loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes, manioc, taro, oysters, fish fillets, whole fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 49 years old and is married with five children aged between 8 and 16 years old. Celestin makes a living by selling a variety of clothes such as: men's clothes and women's clothes. His business is well-organized. Celestin has 4 years of experience. He currently employs one person and his business is open from 7am to 6pm every day except on Sunday.

Celestin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more various types of clothes to sell. With any profits, Celestin hopes to continue reinvesting in his business and to save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more men's and women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Malish

texts.en: R. is currently in business doing photocopying, printing and scanning. She is 35 years old, divorced, with two children and both of them go to school. R. borrowed a loan to stock more machines for photocopying, printing and scanning. She hopes to expand and pay for her children in school in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more machines for photocopying, printing and scanning.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti, a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her husband is a policeman who contributes to his family basic needs. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, Mwanasiti has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She also owns houses which constitute her other source of income. Mwanasiti faces the major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of prospering and establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, cereals and wheat flour for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, cereals and wheat flour.

loans.name: Torype Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este comité inició gracias a la Señora Irmina, quien trabaja vendiendo remedios refrescantes en la Avda. Carlos Antonio López. Ella vive en la zona del Barrio San Miguel de Ciudad del Este y contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
El comité se Denomina “Torype Oñondivepa" y cuenta con 19  integrantes, las integrantes del grupo  se destacan  en el barrio por ser muy unidas y responsables en la comunidad, ya que realizan obras de caridad y actividades para el fondo del grupo. Ellas tienen actividades diferentes  y otras que están emprendiendo una nueva labor y cuentan con un ingreso fijo.
Irmina desea poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y un futuro en el que puedan estudiar y ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
This committee started thanks to Irmina who works selling refreshing remedies on Carlos Antonio López Avenue.  She lives in the San Miguel neighborhood in Ciudad del Este and contacted her friends and neighbors to become part of the area committee.

The committee is called “Torype Oñondivepa” and has 19 members.  The group members stand out in the neighborhood for being very united and responsible in the community since they carry out charitable deeds and activities for the group’s fund.  They have different occupations and some are starting new work and have fixed incomes.

Irmina wants to provide her children with a better quality of life so that in the future they’ll be able to study and become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy herbal remedies or natural medicines to resell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos de 26 y 23 años de edad, él es agricultor desde hace 35 años, desde muy joven aprendió junto a su padre, no tiene un horario fijo, y actualmente iniciara el proceso de siembra de maíz.
Este préstamo le ayudara a adquirir semilla, abono y preparar la tierra, con estos materiales podrá dar inicio a la actividad y producir granos básicos para su familia.
Su objetivo al iniciar cada siembra es obtener una buena cosecha, ayudar a su familia para la alimentación y mejorar las condiciones.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his family, which is his wife and two children, aged 26 and 23 years old. He has been a farmer for 35 years. He learned when he was very young at his father's side. He has no set schedule, and at this time he will begin planting corn.   

This loan will help him acquire seed, ferilizer and to prepare the soil. With these materials, he can begin the activity and produce basic grains for his family. His objective is to have a good harvest, to help his family with food, and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Anarkan's Group

texts.en:
Anarkan, 52, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and resides in the small-populated village of Tup. The children are grown and have their own families. Anarkan has devoted her entire life to raising her kids and being a good housewife. However, the situation changed three years ago when she lost her husband who was the only breadwinner in the family. Since Anarkan had never worked before, she faced the challenge of finding a job to make a living. After long and thorough thoughts, Anarkan decided to sell her apartment and invest the revenue in the purchase of a smaller place to live and in opening a cattle-breeding business. The start-up capital was 30,000 soms and her monthly income is 2,000 soms. Anarkan believes in the further potential of cattle breeding and wants to broaden the business by purchasing two heads of cattle for fattening and reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has three children.

Thamer has owned a farm for rearing calves and cows since 2000. He has a long experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1800 loan to make an external fence. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make an external fence for his farm.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto, tiene la edad de 32 años, está casado y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado por lo cual lo que hará es suministrarle lo necesario para una buena cosecha esta próxima temporada. El quiere obtener de su cafetal mayores resultados y así generar las ganancias para salir adelante con el proyecto y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children who are his highest priorities. He intends to use this loan to buy the necessary supplies for maintaining his coffee crop. His land has already been planted, but he needs to obtain the essentials for achieving a good harvest for next season. Luis wants to achieve better results with his coffee crop so that he can generate income to move forward with his farming project and provide his family a better quality of life.

This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Luis has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for maintaining his coffee crop.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Analie has a food shop that sells dishes like fried chicken & "escabeche". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes & for fruit salads.

Analie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Analie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for preparing dishes & for fruit salads.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Russel has a retail shop that sells party supplies, little toys and accessories. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of toys and party supplies.
Russel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Russel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of toys and party supplies for sale

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en: Sopha, 54 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $5 per day. She has three children, all of whom are working with $3 per day for each. Every month she has to spend $80 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a plot of land for doing farming. In the future, she wants to get a small tailoring shop for her daughter to do at home because she can earn a better income than working in the factory.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for doing farming

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María, tiene cuarenta y siete años de edad, es casada sin hijos
María acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para el mejoramiento de  su casa de habitación, ya que el préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción como es arena, cemento y piedra, para la construcción de un porche  en su casa de habitación ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Todo esto para tener una mejor vivienda y poder gozar de ella.
texts.en:
María is 47, married and has no children. María came to the Ceprodel office to apply for a loan, in order to make improvements to her home. 

She will use the loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement and stone. This is in order to build a new porch for her house, as the existing one is in poor condition.  Her aim is to have a better home to enjoy.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as sand, cement and stone.

loans.name: Kimsrey

texts.en:
Kimsrey (pictured here) and her husband, Khlau, live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons. Two of her sons attend school and one is still too young. 

Kimsrey is a weaver and she also sells mangoes. She buys mango under contract from villagers and when the harvest season comes, she transports them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Kimsrey is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase weaving materials. She will also use a part of the loan to buy mango under contract to sell.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and buy mango under contract

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is 45 years old and divorced with five children, one of whom is in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Dar es Salam branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Cicilia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order more charcoal to sell. She says that the profits from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 33 years old, is married and supports four people. He has been a mixed farmer for the last eight years. He engages in animal trading and also wheat farming.  

He learned about KADET from KADET staff through their marketing efforts. This will be John's first loan, and he is planning to buy more sheep and farm inputs. 

John's business has proven to be doing well in the area due to conducive climate conditions. With the profit he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to expand the business. His hope and dream is to become a prominent businessman in livestock and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and farm inputs.

loans.name: Bethania Group

texts.en:
Esther, who is in her mid 70s, is a widow with six children, but only one stays with her; the rest are independent. 

She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy herself clothes, pay household expenses and increase the food stock, and she has paid back all her loans successfully.  

She wants a loan to expand the place where she sells her food since it was small. Her dream is to one day be able to build herself a good house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Bethania," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To expand the place where she sells her food.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 36 years old. She is married with three children. To earn a living, she sells cereals. She has been in the business for five years. She has employed one person in her business. Even though she runs her business in a competitive environment, she is able to retain her customers because of her good customer care.  

Caroline hopes to expand her business in the future. She has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to build a storage facility and to pay school fees.

loans.use: To build a storage facility and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves, de 45 años es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive en compañía de 2 de sus 4 hijos: Jarol y Julissa a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Chilca. Su sonrisa es muestra de su vitalidad. Ella se dedica a la siembra de productos como papa, olluco y habas una vez al año, pero como desea tener productos de calidad, constantemente los cuida, abona y protege. Agradece a la agricultura, pues le permitió mantener a sus hijos, brindándoles los alimentos del día. Pero como no la ganancia no es estable, decidió incursionar en la costura, donde confecciona prendas de vestir de todo tamaño y calidad, cuenta que gana a las semana un promedio de 150 nuevos soles, pero en navidad, año nuevo y festividad agrícola de Santiago; en donde ella obtiene mejores ganancias. Por ello ahora desea mejorar su calidad de vida, con el arreglo de su casa. Pues sus hijos son todos unos profesionales y necesitan su espacio. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nieves de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en mejorar el material con el que fue construido su casa, por otro más fuerte. Además de un cuarto prefabricado para el taller de su hijo, que es ingeniero civil.
texts.en:
Nieves, 45, is a courageous single mother. She lives with two of her four children, Jarol and Julissa, who she takes care of in her own house, located in the Chilca district.  Her smile shows her vitality. 

She grows products such as potatoes, olluco (root vegetable similar to potato) and lima beans, once a year.  As she wishes to have quality products, she is constantly looking after them, fertilizing and protecting them  She is thankful for farming, as it allowed her to support her children, and provide their daily food. But as these earnings are not steady, she decided to get into sewing, and she makes articles of clothing of every size and quality. 

She says she earns an average of 150 nuevos soles per week, but at Christmas, New Year's, and the Santiago agricultural festival, she gets better earnings. That is why she now wishes to improve her quality of life by repairing her house, since her children are all professionals and need their space. 

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is hoping for your contribution, so that she can make her plans a reality. Moreover, she promises to fulfil her instalment payments. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her association, because all the members are responsible people and very supportive. 

When she receives her loan, Nieves will use the money she has applied for, to improve the material that her house is constructed with, replacing it with another one that is stronger. In addition she will build a room using prefabricated materials, as a workshop for her son, who is a civil engineer.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for repairing her house, and to add a room using prefabricated material.

loans.name: Mae Jean

texts.en:
Mae Jean is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Mae Jean has a computer shop that provides internet and online games. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her internet shop.

Mae Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Mae Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for her internet shop.

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es: Manuela De Jesús trabaja como técnica de estadística en el hospital. Ella tiene dos hijas bajo su cargo de 12 y 16 años. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, bloques, cemento entre otros. Manuela quería realizar estas mejoras desde hace mucho tiempo y por la falta de dinero no había podido obtenerlas. Ella es una mujer responsable y quiere dejarles a sus hijas un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Manuela De Jesús works as a statistical technichian in the hospital.  She has two daughters, ages 12 and 16, under her care.

This loan is to buy construction materials like sand, cement blocks, cement, and others.  Manuela has wanted to make these improvements for a very long time.  She has not been able to do so for lack of money.

She is a responsible woman who wants to leave her daughters a promising future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement blocks, cement, and others.

loans.name: Kulbara

texts.ru: Кулбаре 53 года, замужем, воспитала двоих детей. После развала Советского Союза, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Кулбара начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммы в 26,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство с коровами и баранами приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, она обрабатывает 1,10 га земли, где выращивает картофель и пшеницу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулбара обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку четырех бычков на откорм. Доходы Кулбара планирует вложить в постройку нового сарая в целях обеспечения комфортных условий для содержания скота.
texts.en: Kulbara is 53 years old, married, and has raised two children.  After the collapse of the Soviet Union, she searched for a source of income to provide for her family and started her own animal husbandry and farming business with an initial capital of  26,000 som (KGS). Today, her cow and sheep business, which allows her to sell meat and dairy products, brings about 10,000  som (KGS) per month.  Kulbara also cultivates 1.10 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and wheat. In order to further develop her business, Kulbara has requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from "Bai Tushum and Partners".  This loan will help her purchase four calves for fattening.  Kulbara plans to invest her income in the construction of a new  barn, in order to provide comfortable living conditions for her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
La señora Maria Salome, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco, Departamento del Cusco. Es soltera, tiene 67 años de edad, todos sus hijos son independientes.
La socia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, la socia se encarga de administrar y atender su tienda de abarrotes, la socia suele hacer pedidos y en muchos productos cancela a la quincena, en otros es al contado y asi juega con la mercadería para abastecerse. La socia desea aprovechando las fiestas navideñas invertir en la compra de panetones, vinos, champan, galletas, arroz, azucar, fideos, harinas, leche, chocolates entre otros productos. La socia solicita el prestamo para implementar us tienda de abarrotes. 

 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Salome belongs to the "Nueva Luz del Mañana" communal bank, of the Asociación Arawiwa in Cusco province, Cusco department. She is 67, and single. All her children are living on their own.

The borrower has a small grocery store. She is responsible for running her grocery store, and serving customers. She usually takes orders, and for many products collects every two weeks. For others, she takes payment in cash. This is how she manages to re-stock merchandise. 

She wishes to take advantage of the Christmas holidays to invest in the purchase of fruitcakes, wines, champagne, cookies, rice, sugar, noodles, flour, milk, chocolates and other products. 

The borrower is applying for the loan in order to run her grocery store.

The borrower is grateful for the opportunity she has been given, and promises to make her instalment payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: To run her grocery store.

loans.name: Juste Justice Justesse

texts.fr:
Client de 25 ans, celibataire sans enfant, a la fin de ses etudes universitaires , n'ayant pas trouve du travail et au chômage, il se lance dans la vente de la friperie.
Il est un client très entreprenant et a deja bénéficie de plusieurs prêts, il fait des épargnes considérables et a une historique de remboursement très efficace et ses différents prêts ont apportes beaucoup de succès  pour  l'évolution de son projet .
Avec ce nouveau prêt , il pense  renforcer et agrandir son commerce en ajoutant encore des draps,des couvertures  des ballots de serviettes et peignoirs , des ballots de veste.
Sa stratégie est de fournir a ses clients des produits de bonne qualité , de fin de série et non utilises a des prix abordables.
Il a pour ambition de devenir un grand homme d'affaire et avec ses bénéfices, il pense a se marier  dans peu de temps.
texts.en:
The client, age 25, is single and without children. After completing his university studies, he was unemployed and couldn't find a job, so he started selling secondhand clothing.

He's very entrepreneurial and already benefited from several loans. He puts considerable amounts of money away, and his repayment history is very good. His loans brought in a lot of success to the evolution of his project.

With this new loan, he intends to bolster and expand his business, by adding sheets, blankets, bales of towels and bathrobes, and bales of jackets.

His strategy consists in offering good quality products to his customers, such as end-of-line items at affordable prices.

He ambitions to become a great businessman and, with his profits, he's thinking about getting married in the near future.

loans.use: to buy bales of sheets, towels, bathrobes, blankets, etc

loans.name: Juanita Yadira

texts.es: La señora Juanita Yadira de 33 años es casada y madre de 2 hijos, de los cuales quiere ofrecerles un mejor patrimonio. Hace 5 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social y con ahorros propios fue levantando paredes para una recamara al frente de su vivienda, el capital que tenía ya se le termino y aun le faltan algunas varillas para construir las dalas, de esta manera tener más reforzada la recamara. Para Juanita es muy importante ampliar su casa ya que de esta manera tendrá más espacio.
texts.en: Juanita Yadira, who is 33 years old, is married and the mother of 2 children.  She wants to offer them a better wealth.  Five years ago, she received her home from a social interest group, and with her own savings, she has put up walls for a bedroom in the front of the house.  She has run out of the money that she had, and now she lacks some bars to construct the supports.  This way the bedroom will be more reinforced.  It is very important to Juanita to increase the size of her house so that she will have more space.

loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a baker in Ayensudu near Elmina. She did not have any form of formal education. She bakes bread. She supplies them to retailers both near and far, as well as individuals around her locality. She has been involved in this business for quite some time. Mary is a single mother with three children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her children in paying their school fees and other general expenses. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her bread. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited funding. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more flour, sugar, and a modern oven for the bakery. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to education to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and a modern oven for her bakery.

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en: Sochea, 27, resides in Kampong Cham province where his rice is grown. He struggles for his living via rice farming and grocery selling business. This is not the first loan for Sochea with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid back his past loan completely and now he teams up a group of two to retake a new loan. As the leader, he will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee. He highly believes that he can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Tuấn

texts.en:
Mr Tuấn is 33 years old and he is married.
 
He has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Tuấn lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable . 
His family has a downgraded toilet .
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns his is the latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build toilet.
This is Tuấn first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With his business profit, Tuấn hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build toilet.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
My name is Marcelino B., in my business I sell plastics, market baskets, cups, disposable silverware, bags for wrapping, tablecloths, napkins and other items for four years. My biggest clients are restaurants and canteens. With my earnings, I finance my personal expenses and those of my wife as we no longer have our children in our home.

Descripción del Negocio: Mi nombre es Marcelino B., mi negocio es la venta de plásticos, canastas de mercardo, vasos, platos, cubiertos desechables, bolsas para envolturas, manteles, servilletas y otros desde hace cuatro años. Mis mayores compradores son los restaurantes y comedores. Con las ganancias que obtengo solvento mis gastos personales y de mis esposa ya que no tenemos a cargo hijos.

loans.use: Buying plastic silverware, flowerpot holders, glasses, cups,  plastic cooking items, wastepaper baskets.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro has 6 years of experience in the washing machine rental business. From the age of 12 he worked with his father as a fisherman; later he began to sell fish on his own. He decided to leave the seafood business and began to sell cell phone cards in the street, but the city wouldn't let him work. Finally one day his wife encouraged him to buy a few washing machines and to begin to rent them. He liked the idea and with the money they had saved they bought 4 washing machines in cash and started the business. Currently they have 6 washing machines and 2 tricycles with which they move them from house to house. They work from 7 am to 9 pm every day of the week.

Pedro wants the loan in order to buy himself 2 more washing machines. He has lots of demand that he is currently unable to meet.

Pedro is 32 years old. He is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. His wife works selling shellfish in the morning and in the afternoon she helps with the washing machine business. About six months ago they bought a small house, since they were living with Pedro's mother. In the future they hope to begin to fix it up in order to give their family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcora, Kiva volunteer.

Pedro tiene una experiencia de 6 años en el negocio de alquiler de lavadoras. Antes se dedicaba desde la edad de 12 años a la pesca junto a su padre, luego ya mayor comienza por su cuenta a vender pescado. Decide dejar ese oficio y comienza a vender tarjetas de celulares en las calles pero el municipio de la ciudad no lo dejaba trabajar, hasta que un cierto día su esposa le anima para comprarse unas lavadoras y comenzar a alquilarlas. Le gusto la idea y con un dinero que tenían ahorrado compran al contado 4 lavadoras y comienzan el negocio. Actualmente cuentan con 6 lavadoras y 2 triciclos que son donde las movilizan de un domicilio a otro en horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. todos los días de la semana.

Pedro desea el crédito para poder comprarse unas dos lavadoras mas ya que tiene una demanda muy buena y por el momento no se abastece con las que tiene.

Pedro tiene 32 años, es casado y 3 hijos dos de los cuales ya estudian. Su esposa también trabaja vendiendo mariscos en la mañana y en la tarde le ayuda a el en el negocio. Hace unos seis meses atrás el se compro una casita ya que vivía con su mama, y a futuro espera comenzar arreglarla para darle mejor vida a su familia.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy more washing machines for his business

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a farmer with a lot of experience. He has bred livestock and worked the land since his childhood. He has over 10 hectares of land. He also has livestock worth a total of $1300. This year he decided to plant 1 hectare of onions and over 5 hectares of wheat. This is his first loan. He became a member of the solidarity group “Obron” to get a loan from MicroInvest. The group chose him to be its accountant. He is responsible for collecting payments and bringing them to MicroInvest on time. He will use the loan for fertilizers and fodder for his livestock.

In future he wants to expand his production and grow melons and watermelons of good quality.

loans.use: Improving working conditions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her Fruit Business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet Egieda is 27 years old, and happily married with 3 children.  She resides in Illushi village in Edo State.  She sells food items to her community and has been in this business for 4 years.  She hopes to buy more food stuffs to sell with the above funds.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a hairdresser. She needs $300 to buy a new hairdryer and some winter clothing that she can sell to her clients. She is a 24 year old woman who lost her mother and has been trying alone to make ends meet ever since.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer and winter clothing

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Mrs. Beauty A. lives in Benin City with her husband and 3 children. She is 41 years old. Beauty sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has 2 years of experience in this business.

Beauty is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more provisions & foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Jorge Mario

texts.es:
Jorge is a young, single man. He works selling cell phones and accessories, and has been on this business for more than 5 years. He gets his products depending on orders previously made by his customers. He has a small working capital.

Competition in this activity is high, because there are many people offering cell phones. However, the demand for these products is similarly high, so Jorge is not out of work. In addition, he has secured a clientele by offering them good quality products and punctuality in filling out his customer's orders.

The merchandise he buys is all related to cell phones, like cell phone covers, cases, parts, phones, and so on. The prices vary depending on the competition.

This is his fourth loan during his time with this institution, and he has demonstrated to be responsible with his payments. Although he has been late with payments occasionally on his last loan, he quickly regularized his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge es una persona joven y sin compromisos conyugales, se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, cuenta con una experiencia en este negocio de más de cinco años. Entrega los productos de acuerdo a pedidos que le hacen anticipadamente los clientes, cuenta con su pequeño capital de trabajo.

La competencia en este rubro es alta, ya que existen bastantes ofertantes de celulares pero paralelamente la demanda también es elevada, por lo que a Jorge no le falta trabajo, además de que él consolido a sus clientes ofreciendoles calidad y puntualidad en la entrega de los productos.

La mercaderia que compra son todas referidas a los celulares; como ser carcasas para celulares, fundas, estuches, repuestos, celulares y otros. Los precios fluctuan de acuerdo a la competencia que exista. Este es el cuarto crédito que ha sacado el cliente, en ese tiempo de relación con la Institución ha demostrado ser una persona responsable en sus pagos, si bien cuenta con algunos atrasos en su ultimo crédito los mismos fueron regularizados a la brevedad.

loans.use: Buying merchandise, cell phones and accessories (Compra de mercadería accesorios y otros)

loans.name: Loko

texts.fr:
Loko Z., age 33, is married and is responsible for five children. Agriculture remains his primary work. He grows corn, cassava, and sweet potatoes. Since the soil is poor and not conducive to agriculture, he often brings in yields too small to enable him to meet basic family needs. To improve his income, he is requesting a loan of $300 to buy fertilizer. This will better allow him to meet customer demands and to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur Z. Loko est marié et a en charge cinq (5) enfants. L’agriculture reste sa principale activité. Il cultive du maïs, du manioc, et de la patate douce. Les sols étant pauvres et défavorables à l’agriculture, il enregistre souvent des rendements qui ne lui permettent pas de subvenir aux besoins fondamentaux de sa famille. Pour améliorer son revenu, il sollicite un financement de $300 pour s’acheter de l’engrais et accroître la fertilité de ses sols. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his soil

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es:
Mrs. María Vilma O. A. is a member of the Communal Bank of “San Juan de Miraflores,” a bank formed in the township of Cuyuchugo in the district of Usquil of the Otuzco province of the state of La Libertad. Ever since her marriage she and her husband have sold pork and mutton to the restaurants of Usquil, Otuzco, Julcan and other cities.

With her first loan of S/. 300.00 ($100.00) Maria purchased chickens. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 ($350.00), which will be repaid if four months, Maria will purchase a lamb, a pig, and a few chickens.

Maria Vilma is 44 years old and has 3 children. Despite the fact that she only completed 5th grade she has been able to succeed for her children. She is very proud to be able to assist her husband and to contribute to the economic maintenance of the home.

Maria’s great dream is to own a store in Otuzco in which she could sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Vilma O. A. es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Miraflores” formado en el caserío de Cuyuchugo, en el distrito de Usquil, provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad.

El negocio al que se ha dedicado siempre desde que se unió con su cónyuge es la venta de carne de chancho y carnero la que distribuye por los restaurantes de Usquil, Otuzco, Julcán y otros.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 compró animales tales como, gallinas y pollos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses comprará un carnero, un chancho y una java de pollos.

La señora Maria Vilma tiene 44 años y 3 hijos. A pesar que solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y se siente muy satisfecha de apoyar a su esposo y aportar a la economía del hogar.

Su mayor sueño es tener un puesto en Otuzco en donde pueda ofrecer su mercadería

loans.use: Purchase of a lamb, a pig, and a few chickens.

loans.name: Ninh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ninh Thi M., 47 years old, joined TYM Fund since 1999. She lives with her husband and two grown-up children in Yen Dong, Y Yen (Vietnam). Before joining TYM Fund, Mrs. M.'s life is very difficult because she only has a small farmland and her income is very low. Mrs. M. used her loans to breed pigs. Each year she earned a profit of some hundred dollars. In 2003, Mrs. M. started to carve wood for manufacturers who produce chairs and tables. She often get the orders and then buy wood to carve the specific design that the manufacturers wanted. The job is not easy, yet it brings pretty high income to her family. On average, each month she earns about 170-200USD. This time she wants to borrow 400USD to buy wood to carve.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Ninh Thị Mỹ, 47 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1999. Chị sống cùng chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành tại Yên Đồng, Ý Yên. Trước khi vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn nhiều khó khăn do ruộng ít, thu nhập thấp. Chị Mỹ vay vốn về đầu tư cho chăn nuôi lợn. Sau mỗi năm chị thu được một khoản lợi nhuận vài trăm USD. Đến năm 2003, chị chuyển sang nghề trạm trổ đồ gỗ cho các cơ sở làm bàn ghế. Chị Mỹ thường nhận đơn đặt hàng sau đó mua gỗ về chế tác theo yêu cầu của khách. Công việc đục đẽo cũng vất vả nhưng mang lại thu nhập tương đối cao. Bình quân một tháng chị Mỹ thu từ 170-200USD. Vòng vốn này chị tiếp tục xin vay 400USD về mua gỗ làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Estwida's Tsunami Group

texts.en:
Estwida is a 28 years old married woman with one child who is eight years old. Estwida owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.
In the past, Estwida has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sofia and Halima, who have businesses dealing in market sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea T. makes Khmer cakes and sells them at the market. He uses a machine to mix the cake ingredients. The majority of his cakes are made from rice and flour, which are normally favorable for his customers. Recently, his machine broke and he now has to manually mix his cakes.

His wife, Seang Ath, is the mother of their four children. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. After the house work, she plants a variety of vegetables which she sells, earning less than one dollar per day of profit. One child works digging a well in the village and makes about $100 a month.

Mr. Phea T. would like a loan to fix the cake-making machine which recently broke. The machine is very important for his family because if the machine cannot operate, there is minimal income for his family.

loans.use: To repair a cake-making  machine.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
For the past 12 years, Cesar Augusto S. has been working in his welding workshop, which he tends to very cordially in his home in the city of Chinandega in the municipality of Somotillo.

He has been remodeling his workshop little by little with the passing of time, and has made investments to improve his business’ conditions and the living standards of his family, which consists of his wife and two small children.

Today, he looks for support from Ceprodel to receive a loan to make improvements to his workshop by expanding it to offer better conditions to his customers. For this reason, he trustingly waits for his loan to be granted to continue with the success of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años el señor Cesar Augusto S. se dedica a trabajar en su taller de soldadura atendido muy cordialmente por él mismo en su propia casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en el municipio de Somotillo.

El taller lo ha venido remodelando poco a poco a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido y ha venido realizando inversión para mejorar las condiciones del negocio y la de su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos pequeños hijos.

Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para el mejoramiento del taller por medio de la ampliación del local para brindar mejores condiciones a sus clientes. Por esta razón es que espera confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Expand his welding workshop to offer his customers better conditions.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarollo- Group 2

texts.en:
Josephina K. A. has a very open and welcoming personality and loves to laugh. She lives in a small town in Samana called Las Galeras. She is the mother of four children, ages 11, 15, 16, and 19. All of them live with her except her eldest. In her spare time, she enjoys music and going to the nearby beach.

She owns a business, selling materials for shoemaK. and other products such as perfumes. The loan will be used to buy materials and the other items she sells. Ms. K. A. has been worK. with Esperanza for 2 ½ years. She was able to start her business with the help of loans she acquired. She is currently worK. out of a small wooden house. In the future she hopes to have a larger establishment maD. of stone that can withstand the weather.

Ms. Josephina K. A. is part of a 6 person group (Group 2) that is part of a 35 person micro-bank called Fuente para el Desarollo, or Fountain for Development in English. In the picture, she is in the middle with a white sleeveless shirt. The others are group members or members of their micro-bank.

Ms. A.'s story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of Esperanza micro-credit loans. This group has united with a common vision of a better life through faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. Each of the associates in this bank have a similar business whether it is selling shoemaK. materials or operating a taxi service. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase shoe material and the perfumes (Avon) to be sold

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Né à Agomé Tomégbé en 1978, Madame S.  Akossiwa a très tôt abandonné ses études pour se lancer dans la culture de produits de maraichage afin de mieux subvenir à ses besoins. Mariée à sieur et mère de six (6) enfants, elle contribue énormément aux charges du foyer. elle sollicite un crédit qui va l’aider à renforcer son activité et son revenu dans le but de subvenir efficacement aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Born in Agomé Tomégbé in 1978, Mrs. Akossiwa S. had to leave her studies at a young age to begin market gardening so as to support herself. Married and the mother of 6 children, she makes a big contribution toward supporting the family. She is asking for this loan that will allow her to bolster her business with the goal of efficiently contributing to meeting the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: market gardening

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van O. was born in 1973, and she is a villager in Prey Chheu Teal Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Taing Sophat, is a construction worker who can earn $2.50 per day, which it is very little income to support his family. Although Mrs. Van O. and her husband both have businesses, they still cannot support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Van O. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Van O. is 35 years old and the mother of five children – one of whom is a construction worker, while another three are attending school. The youngest one is three years old and too young to work or study. Mrs. Van O.’s husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Gardeny

texts.es:
La señora Gardeny, socia del Banco Comunal “Alfonso Ugarte”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Es cosmetóloga y dicta clases en una academia de cosmetología, también vende productos de belleza y sus clientes son sus amigos, familiares y alumnas de la academia a quienes les vende lo que ellos requieran para realizar sus prácticas.
 
Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, lociones, etc., también tintes, tijeras, líquido para realizar los trabajos de rizados y otros materiales que se requiere en la cosmetología.

Gardeny tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su hijo quien le da fortalezas para seguir  trabajando. Su meta es contar con un local para implementar su propio salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Gardeny is a member of the "Alfonso Ugarte" community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin in the district of Tarapoto. She is a cosmetologist and she gives classes at a cosmetology college. She also sells beauty products to her friends, family and students from the academy. She sells to her students so that they can set up their businesses.

With this loan amounting to S/.1000, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase beauty products that are currently on sale such as perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, deodorants, fashion jewlery, nail polish, lotions etc. She will also purchase hair dyes, scissors, and streaking treatments and other materials she needs for her work in cosmetology.

Gardeny is 27 years old and she is a single Mom. Her son gives her the strength to keep working. Her goal is to set up a small store where she can have her own beauty salon.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This 39-year-old Agnes M. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of seven and 17. Agnes has been running a clothes business since 1999. She sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method and has its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is an expressive textile: the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. In addition, Agnes runs a tailoring business where she can sew those fabrics purchased in her store to the specifications of her customers. She works at this business for six hours per day, 12 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Agnes currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase another sewing machine. Agnes thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. is a tailor. She sews various designs for her customers. She also sells tailoring materials. Helen is married to a carpenter and they have 5 children. She is 50 years old. The demands are high for her tailoring materials, such as thread, zips, tailor chalk, and needles. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Helen says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.en:
The Gotitas D. Amor (“Little Drops of Love”) Village Bank is a new group that is just starting out with fifteen members, who after weeks of training are very happy to get started.  The group members are involved in a variety of businesses: they sell cell phones, bread, cakes, vegetables, firewood, plastics, clothing for children and adults, grains, and catalog cosmetics. The group members sell from home, on delivery, on the street and in several of the city’s markets.  They are each requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 600 or 750 soles. The group is requesting a total of 5,700 soles.  Group members will use their loans to buy carrots, onions, firewood, bags, t-shirts, sweaters, blouses, wheat, barley and corn.  The group members dream of owning their own homes, of expanding their businesses, of providing their children with all the best and a good education. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Gotitas D. Amor es un Banco Nuevo que recién inicia con 15 socias, quienes después D. semanas D. capacitación inician con mucha alegría. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. celulares, panes, pasteles, verduras, leñas, plásticos, ropa para adultos y niños, cereales, cosméticos por catálogos Sus ventas los realizan en sus domicilios, reparten a domicilio, ambulantemente y en algunos mercados D. la ciudad. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles  haciendo un total D. 5,700 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.
Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. zanahoria, cebolla, leña, bolsas, polos, chompas, blusas, trigo, cebada, maíz. 
Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, ampliar sus negocios, brindar a sus hijos todo lo mejor, buena educación.

loans.use: Buy carrots, onions, firewood, bags, t-shirts, sweaters, blouses, wheat, barley and corn

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa B. is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children – two girls and a boy. Two of her children are in the basic school at the moment. The last-born is still being breast-fed. She lives together with her children and husband in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Theresa’s husband is a commercial driver. He conveys goods and passengers between Offinso and Kumasi, the regional capital. Theresa works to help her husband provide for the family. She is a fish-monger. She sells on a small table top in the market square. She procures her goods from big-time fish-mongers in Kumasi who sell at wholesale prices.

Theresa has been in business for four years. According to her, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy smoked fish in bulk to make more profit. She hopes to expand her business by trekking to nearby towns to do business.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Adelakun

texts.en:
Adelakun S. runs a beautfy salon. In her salon, she also has a deep freezer, from which she sells drinks to her cutomers.

She gives her customers lovely hair styles.

Adelakun S. now needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase two hair dryers for her salon. She would also like to purchase crates for the drinks that she sells.

She is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase two hair dryers and crates of drinks for her beauty salon

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La venta de especies es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Candida D. en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama que a raíz de su necesidad económica ha buscado la forma de cómo llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de las especies  ya que requiere de estos productos para continuarlos ofertando en su establecimiento en el mercado Central de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Selling spices is the business that Mrs. Candida D. has in the Chinandega city Central market. She is a woman who as a result of economic necessity has looked for a way to support her home. It is important to note that today she has approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy the spices that she requires to continue offering them in her establishment in the Chinandega Central market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spices

loans.name: Sergiu

texts.en:
Sergiu P. grows vegetables, like radishes in greenhouses. He has five years experience.

He requests the loan to purchase seeds of tomato and spare parts for automobile repair.

Sergiu has one swine, one cow and a calf, In the future, he plans to increase the number of animals.

loans.use: Purchase seeds of tomato and spare parts for automobile repair..

loans.name: Roland

texts.es: Roland tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres. Se dedica al alquiler de equipos de sonido para eventos sociales y musicales, esto lo viene haciendo desde hace 3 años de manera independiente. Todos los días atiende su  establecimiento donde siempre alquila pidiendo como garantía el documento de identidad del contratante. Sus  equipos son constantemente revisados y los mantiene en perfecto estado para brindar un buen servicio. Roland está siempre alerta ante las nuevas innovaciones que puedan salir en equipos y aunque muchas veces los precios son altos, se esfuerza para ahorrar de sus ganancias hasta adquirir ese nuevo equipo. Para más adelante está pensando en mejorar su local para que tenga una mejor apariencia. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él es uno de los más jóvenes integrantes de su banco comunal, quien transmite buena energía para hacer bien las cosas y se siente muy a gusto de ser parte de ese equipo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de nuevos parlantes valorizados en 1500 soles, lo que falta del monto del préstamo, él pondrá de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Roland is 26 years old, is single and lives with his parents. He rents out sound equipment for social events and concerts. He has been doing this independently for 3 years. Everyday he runs his shop where he always rents while asking for identification from the contracting party. His equipment are constantly checked and he keeps them in perfect condition, in order to offer good service. Roland is always aware of new innovations in equipment and often the prices are high. He is working to save the earnings to acquire this new equipment. For the future, he is thinking of improving his location, in order to have a better appearance. It's the second time that he has had a loan with MFP. He is one of the youngest involved in his community bank. He transmits good energy to do good things, and feels enthusiastic to be part of the team. The money that he is asking for is for the purchase of new speakers for 1500 soles, which he lacks and is the total of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new speakers

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 1 hijo, vive en el Jr. Cristo Rey barrio Alianza y cuenta con estudios de segundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio, ella venda carne de ganado vacuno.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de productos para su negocio, comprará carne de ganado vacuno.  Su mayor deseo es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Delia is a member of the Manuela Ramos Bank in the district of Mazocruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 23 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She lives in Jr. Cristo Rey in the Alianza neighborhood. She has completed secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 1 year and began with a loan of 300 new soles, which allowed her to increase the capital for her business. She sells cattle meat. At present, she needs a new loan in the amount of 500 new soles. This loan will allow her to buy more products for her business. She will buy cattle meat. She biggest dream is to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle meat

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. makes a living running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Teresita is 51 years old, married and has one adult child. She is from the village of Clarin. Teresita has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living conditions and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
T. Tràn Thị (1816071344) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has one school-aged child.

T. owns and operates a business providing medicinal services to local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 4th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia E., 38, is married with 4 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the ice cake business.  She sells to the public 6 days per week.  She has 1 previous loans with SPBD.  Telesia expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Telesia’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase cordials, plastic cups,freezer.

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 28-year-old married man with one child. He has been working in the trade of sanitary products since 2002 with a previous seventeen years of experience in the field.

Today, Yasser is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy an electric machine specified for his job in order to expand his work after his long experience in the field.

loans.use: To buy an electric machine for his business

loans.name: Farhad Group

texts.en:
Farhad is the leader of Farhad Group. There are four members in this group. Each of them requests a loan to make progress in their businesses and make their businesses larger. Farhad requests a loan for his general store. Seveta and Zarghna request a loan for the business of tailoring. Jawad requests a loan for his taxi service. 

They are requesting a group loan of 20,000 AFN and they are very happy with this process of obtaining a loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses (general store, tailoring and taxi service)

loans.name: Mary   Fe

texts.en:
Mary Fe A. is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old. Mary Fe is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Fe owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Mary Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Fe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Layli

texts.es:
Layli tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo, quien es agricultor y cultiva la palma aceitera, tienen 3 hijos que vienen cursando estudios primarios. Ella se levanta muy temprano para ir al puerto fluvial pesquero donde compra pescado salado, inmediatamente después coge otro bote para viajar una hora, río arriba, hacia un caserío llamado “Mashangay”, donde vende los pescados o los cambia con otros productos como plátanos, yucas u otras cosas, los cuales al regresar vende. En esta actividad ya tiene un periodo de un año y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es apreciar el paisaje cuando viaja por el río, además aprender nuevas costumbres de los poblados que visita. Por ello, Layli está muy contenta, pues la venta de sus productos le brinda las ganancias suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y menciona que lo que más le agrada de su banco comunal es que todos trabajan organizadamente y no tienen problemas de falta de pago. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más pescado para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila A. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, widowed and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Sheila owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling used clothing ("ukay-ukay") and doormats in the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sheila joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes and cooking oil to sell. Keji is 20 years old and is married to a clerk. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
At the age of 54, Yolanda is already widowed. She is now all by herself in providing for her family. Her partner now is her business, which supports her family in their everyday expenses. Her two children (Abigail, 31 years old, and Lea, 28 years old) now have their own families. Yolanda is now a grandmother who wants only for her grandchildren to finish their studies, unlike their mothers. That is why she does everything just to improve her business that has been her partner for many years.

Yolanda's business is the selling of different kinds of plastic and Styrofoam. She has run this business for 10 years now, and she continues to run it with the help of added capital from a loan that she received in Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) after joining that organization in 2000. Because she used the loan properly, she has already expanded the store into a much bigger one than before. Now she wants another loan to buy the things she needs in her business so that it will grow more.

Yolanda's dream is not for herself anymore, but for her grandchildren--for them to finish their studies so they can have a better life in the future. She plans to make her business continue to grow so that she will help her grandchildren with their educational expenses.

loans.use: For additional capital

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela B. is a 40-year old entrepreneur living in Norala, South Cotabato. She started with little capital in the amount of 2,500 PHP for her sari-sari (retail) store in 2007. After all her efforts to make her business bigger, she was able to provide for the financial needs of her five children, sending them to school.

She needs additional capital in the amount of 18,000 PHP as a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to buy groceries for her store and make it more productive.

loans.use: Groceries

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita G. is from the village of Hubangon, Mahinog Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Tita is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Tita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Tita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Tita is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Tita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the  education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband teaches in a government school and he also helps to support their family. She sells used clothes. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to gain more profits. She says her business is expanding and is looking forward to having a bigger stall in the future. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
El señor Arístides Martínez A. se dedica a la venta de truchas tales como: reloj cadenas radios controles de tv ofreciéndolos en el Mercado el mayoreo Managua.
Solicita un crédito en ceprodel para la compra de productos para la venta en los que se encuentran: reloj cadenas radios controles de tv entre otros.
Inicio en este negocio desde hace 18 años vendiendo en una acera ahora el tiene su propio local el cual le es mas rentable.
Es importante destacar que el señor Arístides es viudo
Y no tiene hijos. Su record crediticio con ceprodel a sido de 24 créditos el cual a demostrado una buena capacidad de pago
texts.en:
Mr. Aristides Martínez A. sells items such as: watches, chains, radios, and tv remote controls for a living at the wholesale market in Managua. He requests a loan with Ceprodel to buy products to be resold such as: watches, chains, radios, tv remote controls, among others. He began this business 18 yeas ago selling on the sidewalk and now he has his own premises which makes business more profitable.

It is important to point out that Mr. Aristides is a widower and has no children. He has had 24 loans with Ceprodel and has repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tv remote controls, watches, chains, radios

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
Elvera A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old, is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elvera owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elvera has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvera joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elvera is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan which Elvera has taken out  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Couronne Plus Group

texts.en:
“Couronne Plus” is a group of 32 owners of small businesses chaired by Patience. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Patience sells lamp oil and clothes. She became a micro entrepreneur in 2004, in the southeast province. She has already received two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy 10 liters of lamp oil. Currently she earns a profit of $120. Patience is 41 years old, married and the mother of eight children aged 4 to 22. All of them attend school.

loans.use: To purchase 10 liters of lamp oil and some clothes to resell in order to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
La señora María de Lourdes R., vive en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, en el Estado de México; es casada  y tiene 4 hijos, la mayor tiene 14 años de ahí sigue el otro de 4 años, después otro de 2 años y el mas pequeño tiene apenas 2 meses de nacido; ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en casa por casa, anteriormente era el esposo que se dedicaba al comercio debido a que los gastos en la familia se han incrementado la señora María de Lourdes desde hace 2 años se dedica al comercio, su necesidad es la compra de un puesto armable para vender sus productos, ya que actualmente lo hace con un triciclo en donde embolsa por kilo las frutas y verduras y es como realiza su venta, con las ganancias que genere ella lo quiere ahorrar porque en donde vive es de familiares, y sus hijos están creciendo y no cuenta con una vivienda que sea propio; por esa razón apoya a su esposo con los gastos para que juntos puedan lograr ahorrar y dejarle a sus hijos un patrimonio.
A ella la invita una amiga que se llama Chuy a que se integre al grupo de Sol naciente en donde pueden ahorrar y a la vez recibir crédito a través de Fundación Realidad y pueda cumplir sus expectativas de vida como cada una de las integrantes del grupo y solicitar dicho crédito.
Las personas que integran el grupo son:
Ma Cristina G. Hernández  vende abarrotes.
Catalina Jiménez M. vende antojitos.
María de Lourdes R. Jiménez vende frutas  y verduras(en la foto esta cargando un bebe).
Jesus González A. vende productos por catalogo.
Rita Hernández Guzmán vende productos por catalogo.
Erika Ramírez vende artículos de bonetería y mercería.
Dulce María R. Jiménez vende lencería por catalogó.
Martha B. Ramírez Hernández vende dulces.
Marco Antonio B. González Tiene un puesto de música.
María De Los Ángeles Limón C. vende dulces.
texts.en:
Señora María de Lourdes R. lives in the community of Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, in the state of México. She is married and has four children, the oldest is 14 years old and from there her other is 4, the next is 2, and the youngest is just 2 months old. She works selling fruits and vegetables house by house. Before it was her husband who worked commercially in order to meet the expenses of the family, which had increased. Señora María de Lourdes has for two years worked selling door to door. She needs to buy a transportable way to carry the products she sells. She has made due with a tricycle where she loads kilos of fruits and vegetables to make her sales. With the income she generates, she wants to save because she lives with her relatives, and her children are growing and she wants to give them a place to live that is their own. Because of this, she is helping her husband with the expenses so that together they can save and leave their children an inheritance.
