She is inviting her friend Chuy, who is part of the group Sol Naciente, where she can save and at the same time receive a loan from Fundación Realidad so she can complete her goals for life, like one of the members of the group, asking for the said credit. The people who make up the group are: Ma Cristina G. Hernández who sells groceries. Catalina Jiménez M. who sells typical Mexican snacks. María de Lourdes R. Jiménez who sells fruits and vegetables (in the photo, she is carrying a baby). Jesus González A. who sells products by catalog. Rita Hernández Guzmán who sells products by catalog. Erika Ramírez who sells clothing articles and merchandise. Dulce María R. Jiménez who sells lingerie by catalog. Martha B. Ramírez Hernández who sells sweets. Marco Antonio B. González who has a music stand. María De Los Ángeles Limón C. who sells sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to buy fruits and vegetables, Mexican snacks, clothing, and women's items.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Melsie

texts.en:
Melsie G. is from the village of San Antonio in the Talakag municipality of Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Melsie is married and has three young children. To make a living, Melsie owns and operates a retail business. The main source of income for her retail business comes from selling soft drinks, dairy products, and shampoo. She also operates a clothing business. She sells ready-to-wear clothing and slightly used clothing to local community members. Melsie has been engaged in her business for over five years, and she earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products for sale. Melsie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the second loan taken out by Melsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mrs. Yoeng Yorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 10 people who are villagers in Pou Ta Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yoeng Y. is the village bank president. She was selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who rents a small piece of land to grow vegetables to sell to support her family. Aside from this, she is also a farm laborer and her husband, Mr. Da Phorn, is a chef. Through this activity, the couple supports six children. Two of the children are laborers and the others are enrolled in the local public school. In order to improve her vegetable production, Mrs. Yoeng Y. decided to ask for a loan to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To grow vegetables

loans.name: Fetersonia

texts.en: Only 22 years old, Fetersonia is the mother of a two-year-old child. She is married to Abgel, who goes out to the sea to fish, and she sells everything he catches. She goes around her community to sell fish and dries some to sell as well. She applied to Community Economic Ventures, Inc to gain access to its financial services. She asks for a loan of PHP 6,000, which she will use to buy fish nets and other fishing materials. She says that receiving this loan will be truly helpful as she hopes to have more fish to sell so she could also earn more.

loans.use: Fish nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Mrs. Vy S. is 46 years old. She is a villager who lives in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she also breeds pigs at home. In order to support her pig business, Mrs. Vy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy ten piglets and pig food for pig breeding. Her husband, Mr. Pharng Ros, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other three are students.

loans.use: To buy ten piglets and pig food

loans.name: Terry's Group

texts.en:
Terry U. is from the village of Danlugan in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Terry is the leader of a 3-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Terry is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Terry sells fresh fish in the local community. Terry has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Terry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Terry is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to use as additional capital. This will be Terry's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to meet her family's daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel C. is from the village of Tipolo Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Russel is married and has one adult child. This picture was taken near the office; this is not on her business site but the account officer confirmed that she has a retail store selling clothing and shoe products.  Russel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 400 Philippine pesos PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Russel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

Russel is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase additional products to sell.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna P. is a 52 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in food vending. She lives in Habitat Homes, Talisay City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 3 school aged children.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.

Edna is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she could use it as an additional working capital for food vending. This will be her 19th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Edna aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Francisco Segundo

texts.es:
Francisco Segundo S. S. tiene 40 años.  Es soltero y vive con sus 2 hijos, Flor Maria (18) y Neiser (10), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Francisco es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Francisco trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, maíz y habas. Trabaja también en la ganadería, tiene 3 vacas. Realiza sus compras en Guaranda y hace sus ventas cada mes en Guaranda también. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaca de leche para hacer queso. Piensa que el crédito le ayudara a comprar la vaca para aumentar su ganadería y su producción de leche. Su sueño es enviar sus hijos a la Universidad. Enfrenta problemas de salud en la familia. 

Le gusta jugar fútbol y voleibol.
texts.en:
Francisco Segundo S. S. is a 40-year-old single man who lives with his 2 children, Flor Maria (18) and Neiser (10), in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province.

Francisco is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is the group's first loan from the San José cooperative.

Francisco grows potatoes, corn, and broad beans for a living. He is also a cattle farmer who owns 3 cows. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells his products there every month.

He is requesting this loan in order to purchase a dairy cow so that he can start making cheese. He thinks that this loan will help him obtain the cow so that he can increase his cattle farm and his milk production. His dream is to be able to send his children to the university. There exist some health problems within his family.

He likes to play soccer and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cow for cheese production

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Samba Ka Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BABACAR SAMB. K. est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 29 femmes issues toutes du même village. Elles ont monté leur groupe par voisinage et affinité.

Madame Fatou L., mise en médaillon, tout à fait en haut à droit de la photo est responsable du Groupe de Solidarité. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants et a la charges des 07 enfants de sa co-épouse décédée. 

Elle faisait de la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Mais avec ce nouveau prêt elle envisage faire de l'embouche ovine. 

Elle va acheter deux moutons qu'elle compte emboucher pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans le marché de son village.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans le prise en charge de la famille surtout pour la nourriture.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Babacar SamB. K. Solidarity Group was created on December 30, 2009. There are 29 women in the group, all of whom are from the same village. They formed a solidarity group because they live near each other and have similar interests. Mrs. Fatou L., inset, is the leader of the Solidarity Group. She is 44 years old and married with two children of her own. She also cares for the 7 children of her deceased co-wife. Mrs. L. used to make peanut oil, but with this new loan she hopes to pasture fatten sheep for market. She will buy two sheep that she plans to fatten for at least 5 months before selling them in her village's market. Her goal is to help her husband meet the needs of the family, especially for food.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sheep to fatten for market

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn C. is 28 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is from the village of Bayabo East located in the municipality of Tumauini in Isabela province on the islands of Luzon. Jonalyn sells vegetables to the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jonalyn joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Jonalyn is requesting her first loan from ASKI of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional produce to sell. She plans to use all revenue generated from the business to pay school tuition fees for her child.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional produce to sell

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur S. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 42 years old. Arthur is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Arthur owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen and selling vegetables in the community. Arthur is just starting this business.

In 2010, Arthur joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arthur is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arthur from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia se dedica a la cría D. ganado vacuno cuya producción D. leche la venD. a Pil Andina (Planta industrializadota  D. leche), vive junto a su  esposo el cual trabaja como albañil y sus hijos los cuales están en edad escolar. Es el primer  crédito en Impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Lidia earns her living by raising cows and selling the milk to PIL Andina, an industrial milk plant. She lives with her husband who is a bricklayer and their school-aged children. This is her first loan with both Impro and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Dukoreshamaboko Yacu Group

texts.fr:
Harindintwali Razar, née à Rubavu, province d’Ouest du Rwanda en 1970, il est célibataire, son niveau éducationnel est primaire. Il vit Rabavu. Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé DUKORESHAMABOKO YACU,  qui est un groupe solidaire dont les membres sont  les maçons et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Razar et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervaux pour leurs enfants pour ceux qui en possèdent, Razar, lui il est maçon. En fait, le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Bankings.a pour acheter des formes destiné a la fabrication des blocs ciment et claustras utilisé en construction des maisons, une partie du profit sera réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour le bon future.


au
texts.en:
Harindintwali Razar was born in Rubavu, the Western province of Rwanda, in 1970. He is single. He finished primary school. He lives in Rubavu. He belongs to a solidarty group named Dukoreshamaboko Yacu, whose members are masons guaranteeing each other’s loans. Razar and his group work in order to support their families and offer them better life conditions, including payment of school fees for those members who have children. Razar is a masons himself. The group has taken out a loan from Amasezerano Community Bankings to purchase block forms in order to manufacture concrete blocks and parturitions used in building houses. A part of the profits will be reinvested in order to maintain the financial stability of the group as well as put away in savings to prepare for a better future.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing block forms to manufacture concrete blocks and partitions

loans.name: Meresel

texts.en:
Meresel C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Meresel owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Meresel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month ftom it.

In 2009, Meresel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meresel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Meresel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Meresel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: This is 30 year-old Mariatu. She is married and has three children ages 12, 10 and 8. Mariatu established her used clothing business because she wanted a means of bringing in income to help her husband support their children. Her business is open 7 days a week, 11 hours a day. Mariatu has a very good credit history. She needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy more used clothing for her business. Mariatu intends to use the proceeds of this loan to educate her children and provide a better life for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for her business

loans.name: Mercy Ekua

texts.en: Mercy Ekua F. sells foodstuffs at Elmina. Mercy has been through junior high school. Her husband is a trader. She is asking to use the loan to buy more of the food items that are very often requested at her shop. She anticipates reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more popular food items to sell.

loans.name: Febie

texts.en:
Febie P. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old. Febie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Febie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, vinegar and soy sauce in pouches, junk food, and fish paste in bottles, in the local community. Febie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Febie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Febie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Febie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Febie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Jane Njeri

texts.en:
Jane Njeri W. is a 28 years old single lady, she supports a family of four brothers and sisters. She runs a clothes selling business in Eldama Ravine town that she started six years ago and she gets an average income of Kshs 30,000 per month.

Jane has borrowed a loan of Kshs in the past. This 60,000 requests being her second loan with Kadet Ltd. She intends to use Kshs 35,000 to purchase new clothes and Kshs 25,000 for Second hand cloths.
 
She anticipates in using the profits from the business to build her plot and buy a farm. She dreams to have a family and be able to provide for her children and also give them the best education possible.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase stock

loans.name: Krishna Maiya

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Krishna Maiya D.. She is married and has two children, ages 35 and 30. In 2004, she established her grocery store. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop. In the future, Krishna Maiya plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan is administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and married with three children. She is a member of the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Ana’s business is raising chickens, guinea pigs, and rabbits. She plans on investing her loan in the purchase of more animals and food. Ana is very happy with her loan and is committed to making full and on-time payments.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie C. is from the village of Mangga. He is 28 years old. Jessie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jessie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jessie from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señoa. Martha T. es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive en la comunidad de Shisquing en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y cordial.

La Señora. Martha tiene 29 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 14, 12, 9 y 6 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como aserrador y tienen su casa  propia  que  fue construida con el sacrificio y trabajo conyugal.

Doña Martha se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar ya que tiene que estar al cuidado de su familia, en su casa  cría gallinas y cuyes  que los vende cuando tiene  alguna necesidad  y también son para su consumo. Ella también le ayuda a su esposo en el aserradero.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 6 años y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el negocio de su esposo, van a comprar  un bosque para preparar la madera y luego venderla en los depósitos. 

Su meta es darles a sus hijos una buena educación  para que se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha T. is a member of the Más que Vencedoras [More than Winners] community bank. She lives in the community of Shisquing in the city of Azogues. This city is known for its beauty, which is a mixture of colonial and modern. Its people are kind and cordial. 

Martha is 29 years old, married and has 4 children aged 14, 12, 9 and 6. Her two oldest children are in high school and the youngest are in an elementary school in town. Her husband works as a sawyer and they own their own house built with the couple's hard work and sacrifice.  

Martha works in the home and she has to take care of her family. In her house she raises chickens and guinea pigs that she sells when she needs to and they are also for consumption. She also helps her husband in his job as a sawyer. 
 
She has been in the community bank for 6 years and she likes it as she has very good friends. She will use the money from the loan to invest in her husband's business. They are going to buy some trees to prepare the lumber and then sell it at the warehouses.   

Her goal is to give her children a good education so that they can get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy some trees (wood).

loans.name: Bayardo Marcelo

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Marcelo, tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa que labora como comerciante de frutas, verduras y abarrotes para poder apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar, ya que tienen dos hijos que estudian su primaria y necesitan del apoyo de los dos para poder salir hacia adelantes juntos como familia, don Bayardo labora desde hace  cinco años como albañil en una empresa constructora  ; la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no poder tener un capital suficiente para poder comprar de una solo ves los materiales de construcción para su vivienda , el está muy contento ya que con el primer crédito logro hacer las cuatro pareces de la misma y ahora quiere comprar el zinc , perlines, puertas , ventanas y otros materiales pendiente para la construcción .
texts.en:
Bayardo Marcelo is 45 years old.  He lives with his wife in the Ticuantepe municipality.  She sells fruits, vegetables, and groceries to be able to help him with the household expenses.  They have two children who go to elementary school.  They both need to help to be able to get ahead together as a family.

Bayardo has worked as a bricklayer for a construction business for five years.  The greatest difficulty he faces is not having enough money to buy all off the construction materials for his house in one purchase.

He is very happy because he used his first loan to build the four walls of the house.  He now wants to buy zinc sheets, beams, doors, windows, and other materials that are needed for the construction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es: carlos césar fernández M. tiene 44 años, es soltero no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus padres, es mecánico automotriz de profesión y conforme realizaba sus prácticas profesionales fue inclinándose para la parte eléctrica de los vehículos es así como el ahora cuenta con un taller propio y adicional a esto lleva trabajando 7 años en el instituto catalina buendía de pecho como docente en la especialidad de mecánica eléctrica, tiene su taller propio el cual lo pudo poner con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, sus principales clientes son vecinos de la zona, él los atiende con gran calidez. este negocio le ha permitido obtener mayores ingresos que le sirven para los gastos de la casa, ya que él es el sustento de sus padres, Carlos desea invertir en compra de instrumentos para una mejor calidad de atención y efectividad en los diagnósticos que realiza, teniendo como resultado la captación de mayor cantidad de clientes, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago, el sueño de carlos es tener una taller completo, donde ofrezca la venta de productos y el servicio mecánico, y de esta manera brindarle una buena calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
Carlos Cesar F. M. is 44 years old. He is single with no children and lives with his parents. He currently works as an auto mechanic; he works primarily on the electrical part of vehicles and has his own shop. He has also worked as a teacher of electric mechancis at the Catalina Buendia de Pecho Institute for the past seven years.

He has his own shop, in which he invests much effort and work. His principal clients are neighbors in the area, whom he serves with great quality. This business has allowed him to have more income that help him with household expenses, since he supports his parents. Carlos would like to invest in the purchase of instruments to be able to offer better quality and effectiveness in his diagnostics. He is being offered the credit based on good personal references and his ability to pay the monthly quotas. Carlos' dream is to have a fully equipped shop where he can offer the sale of products as well as mechanical servcies, and in this way offer a better quality of life to his parents.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and car accessories

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 34 year-old Hawa.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 18, 16 and 13.  In 2001, Hawa established her provision shop business. Hawa got her first stock on credit from a friend and later accumulated a profit, which she used to open a provision shop. She began her business with the hope of generating enough income to help her husband support their family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 100,000 from her business every month. Hawa needs a loan of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy milk, sugar, tea, sardines, margarine, etc., for her shop. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Hawa plans to get a house for her family.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, tea, sardines, margarine, etc., for her shop.

loans.name: Jose Cruz

texts.es:
Don José, reside en Joateca departamento de Morazán, tiene 51 años de edad, se dedica a la producción de maíz, él está casado vive en compañía de su esposa, don José tiene 30 años de ser agricultor, trabajando la tierra en las siembras de maíz y frijol, el periodo que aprovecha para trabajar es el invierno, dejando el verano para la comercialización de la cosecha.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semilla mejorada, esta compra con el objetivo de iniciar el proceso de la siembra para este nuevo año, permitiéndole realizar el trabajo y mejorar la cosecha.
Sus proyecciones son mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda, para tener a su familia más segura y cómoda.
texts.en:
José lives in Joateca, Morazán Department.  He’s 51 years old and is a corn farmer.  He’s married living with his wife.  He’s been a farmer for 30 years.  He works the soil planting corn and beans.  The season he takes advantage of to work is winter leaving summer to sell his harvest.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and improved seed.  This purchase’s goal is to start the planting process for this new year making it possible for him to do the work and improve the crop yields.  His project is to improve the infrastructure of his house so that his family will be more secure and comfortable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and improved seed.

loans.name: Rodegunda

texts.en:
Rodegunda C. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Rodegunda is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Rodegunda owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing like blouses, T-shirts, pants, jeans & also shoes in the local community. Rodegunda has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rodegunda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodegunda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Rodegunda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like blouses & T-shirts. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Rodegunda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like blouses & T-shirts.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 45 years old, married and has four children.

In 2009 Hanaa opened a food market where she sells all kinds of food, beverages, and desserts. She has two years experience and a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2500 loan to buy a new refrigerator and to make more shelves for her market. She aspires to obtain more income through increased sales so she will be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator and to make more shelves for her market.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa casada su esposo de professión tornero, tiene a sus hijos estudiando. Ella tiene su propio negocio venta de productos plásticos desde hace un tiempo, se le ha presentado ventas baja en ocasiones, inicio con financiamientos. Sus planes futuros incrementar las ventas. El préstamo lo requiere para compra de mercadería platos, baldes, bolsas, Plásticos negros y de colores, tinas, coladores, cucharas entre otros productos  para ofrecerle mayores cantidades y variedad de productos. Agradece a la financiera por su apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is married. Her husband is a lathe operator. Her children go to school. She has had her own business selling plastic products for some time. Sales are low sometimes, and she started with financing. Her plans for the future are to increase sales. She needs the loan to buy merchandise such as plates, buckets, bags, black and colored plastic, tubs, colanders, and spoons, among other products, in order to offer larger quantities and a variety of products.  She is thankful to the lenders for the support for the development of her business and the improvement of her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Saul Ernesto

texts.es:
Saúl, vive con su esposa, tienen dos hijos de 14 y 19 años de edad, él se dedica a la reparación de bicicletas, este negocio surge por la necesidad de cubrir las necesidades del hogar, el aprendió joven a reparar las bicicletas por tal motivo decidió instalar el taller. 
Él necesita por el momento repuesto para bicicletas, por lo que solicita un préstamo para adquirir maniubros, frenos, rayos, pedales, asientos y forros, ya que se le agotan y quiere estar preparado para realizar reparaciones de forma rápida.
Su objetivo es potenciar el taller, que sea más rentable y mantener esta fuente de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Saúl lives with his wife and their two children, who are 14 and 19 years old. He has a bicycle repair workshop, which he started in order to be able to support his family. He learned to fix bicycles when he was young and decided to set up a workshop.
At the moment, he needs bicycle parts, and is requesting this loan in order to purchase gears, brakes, spokes, pedals, seats, and tires, since his supplies are running low and he wants to be ready to make repairs quickly.
He'd like to expand his workshop, making it more lucrative and maintaining this source of income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase gears, brakes, spokes, pedals, seats, and tires.

loans.name: Someoun

texts.en:
Someoun, age 34, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, earning an income of $0.8 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $3 per day. 

Someoun is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. For the past three years Christine has operated a retail shop, and works seven days out of every week. She has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and a bag of rice. The main business challenges Christine faces are seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of commodities. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop.

Christine lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and a bag of rice.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Vuthy, 29 years old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $4 per day. She has one child who is three years old. Every month she has to spend around $70 on every expense for the family. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy another motorbike to travel to work because her current motorbike is too old and needs a lot of fixing. In the future, she wants to feed chickens at home so that she can have time to take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Азам проживает в районе Яван. Ему 51 год. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена занимается растениеводством. Сам Азам занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Azam lives in Yavan. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a farmer. Azam works in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle for sale.  He has been doing this work for ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase his herd.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, single and lives with three family members. One of his family members works.

Alaa has been a tailor since 2006. He makes and repairs women and men’s clothing. He has a deep understanding of local consumer and he has a good experience. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1200 loan to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine and a generator.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 33 years old, has worked in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last three years. Introduced to KADET by a friend, Joseph, in order to diversify his sources of income, is requesting his first loan to start an animal-farming enterprise through the purchase of four goats which he will rear and later sell at a profit.

In the future, Joseph hopes to open a shop selling motorbikes and spare parts and also grow his farming project.

loans.use: to start animal farming.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos  de 53 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 6 años Santos se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea cada vez más grande y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Santos es una persona responsable y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles más comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 53 years old, lives with his spouse and children in their own house, which has electric service only. They are in the rural area of Tambogrande district, which is in the department of Piura. The area is known for farming, ranching and arts and crafts.

For the past six years, Santos has sold staple goods (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc.) and drinks. He has put the business in his own house for comfort and safety. With the earnings he gets from sales of his products, he tries to cover all his expenses and improve his family's standard of living.

In order to help his business, Santos has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to buy more merchandise. His only ideal is that his business continues growing and is better stocked so he can offer more to his customers. Santos is a responsible and hardworking person who cares about making his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Adjo Bernadette

texts.fr:
Adjo Bernadette est une femme âgé(e) de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 03enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier a 07 ans.  
Adjo Bernadette travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2002. Elle vend à ses clients dans une boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de la mévente et le vol. 
Adjo Bernadette a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut épargner les profits supplémentaires. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo Bernadette voudrait ouvrir une grande boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjo Bernadette is a 41-year-old woman who is married to a driver. She has three children, of whom two are in school. The first-born is 20 years old, and the last is 7. Adjo Bernadette has been working as a retailer grocer since 2002. She makes her sales out of a store. She buys the goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo. At the moment, her main difficulties are a drop in sales and theft. 

Adjo Bernadette has requested her first loan cycle at WAGES to buy some grocery items. She wants to save her extra profits. In the next few years, she would like to open a large store. With the profits, she says she plans to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Anmar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and a father of one child.

Anmar has been an owner of a food market since 2009. He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs.  He has sufficient experience from his previous work with his father. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs to his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to buiy more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 58 years old. She lives in the village of Kumistavi, West Georgia. She lives alone and earns a living through agricultural activities. She has two milk cows and produces cheese, which is sold at a local market. Also she has a garden with 50 tangerine and 50 nut trees. She sells harvested tangerines and nuts at the same market. Her total average monthly income is 300 Lari (GEL) (approximately 180 USD). 

With the requested 1000 Laris Ketevan plans to purchase a milk cow. She will produce 50% more cheese and increase her income, which will allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.ru:
Руслана замужем, у нее двое дочерей. Руслана предоставляет услуги парикмахера и параллельно является технологом-колористом в своем родном городе Никополе. Она работает в небольшом съемном помещении при местной бане, превратив его в уютную парикмахерскую. В этом районе больше нет парикмахерских, что способствует развитию бизнеса Русланы. Кроме отсутствия конкурентов на рост бизнеса повлияла помощь мужа и стремление самой Руслана к развитию. Сначала Руслана занималась торговлей, но потом поняла, что это не ее сфера и решила заняться парикмахерской. Этим делом она занимается пока только 2 года. Ее ежемесячная чистая прибыль составляет около 2 300 гривен. 

Руслана планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 8 000 гривен в оплату аренды помещения, которое она снимает для работы. По условиям аренды ей нужно оплатить аренду за полгода вперед. Кроме этого Руслана надеется купить необходимое оборудование для работы в своей парикмахерской, а также приобрести стеклянную витрину.  В планах Русланы превратить свою маленькую парикмахерскую в настоящий салон красоты. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Ruslana is married, she has two daughters.  Ruslana provides hair cutting services and is also a colorist in her hometown, Nikopol.  She works in a small rented space in the local bathhouse, having turned it into a cozy barber shop.  In this neighborhood there are no other barber shops, which helps the growth of Ruslana's business.  In addition to the lack of competitors the growth of the business has been effected by the help of her husband and Ruslana's own striving for growth.  In the beginning Ruslana worked in sales but then understood that this was not the right sphere for her and decided to start a barber shop.  She has been in this business for only 2 years so far.  Her monthly net profit is around 2,300 hryvnia.

Ruslana plans to invest the KIVA loan of 8,000 hryvnia into paying rent on the space that she leases for work.  Under the terms of her lease she needs to prepay the rent for half a year in advance.  In addition, Ruslana hopes to purchase necessary equipment to work in her beauty salon and to purchase a glass display.  Ruslana has plans to transform her small barber shop into a real beauty salon.

loans.use: to pay rent for the space that she leases for work and to purchase required salon equipment

loans.name: Lino

texts.en:
Lino is 55 years of age, married, and has been blessed with three children. He is glad that he is able to provide for the needs of his family. Lino has been engaged in a corn farming business for five years. According to him, he is able to earn about P35,000 per cropping season. His income goes to their daily needs, allowances of children, payment for electric bills and some amount was used in maintaining their corn field. 

Lino would like to ask for additional capital amounting to P27,000 allowing him to buy his farm supplies such as fertilizer, insecticides and certified seeds for his farming business. He believes that through his patience and effort in improving his corn field he could be able to improve their way of living. In addition, his income will also increase. In this way, he could sustain his family needs. He hopes that he could get the loan amount he requested.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as insecticides, certified seeds and fertilizer for his corn farming business.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines tiene 57 años, su actividad es la venta y destace de cerdo. Hace más de 18 años que tiene este medio de vida, dio inicio a este negocio ante la falta de trabajo que aqueja a nuestro país. Ella desea invertir este crédito en la compra de cerdos, ella sale a buscar sus productos a las diferentes zonas de su comarca. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido ha sido su salud, pues tiene que salir a buscar los cerdos y pagar por el transporte para trasladarlo hasta su vivienda. Su sueño siempre ha sido mantener su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
María Inés is 57 years old.  Her job is selling and butchering pigs.  She has had this means of support for more than 18 years.  She began this business when faced with the lack of work that afflicts our country.  She goes looking for her products to the different areas of her region.  One of her biggest challenges has been her health, since she has to go looking for the pigs and pay for transporting them to her home.  

María Inés wants to invest this loan in buying pigs.  Her  dream has always been to keep her business and have good health.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Bernard has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) of several networks like GLOBE & SMART. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads. Bernard has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Bernard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Henry De Jesús

texts.es:
Con su negocio de venta y engorde de ganado porcino (cerdos), se garantiza un sueldo mensual pero no le da para mantener a sus cuatro hijos y a su esposa que le ayuda en esta ardua tarea diaria. Con el crédito quiere comprar tres cerdos para ampliar así su capacidad de producción lo que le favorece para aumentar sus ganancias.

Su mayor sueño en este momento es poder comprar los corrales y no tener que pedirlos prestados a un amigo que le ayuda para que Henry no incurra en más gastos y pueda así cumplirle a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Henry sells pigs that he has raised. The job guarantees him a monthly income, but it is not enough for him to support his four children and wife who help him with this hard work. With the loan he plans to buy three more pigs and thus increase both production and his income.

Henry’s dream at the moment is to be able to buy his own pig pens and not have to rent them from a friend. He would then have fewer expenses and be able to fulfill his family obligations.

loans.use: to buy three pigs

loans.name: Lavian

texts.en:
Lavian is 30 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school. She has a saloon in Yei, South Sudan, which she has owned for five years.

Lavian is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase weaves and hair lotions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase weaves and hair lotion to sell.

loans.name: Grace Efua

texts.en:
Grace Efua prepares millet porridge for sale at Efutu. 

Grace is married to a nurse and has five children. She uses her income to support the husband to pay utility bills. 

She will use her loan to purchase more millet, sugar and milk to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profit , she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk millet, sugar and milk for the porridge.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат женат имеет двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка занимается домохозяйством. По профессии он учитель. Зарплата учителя маленькая и чтоба содержать свою семью он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и откормом скота., так как живет в регионе, где все занимаются сельхозом. Он занимается виноградоводством. Виноградник требует тщательного ухода. Он трудолюбив и усерден. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000 сомони для покупки мелкого рогатого скота. Он надеется на помощь и милосердие с вашей стороны.
texts.en: Shavkat is married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker and is involved in household work.  Shavkat is a teacher.  However, a teacher's salary is low, and, in order to support his family, he is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock because he lives in a region, where everyone is involved in agriculture.  Shavkat is involved in growing grapes, and grapes require thorough care.  He is a hardworking and diligent person.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1000 somoni to purchase small livestock.  Shavkat relies on the help and mercy from you.

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Myla has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 10,000 to buy fish to sell.

Myla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Myla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Hanzel

texts.en:
Hanzel is 18 years old and is first of five children in the family. Her mother Ana supports the family through her frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Hanzel is studying Hotel and Restaurant Management, and is currently in the 2nd of this 4-year course. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees of the second semester of the school year 2014-15. In the future, she plans to graduate and to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: Doña Araceli se encuentra muy feliz ya que con su primer crédito ella pudo comprar los insumos para sus cultivos de café los cuales asistió de manera oportuna obteniendo una excelente producción y el cual vendió a muy buen precio con algunos dueños de bodegas donde ofrecían el mejor precio de compra. Las ganancias fueron muy buenas y re invirtió en sus cultivos una parte y la otra fue destinada para poder pagar su crédito y otros compromisos que aún no lograba cancelar. Su negocio tuvo un cambio porque mejoro su producción gracias al primer financiamiento como también su calidad de vida ya que los ingresos obtenidos eran los esperados gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo realizado para que el grano no sufriera ningún daño y la planta fuera afectada por plagas. Doña Araceli solicita un segundo crédito con el cual pueda nuevamente comprar abonos, foliares, fertilizantes y el pago de mano de obra para dar limpieza a sus plantaciones de café esperando ser nuevamente apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en Kiva y COMIXMUL.

loans.use: Para compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares y pago de mano de obra para asistir su cultivos de cafe

loans.name: Musah

texts.en: Musah is an Organic and Fair trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 53 years old and married with 9 Children, seven of his children have completed Senior High school education, and others still having their Basic education. Musah believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can purchase a pruning and harvesting knife for the maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Ivan Kirilov

texts.en: In 1989, after the fall of communism in Bulgaria, Ivan began to drive a taxi.  He initially began working for another company, although several years ago was able to put together enough money for his own car and strike out on his own.  He now is a member of a cab co-op, which allows Ivan to work for himself, while having the infrastructure he would enjoy working for a larger company; the co-op provides its members with centralized dispatch, discounted repair and maintenance, and other services.   He is in need, however, at this point of a new car.  He has found a used Opel Astra for approx. $4,000, which fits his needs nicely.  This loan will fund half the cost, while he will be using his own cash for the remaining cost.  He has two children, one of whom is currently taking an auto mechanics course (which may come in handy at some point for dad…)   His wife is a seamstress and his daughter is still in school.  The S. family lives in Sliven, Bulgaria.

loans.use: Capital expenditure; the purchase of a new(er) taxi.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.en:
Argentina has been selling clothes and shoes for a year and a half. She does it with her daughter, who helps her. She works Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. She lets her clients buy on credit and carries an account register. Each week she collects payments from her clients. The other days of the week she is a domestic assistant in 3 houses, which is her other source of income. She was able to save and buy the inventory for her small business. Her earnings allowed her to buy her house and add a foundation. Previously it was located over the water.

She needs the loan because she wants to buy inventory for the beach season. With her earnings she hopes to increase her capital and make some repairs to her home.

Argentina was born in Santa Lucia – Guayas. She is 49 years old. She has 3 children, one of whom is now independent. She does not have a husband because he abandoned her 15 years ago. Argentina has confronted the full responsibility for the household alone. She had to work with her mother from the time she was very young and now she must continue to work, for her children. Her aspiration is that her business grows and she is able to work full time in clothing sales, because the earnings are better.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Argentina lleva vendiendo ropa y zapatos desde hace 1 año y medio. Ella lo hace junto a su hija que la ayuda. Se dedica a trabajar los días viernes sábado y domingo. Ella deja a crédito la ropa y lleva un registro. Cada semana cobra a sus clientes. Además los otros días es asistente domestica en 3 casas donde percibe sus otros ingresos. Ella pudo ahorrar y comprar su mercadería para su pequeño negocio. Con sus ingresos generados le ha permitido tener su casa y hacerle el relleno porque antes estaba sobre el agua. Ella necesita el préstamo porque desea comprar mercadería de temporada playera. Con estos ingresos espera incrementar su capital y hacer unos arreglos para su casa. Argentina nació en Santa Lucia –Guayas. Tiene 49 años. Tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos es independiente ya. No tiene esposo porque la abandono hace 15 años. Argentina sola ha tenido que enfrentar todo la responsabilidad de su hogar. Desde pequeña tuvo que trabajar con su madre y ahora también debe hacerlo por sus 2 hijos. Su aspiración es que su negocio crezca y dedicarse todo el tiempo a la venta de ropa porque los ingresos son mejores.

loans.use: Buy beach clothing to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea R. is 46 years old and runs a small business selling pork rice, noodles, and coffee.  She earns $3.80/day, while her husband makes $3/day working as a security guard at an English school.  R. and her husband have 2 children that both work security with their father.  With this loan, she will buy wood in order to build a proper restaurant.  She is confident that this will attract more customers and increase her income.  In the future, she hopes to build a new home.

loans.use: To buy wood in order to build a proper noodle & rice shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a grocery shop

loans.name: Maria Esmerelda

texts.en: Maria Esperanza

loans.use: Buy a cover for her stand to protect from the rain.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Business Description

Hilda C. has a small general store that sells novelty items. Her store has a very good location on a main street. She began her business with her parent’s help.

Use of the Loan

Hilda will use the loan to increase her merchandise and to make improvements at her location.

Personal Information

Hilda is 26 years-old and has a son. Her home is made of cement. Her goals are to buy a home and to save for her children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Hilda tiene una bazar donde vende articulos de novedad. Su local esta muy bien ubicado encalle principal y empezo su negocio conla ayuda de sus padres.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella usara el prestamo para incrementar mercaderia y hacer mejoramientos en su local.

Información Personal

Tiene 26 años esta separada y tiene unhijo su vivienda es de cemento. Sus metas es pomprarse una vivienda y ahorrar para el futuro de sus hijos

loans.use: Vary Merchandise

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael O. is 38 years, married and has two (2) children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling drinks and provisions since 1996.  She is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan of US$800 to enable her to buy more drinks & provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & provisions for sale

loans.name: Rita Lucrecia

texts.es:
Rita Lucrecia is a woman who started her own business 9 years ago with a small capital investment of $1000, the product of a loan made at a high interest rate by a money lender. With that first loan she established her business selling products such as preserves, vinegars, condiments and on occasion, meals she prepares herself.

She started out selling her products from her house and later succeeded in locating her business inside the central market, in one of the principal entrances. The quality of her products has continually improved thanks to the support she has received from Ceprodel. She has now received 22 loans, which have played a big part in her growth. She has improved her sales stall and now it is quite advantageous, large and attractive. Rita has been receiving loans from Ceprodel for 3 years and has had excellent results to date.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Rita Lucrecia es una dama que inicia su negocio hace 9 años con un pequeño capital de trabajo de C$1.000.00 producto de un préstamo que le hizo un prestamista a tasas bastante altas, estableciendo su negocio de venta de productos como enlatados, vinagres, condimentos y en ocasiones comidas preparadas por ella misma.

Inicia vendiendo en su casa y luego logra ubicar su negocio en el interior del mercado central en una de las entradas principales. La calidad del producto ha venido mejorando satisfactoriamente gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel ya que ha tenido 22 créditos que le han servido mucho para su crecimiento por lo que el puesto de venta lo ha mejorado y esta bastante favorable, amplio y vistoso. Ella tiene 3 años de tener crédito con Ceprodel y hasta hoy ha tenido excelentes resultados.

loans.use: Investment in the sales of spices and pickled foods

loans.name: Koudossou

texts.fr:
Born on February 21, 1978 in Lomé, Monsieur Koudossou F. is a sewing machine repairer. Single, with no children, he currently lives and works in the Gbényedji neighborhood of Lomé. Unfortunately, he has come up against financial difficulties preventing him from buying the tools he needs to practice his trade. He is therefore requesting a $400 loan to allow him to buy some pliers and other work tools. Monsieur F. is a very dynamic young man who deserves support.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Né le 21 Février 1978 à Lomé, Monsieur Koudossou F. est reparateur machine à coudre de formation. Célibataire sans enfants, il vit actuellement à Lomé au quartier Gbényedji où il exerce son métier. Malheureusement, il est confronté aux problèmes de moyens financiers pour acquérir les outils nécessaires à l’exercice de son métier. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un financement de $400 pour lui permettre de s’acheter quelques pinces et outils de travail. C’est un jeune homme très dynamique qui mérite d’être soutenu.

loans.use: To purchase work tools

loans.name: Geronima

texts.es:
Thanks to the first loan we received, we were able to buy the tools we needed, as well as offer good service to our customers. We are requesting a second loan in order to improve our auto repair shop and expand it a little more, thus allowing us to better serve our customers daily. We are requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to improve our auto repair shop business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Gracias por el primer crédito que pedimos comprar la herramienta que nos estaba haciendo falta y le podemos dar un buen servicio a los clientes. Estamos solicitando un segundo crédito para mejorar el taller y ampliarlo un poco más y así poder atender más de dos clientes por día. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para mejorar el negocio de taller de mecánica.

loans.use: Improve automotive repair shop

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget S., 43, a garment worker in the Canadia garment factory, lives with her family in the Kork Chombak Village in Phnom Penh City. She earns about $2.50 per day and has three children, one of whom is a bicycle and motorcycle repairman who provides his family with about $2 per day; the remaining two are students. Her husband, Mr. Leang Ngim, is a 46-year-old motorcycle taxi driver who earns up to $2 per day.

Mrs. S. now requests a loan of $700 to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband’s transportation business and to build a two-roomed house to rent out. Her husband is shown in the photo because S. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for her husband’s transportation business and to build a two-roomed house to rent out.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy three sewing machines and materials need to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Halima.

texts.ru:
Halima N. lives in the town of Vahdat, Tajikistan. She is a housewife, 46, and is married with 6 children. She has a high school education and raises livestock at home. Halima wants to buy a cow and start a small milk farm. She plans to use some milk from this farm to feed her own children. She is requesting a loan of $1025 which she plans to pay back in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Носирова Халима проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 46 лет, замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка , но занимается животноводством. Хочет купить корову для того , чтобы получить потомство и развести небольшое хозяйство. Кроме того, приобретя корову она сможет получать молоко , которое сможет использовать для своей семьи. Для этого она хочет получить кредит , который сможет погасить в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Moa S., age 42, is the mother of two children and together with her husband works selling groceries in the village. There are not many stalls selling groceries in the village. That is why her stall has many customers. She started doing this business in 2000 and on average she makes $18 each day in revenue. All of their children are students. This couple is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase groceries in bulk in order to save some money.

loans.use: Moa would like to purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Julio Humberto

texts.es:
Mr Julio Humberto R.' principal activity is making and selling the highest quality shoes, based on 40 years experience. He started with a small location on the street, where we went very early in the morning until the late hours of the night, because he wanted to move forward his life and have the power to offer something to his family. This is how he fought through a long time, for the power to obtain his business. He is a client that has worked two years with the institution without any delay, and he is very responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

EL SEÑOR JULIO HUMBERTO R. TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA FABRICACIÓN Y VENTAS DE ZAPATOS AL POR MAYOR, CON LA EXPERIENCIA DE 40 AÑOS EL COMENZO CON UN PEQUEÑO PUESTO EN LA CALLE DONDE EL SALIA DESDE MUY TEMPRANO HASTA ALTAS HORAS DE LA NOCHE PORQUE EL QUERIA SALIR ADENTE Y HACI PODER BRINDAR ALGO A SU FAMILIA Y FUE ASI QUE EL LUCHO DURANTE MUCHO TIEMPO, PARA PODER OBTENER SU NEGOCIO ES UN CLIENTE QUE TRABAJA DOS AÑOS CON LA INSTITUCIÓN SIN RETRASO ALGUNO Y ES MUY RESPONZABLE EN SUS PAGOS

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Née en 1945 à Agomé-Tomégbé, Madame B. Abra a comme activité l’élevage des porcs. Veuve, elle a à sa charge une (01) personne et elle est seule à faire face aux charges du foyer grâce au revenu de son élevage. En vue de protéger ses animaux et de les nourrir de la meilleure façon pour les vendre plus chers à sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui servir de renforcer ses activités en construisant un enclos et acheter assez de nourriture.
texts.en:
Born in 1945 in Agomé-Tomégbé, Mrs. Abra B. raises pigs. She is a widow and is responsible for one other person. She is the only breadwinner for her household and her source of income is her pigs. With a view to protecting her animals and feeding them as well as possible so that she can sell them to her clientele for as much as possible, she is asking for a loan that she will use to improve her pig breeding business by building a sty and purchasing enough feed.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising pigs

loans.name: Ahoéfa Sonia

texts.fr:
Née le 17 octobre 1983 à Lomé, Madame M. Ahoéfa Sonia est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des bijoux dans l’un des marchés locaux de la ville de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2003 et a des clients fidèles.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’aller faire des achats de 30 colliers et 50 paires de boucles d’oreilles.
texts.en:
Born on October 17, 1983 in Lomé, Mrs. Ahoéfa Sonia M. is married and the mother of two children. Her primary business activity is the sale of costume jewelry in one of the local markets of the city of Lomé. She began this business in 2003 and has a faithful clientele.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 30 necklaces and 50 pairs of earrings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of costume jewelry for re-sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La señora Judith, socia del BC “Las Cucardas II”, vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Se dedica a la venta de sábanas, leña y gaseosas. El negocio está ubicado en su casa en el Jr. San Martín Nº 355 del A.A. H.H. Las Flores de la Molina, lugar donde atiende a sus clientes, lo cuales son sus vecinos y transeúntes que visitan su distrito.   

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará sábanas, leña en cantidad, plátanos en racimos para poder venderlos al menudeo, también comprará gaseosas de diferentes marcas, tamaños y sabores, para que sus clientes encuentren lo que requieren.

Judith tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 02 de sus hijos quienes la apoyan en la atención de los clientes. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo en la economía de la casa. Más adelante desea poner un negocio de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Judith, member of the Las Cucardas (Award Ribbons) village bank, lives in the La Banda de Shilcayo district in the province of San Martin, Peru. She sells sheets, firewood, and soft drinks. She runs the business out of her home on San Martin Street in the Las Flores de la Molina neighborhood; here she tends to her customers who are generally her neighbors and passersby that visit the area. With this $275 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase sheets, wholesale firewood, and bunches of plantains to sell retail. She will also purchase different brands, sizes and flavors of soft drinks for her customers. Judith is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children who help her to tend to her customers. She is a very long-suffering and responsible woman with great desires to progress and help her husband with the home expenses. In the future, she'd like to put a small grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets, firewood, plantains and soft drinks

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Lena

texts.fr: Mme Lena est une femme mariée mere de famille agée de 30 ans.Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le domicile conjugal.Son activité principale est la vente de bouteilles recupérées dans les hotels et autre endroit.les boutelles recuperées sont stockées chez elles avant d'être vendu aux fabriquant de produits synthetique diluant vernis et colle.Elle fait ce metier depuis deux(02)ans les revenus qu ' elle de ce travail lui permettent de participer aux depenses du menange.
texts.en:
Ms. Lena is 30-years-old, married, and a mother. She lives with her husband and her children in their marital home. Selling bottles salvaged from hotels and other places is her principal business. The salvaged bottles are stocked at her place and then sold to makers of synthetic products used for thinning varnishes and glues. This has been her trade for two years. The income she earns from this work enables her to help cover household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sergio Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio de 48 años de edad, su esposa le tiene un hijos de 18 años de edad, lo tiene estudiando en un colegio de la capital, habita en barrio el pilar de la cuidad de Managua. Su señora es ama de casa, lo cual se levanta en horas temprana para prepararle el desayuno a su esposo, ya que tiene que tomar el autobús en horas de la mañana, Trabaja en una empresa privada ocupando el cargo de contador. Sus planes son  construir su vivienda, comprando materiales de construcción como: piedras, cementos, hierros, bloques para terminar el porche como repellara las paredes y así  poder brindarle seguridad y protección a su familia. Gracias al préstamo de Afodenic lograra  asegurarle un buen patrimonio y futuro mejor a su hijo
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio is 48 years old and and with his wife has one 18 year old son who is studying in the capital high school. They live in the El Pilar neighborhood in Managua.
