His wife is a homemaker who wakes up very early to make breakfast for her husband who has to take the bus in the morning to his job. He works in a private company as an accountant. He has plans to finish building his home--purchasing construction materials such as stones, cement, iron, and blocks to finish his porch, and plaster his walls in order to provide better security and protection for his family. Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC, he will be able to secure a better inheritance and future for his son.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make a porch and plaster the walls

loans.name: Candy Selene

texts.es:
La señora Candy Selene S. F. tiene 27 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Pasaje La Marina 606 del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry de la provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió Enfermería Técnica, pero no termino porque se comprometió con su pareja a los 17 años. Tiene 2 hijos que aun son estudiantes.
Candy se dedica a la venta de muñecos de Peluche, marcianos y otros, lo realiza en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelados en 4 cuotas, que  invirtió en compra de productos de belleza que en ese tiempo vendía.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, lo invertirá en su negocio.
Candy desea con ver a sus hijos profesionales y con un gran futuro.
texts.en:
Candy Selene S. F. is 27 years old and belongs to the “Enterprising Women II” cooperative bank. She lives in the Trujillo province, located in La Libertad, Perú. She studied Nursing, but did not finish because she became engaged at the age of 17. She has two children who are still in school. Candy dedicates herself to selling stuffed toys/dolls from her home. With her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, which she paid in four installments, she invested in the purchase of the beauty products she sold at that time. With this loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six installments, she will invest in her business. Candy’s wish is to see her children become professionals with bright futures.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is the thirty-year-old mother of three children, a daughter and two sons, two of whom currently attend school. Mary’s husband is a farmer who cultivates plantains and vegetables, and the family lives in a rented apartment in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Mary has traded in fried fish for over 10 years, procuring fresh fish and vegetable cooking oil at wholesale prices from big store operators in nearby cities. Frying and then selling her product on a table in the local market square, she also sells to food vendors in her community.

Mary is requesting a loan to buy fresh fish and other materials in bulk in order to supply to more customers. She also desires to acquire refrigerators to store some of the fresh fish she procures, and hopes eventually to own a family house.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Janet E.

texts.en: Janet E. A. sells used clothing at the Elmina New Market. Janet E. has received junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman. Janet E. has been selling used clothing since 2000. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her stock of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a plot of land for building the family house; then she can stop paying rent and also gain a comfortable shelter for her family.

loans.use: To increase the stock of used clothing

loans.name: Adith Mego

texts.es:
La señora Edith Mego V. D. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara”, vive en el Jr. José Olaya Nº 1066, Distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 50 años y es madre D. 2 hijos, los dos mayores D. edad, que ya no dependen D. ella. Tiene 01 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. Mercería, como (Zapatillas, calculadoras, toallas, libros, hilos, etc), en un ambiente D. su propia casa.

Con el préstamo D. S/1,000.00 que cancelará a plazo D. 06  meses, lo invertirá comprando útiles escolares como: Cuadernos, libros, lápices, lapiceros, mochilas, así como zapatillas en variedad D. tallas, con modelos para damas, caballeros y niños.

Ella; es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio, en lo personal, nos cuenta que también desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar el ambiente donD. ofrece sus productos. 

Adith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edith Mego V. D. C. belongs to the “Santa Bàrbara” Community Bank. She lives at 1066 Jr. José Olaya St. in the Tarapota District of the San Martín region. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. Both children are adults and are no longer dependents. She has worked with the Bank for 1 year.

She currently sells notions such as (sneakers, calculators, towels, books, thread, etc.) in her own home. She will payback the loan of 1,000.00 PEN in 6 months. She will invest in school supplies such as: notebooks, books, pencils, pencil holders and backpacks as well as sneakers in a variety of sizes and styles for women, men and children.

She makes the decisions about the earnings from her business. Personally she tells us she would like to increase her business and improve the area where she sells her products.

Adith is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies: notebooks, books, pencils, backpacks.  Purchase sneakers for women, men and children.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis Alberto lives in a rural, predominately agricultural area in the Municipality of Anta, about an hour outside the city of Cusco. Luis Alberto is a member of the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank, along with his mother and five of his brothers and sisters: Damiana, Jose Luis, Juan Carlos, Basilia Sulema and Rosa, the group's current president.

Luis Alberto has been working as a taxi driver for the past two years and has his own car. He is requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles to perform maintenance on his taxi.

Luis Alberto is beginning his second loan cycle with the San Pedro de Katañiray Village Bank. His mother and some of his siblings have been members of the bank for more than five years. The group's loan officer, Franklin, says that it's often considered a bad idea to have many family members participate in one village bank. Franklin suggests this because many individuals are often dependent on a single business, or may all be taking out money to give to a single family member. However, Luis Alberto and his family have always been very reliable clients. Luis Alberto has pledged to repay his Kiva loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 48 años, es casada, tiene 7 hijos, uno falleció y 2 ya viven independientes. Con una atenta mirada y la plena concentración teje faldas, gorras, chompas, etc. a palitos y a crochet, en esta actividad lleva toda su vida, y lo que le causa mayor placer es que le es muy rentable, y ha hecho clientes regulares. En época de cosecha apoya a su esposo con las faenas agrícolas, una vez cosechada su producción, la acumulan en su deposito y después con mayor disposición de tiempo selecciona sus productos de acuerdo al tamaño. Una vez realizado este proceso su esposo busca un carro para transportar al mercado de la ciudad, y Victoria aprovecha para llevar sus tejidos y vender en el mercado. Gracias a su habilidad textil, puede disponer de dinero para sus necesidades personales, inclusive cuando saca a pastear a sus animales va tejiendo y camino a su chacra, sigue tejiendo. Inclusive durante las reuniones de su banco comunal está ocupada con su tejido, este es su 5to crédito con MFP, donde en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con una parte del dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para que ella y su esposo abonen la hectárea de papas que acaban de sembrar; y con la otra parte comprará madejas de lana de diversos colores para la elaboración de sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old, and has 7 children, although one passed away and 2 now live independently. With an attentive gaze and full concentration she knits and crochets skirts, hats, jackets, etc. She has spent most of her life doing this, and what gives her the greatest pleasure is that it's very profitable and she has made regular clients. When it's harvest time, she helps her husband with his farm duties, and once gathered, she prepares the crops before putting them in a storehouse until they can later be sorted by size. Once this process is finished, her husband borrows a car in order to transport the merchandise to the city, and Victoria takes advantage of this opportunity to bring her textiles and sell them in the market. Thanks to her skill in her trade, she can make enough money for her personal needs. Even when she takes her animals out to graze, she's knitting. Even when she is walking to their farm, she continues knitting. Even during meetings with her local bank, she's there, busy knitting. This is her 5th loan with MFP, and she has always shown herself to be punctual with her payments. With part of the money that she's asking for, she will buy chemical fertilizers for the hectare of potatoes that she and her husband just planted, and with the other part she will buy skeins of yarn of different colors which she will use for her textiles.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool for textiles and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Dashzeveg

texts.en:
Dashzeveg T. lives with his wife and three children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Two of their children are local high school students. Dashzeveg has a small business selling firewood. His wife is a big fan of Dashzeveg's business and she helps any way she can.

Since 2004, Dashzeveg has been cutting firewood and selling it in small bags to local restaurants and cafeterias. Since the beginning, his business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT ($1 = 1,500 MNT) to 800,000 MNT. He has gained the trust of cafeteria owners who are happy to purchase firewood from him. In the future, he would like to expand his business by adding more cafeterias and restaurants to his clientele list. He requests a loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela P. makes a living running a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is 60 years old, married and has seven adult children. She is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. Gabriela has been in business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Gabriela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Gabriela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Gabriela is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Gabriela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
la sra. Maria C. tiene 50 años de edad, ella esta casada con el sr. Luis Garay quien se dedica a la agricultura, Maria tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos vive en España, otro en USA y el otro en Honduras. ellos le mandan dinero para ayudarle economicamente.
Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en el barrio Maria Auxiliadora de la ciudad de Nacaome, uno de los productos que mas se vende en esta zona son los productos helados debido a la intensa calor en que viven en esta ciudad, cabe mensionar que Nacaome es el Lugar mas caliente de toda Honduras.
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener una buena tienda y cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria C. is 50 years old. She is married to Mr. Luis Garay, who is a farmer. Of Maria's three children, one lives in Spain, one in the United States, and the third in Honduras. Her children send her money to help her economically. Maria sells products that are used daily in her local store that is located in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood in the city of Nacaome. Very popular are ice-cold products, due to the intense heat in which the residents of the city live. It is appropriate to add that Nacaome is the hottest place in all of Honduras. Maria needs a loan to purchase more merchandise and therefore have a good store and meet all the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of popsicles, ice cream cones, ice cream, strips of fried dough, soft drinks, water in cartons and bottles, soup, rice, sugar, beans, bread, cookies, sweets, salsas, pastas, toilet paper

loans.name: Sitina

texts.en:
Sitina L., 50, is married with five children. She has one year of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~75 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Sitina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase knives, weed killer and sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
C. Vũ Thị (1412030326) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children.

C. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2003, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Rookhsar Group

texts.en:
Sadaqat, the leader of Rookhsar Group, is married and has three children. With hard work he formed a group of three members, each one of them busy in different tasks: Sadaqat has a metal working business, Abdull Habib has a fuel shop and Muhib has a tailoring shop. They want to become stronger in their businesses. Therefore, they formed a group and requested a group loan. Each member requests 14,000 AFN to further their work and be a good client for Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company). 

Sadaqat is sure that they can repay the loan on time and that he can lead the group. He would like to thank everybody who is helping with this process of obtaining a loan in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults

loans.use: To complete stock in their businesses (metal working, fuel sales and tailoring)

loans.name: Claudio Mauricio

texts.es: EL Joven Claudio L. de 21años de edad, reside en Villa el Carmen carretera vieja a León, soltero y vive junto con sus padres, trabaja en servicios de seguridad,  anteriormente de albañil para poder ganar el pan de cada día. Con suerte logro encontrar un trabajo fijo para. Con este préstamo hará mejoras a su vivienda y poder estar en mejores condiciones. Sus planes es poder seguir estudiando ya que por falta de recursos económico no ha seguido estudiando. Muy agradecido ya que con este oportunidad del préstamo podrá tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Young 21-year-old Claudio L. lives in Villa el Carmen, along the old highway to León. He is single and lives with his parents. He works for a security service company, and before that as a handyman, to earn money. Luckily he was able to find a steady job. With this loan he will make some home improvements and be able to have better living conditions. His plans are to be able to study, since due to lack of money he could not keep studying. He is very grateful for the opportunity that this loan provides to be able to have a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make home improvements.

loans.name: Doris Marely

texts.es:
Doris tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hija, de 8 años de edad, su madre y su hermana menor en el centro poblado Saltur, distrto de Zaña, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es propietaria de una pequeña bodega - tienda en su casa, allí vende golosinas y bebidas, este negocio le está dando buenos resultados y poco a poco lo ha ido ampliando, siendo esta actividad la única fuente de ingreso familiar.

Ella desea terminar de ampliar su negocio con la compra de abarrotes y productos de cuidado personal (jaboncillo, crema dental, cepillos dentales, etc.) por este motivo está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ahorrar el dinero suficiente para asegurarle a su hija una buena  educación así como brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida; Doris es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la toman por una mujer responsable y preocupada por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Doris is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her 8-year-old daughter, her mother, and her youngest sister in the town of Saltur, district of Zaña, located some 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She owns a small in-home general store, where she sells drinks and candy. This business has yielded great results for her, and she has been able to expand it little by little. This is her family’s sole source of income. She would like to finish expanding her business by purchasing provisions and personal care products (soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc.). For this reason, she is requesting her first loan of 500.00 PEN from our institute.

Her greatest wish is to be able to save enough money to give her daughter a good education, as well as offer her mother a better quality of life. Doris is well-known and esteemed by her neighbors, who view her as a responsible woman who cares about her family’s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions and personal care products to sell

loans.name: Vey

texts.en: Vey N., 25, is married and resides in Kompong Cham Province. She lives with her husband and her young child in a way simple way of life. To make a living, she is engaged in the business of selling gasoline in front of her house in the village, earning an approximate income of US $5 per day. The family is supported financially primarily by her husband, who operates as a taxi driver using his own car. He provides a taxi service from the province to the city, earning an income of US $15 per day. These businesses have made the family’s standard of living much better. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase various kinds of groceries to start a new business. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to raise the good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Ajelina

texts.en:
Ajelina J. is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Ajelina is 32 years old and is married. Her husband works in security for UN. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya de l’association Horonya est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, région de Ségou quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins  5 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe font le petit commerce des produits divers à Tominian il y’a environ 15 ans. Elles vendent des cosmétiques, des tissus, des céréales et autres. 
Pour rentabiliser leurs activités, les membres du groupe Danaya  de l’association Horonya ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Ce groupe est à son premier prêt avec l’institution.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour l’achat des produits divers de commerce.  
Ces activités sont très rentables pour ces femmes qui font leurs ventes en détail au marché de Tominian. 
Les femmes du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA à 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Danaya of Horonya association is made up of married women of Tominian town, Segou region ( fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and have average age of 33 years and at least 5 children. The women of this group do petty trading of various products in Tominian for about 15 years. They sell cosmetics, fabrics, cereals and other items. To make profit on their businesses, members of group Danaya of Horonya association decided to be part of the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso this year. This group is on its first loan with the institution. The current loan will be used to purchase various products for trading. These businesses are profitable for these women who make sale by retail in the market of Tominian. The women of group Danaya intend to make a monthly profit of 15 000FCFA to 20 000FCFA each which will be used for repayment of interest on loans and the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Mrs. Chandoeurn Chen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people who are all living in Preak Reussei village in the Kandal province make up this village bank loan group. They all will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Chandoeurn C. is the village bank president who has been selected the members. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. For this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and gasoline to pump water to support the field. Her husband, Mr. Chea Thoeurn, is a construction worker. Mrs. Chandoeurn C. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and gasoline to pump water to support the field

loans.name: Nasaret A1 Group

texts.en:
Frans S. is 37 years old and the leader of the Nasaret A1 Group. He was born into a farm family. He is a married man and has one son, Minggas S., who is 9 years old and studying in the first grade of elementary school. Frans lives with his family in Nenas Village, Fatumnasi Sub district, Kapan – South Central Region of Timor. Nenas lives far away from downtown. It takes about two and a half hours to travel from the Kapan Branch Office. Even though categorized as a cloistered place, Nenas Village is surrounded with a beautiful view. 

In order to meet his family's needs, Frans has to work hard by cultivating carrots, leeks and vegetables. The traders from Kupang city usually come to buy his agricultural products, so he doesn’t have to sell them at the market. The income that he generates from selling agricultural products helps him to meet his family's needs and Minggas’ educational needs, such as his uniform and books. 

Frans usually works on the farm from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm. Frans faces challenges in farming. He has to fetch water from a well by using two buckets and then carrying them on his shoulders. Actually, there is a fresh water facility available in the village. It is provided by a Non-Government Institution in West Timor, but not all of the community members, including Frans, can access the fresh water facility because their houses are situated far from the main street. This is the reason why he has to fetch water from the well. Even though he has to walk for about four kilometers from his farm to fetch the water, Frans never complains. He is happy to do his work.

Frans and family live in a very simple house that is constructed of thatch (also called water reeds or roof reeds), It is called a ‘round house’ – this is a type of traditional house in the South Central Region of Timor). There is only one room available in this house for cooking and sleeping. Frans plans to build a better house for his family, but he cannot afford it as he is only a poor farmer. His income is only enough to meet their daily needs and his son’s educational needs. 

Frans heard from the clergyman in the village that the Kiva field partner, the Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation, provides cattle loans for farmers in West Timor through the Cattle Fattening Program. Many farmers have felt the benefits of this program. Frans discussed it with his neighbors and they decided to form a group of ten farmers to join the Cattle Fattening Program. The group was named Nasaret A1. He is interested in joining the program because he wants to build a house for his family. He believes that through this program he will be able to generate profits that can help him buy the necessary building materials. Frans is requesting a loan amounting to 3,400,000 IDR from TLM to buy young cattle to fatten in twelve months. The other group members are also requesting a loan to buy young cattle. They hope to have a better life through this loan.

Note: When the group picture was taken, Jermias was not present.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Barbara Hilda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia HILDA tiene 42 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijas. Sus hijas son: Kelly estudia en un Instituto la carrera profesional de Turismo y Geordana estudia en la universidad “Alas Peruanas” la carrera profesional de Contabilidad. La socia es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comida. La socia tiene un restaurante en el mercado en la calle “Belén” donde prepara caldo de cabeza, caldo de gallina, adobo y comida típica de la región,  Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos como carne, verduras, arroz, azúcar y fideos.             
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our client Hilda is 42 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has two daughters. Her daughter Kelly studies in a professional tourism institute and Geordana studies in the university “Alas Peruanas” for professional accounting. Hilda is a native to Cusco and belongs to the communal bank “Ricchary Cusco” associated with Asociación Arariwa.

The client alternates her activities between caring for the house and selling food. She has a restaurant in the market on “Belén" street where she prepares chicken head soup, chicken soup, pickles and other typical food from the region. She has had the business for many years and it has gone well thanks to the effort she has put in the business. Our client is a hard working and enterprising woman that takes her family forward. She needs a loan to increase her business capital and wants to buy consumables like beef, vegetables, rice, sugar and beans.

She is very grateful for the opportunity provided through this loan and commits to finish her payments corresponding to the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The client need a loan to increase her business capital and wishes to buy consumables like beef, vegetables, rice, sugar and beans

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La señora Maria Esther  tiene 54 años de edad,  reside en el barrio Batahola Norte, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos  que trabajan, de  cuatro solo uno estudia el cual  espera poder apoyar para que culminen sus estudios, se dedica a la venta de bisutería, golosinas, helados, frutas ambulante en el portón de un colegio  desde hace varios años, el cual ha sido su medio de subsistencia, gracias al préstamo de Afodenic logro poner cerámica  a su sala ya que era de tierra, muy contenta por la buena mejora como una mejor higiene, con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de zinc, nuevo para cambiar el que tiene ya que mucho se le pasa el agua en el invierno es por eso la necesidad de poder cambiarlo para poder gozar de un mejor techo, así como seguir incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is 54 years old. She lives in the Batahola Norte neighborhood. She is a single mother of four children who all work. Of her children, only one is studying and she hopes to be able to support him so that he can finish his studies. She has been selling accessories, sweets, ice creams, and fruits as a street vendor at the gate of a high school for several years and this has been her means of living. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, she was able to put a tile floor in her living room, which had been a dirt floor. She has been very pleased with this improvement because it is more hygienic. With this loan she will purchase new tin roofing because a lot of water leaks in during the rainy season. She needs to change it out so that she can have a better roof and so that she can continue increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tin roofing and nails to change the roof on her house

loans.name: Peal's Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of nineteen people is located in Prey Snoul village in Takeo province. They will each use the loan which they obtain for a different purpose. Mrs. Peal S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Peal S. is the mother of four children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver, another is an employed in the garment factory while two others are students in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Lyno Hem, is an officer in the government.

Mrs. Peal S. is a rice middleman (a perS. who buys from producers and sells to retailers). In order to expand her business, she decided to ask for a loan to bU. more rice to re-sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to re-sell

loans.name: Diakhou

texts.fr: Madame Diakhou G. est une veuve qui a adhéré dans l’institution depuis 9 ans avec le démarrage du programme de micro crédit. Elle a déjà rembourse 20 prêts. Elle est mère de 3 enfants et s’est toujours battu pour l’entretien de son ménage. Elle évolue dans le commerce de pain et de petit déjeuner. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi pour ne pas rester oisive. Madame G. sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs dans le but d’acquérir du matériel pour finir la maison que lui a laisse son défunt mari en héritage. Son souhait est de la mettre en location afin de disposer d’une autre source de revenu  ce qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux besoins de la famille. Elle se réjouit de la progression positive de ses activités, et surtout la possibilité pour elle d’auto financer son commerce.
texts.en:
Madam Diakhou G. is a widow who joined the institution 9 years ago with the startup of the micro credit program. She already repaid 20 loans. She is the mother of 3 children and always struggled for the upkeep of her household. She has been a seller of bread and breakfast. She chose this business in order not to stay idle. Madam G. is requesting a loan of 300 000frs with the aim of acquiring some material to complete the house that her deceased husband bequeathed to her.Her wish is to put it up for rent inorder to have another source of revenue which will allow her better to meet the needs of the family. She is delighted with the positive progress of her business especially the possibility for her to self-finance her business.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del barrio Bernardino Caballero, de la ciudad de Ypane. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. 
Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable.
Las actividad que realiza la señora Petrona E. le resulta bastante bien en cuanto ya que los ingresos que obtiene con esta actividad le ayuda para la alimentación, y vestimenta de su familia.

texts.en:
The committee, “Maria Auxiliadora,” was formed jointly by some neighbors in the Bernardino Caballero neighborhood in the city of Ypane. All the members of the committee have different activities in sales.

The members have become very close and are capable of carrying out activities as a group, since the majority of the members are in sales and they are all colleagues.

All the members of the committee are mothers that perform their activities to strengthen the household finances and develop their sustainable businesses.

The activity that Mrs. Petrona E. does has helped her a lot since the income that she receives has helped her feed and clothe her family.

Below is a list of the activities of each member: 1 Petrona E. Selling Clothing 2 Patricia F. Selling Clothing 3 Maria F. Selling Clothing 4 Maria F. Baker 5 Lilia A. Selling makeup 6 Claudia D. Lottery Ticket Sales 7 Petrona N. Lottery Ticket Sales 8 Juana F. Selling drinks 9 Maria R. Snack bar 10 Elida C. Small grocery store 11 Nora A. Baker 12 Norma D. Selling clothing 13 Maria Z. Selling food 14 Edith G. Small grocery store 15 Leonidas P. Selling fruits 16 Mercedes V. Small grocery store

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, dresses, pants, shorts, sweaters, sportswear

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos ya independizados, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito D. Monsefú, ubicado a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

DesD. hace 18 años tiene instalado en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Monsefú un puesto D. venta D. verduras. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad D. legumbres y tubérculos frescos. Este negocio es una fuente importante D. ayuda a la familia, ya que lo que su esposo gana como albañil no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio D. Ursula siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. Ella está pensando en ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ursula es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ursula, 55, is married and has 5 children, who are all independent now; she lives with her husband in Monsefú district, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has sold vegetables in Monsefú's wholesale food market for the past 18 years. Every day she offers a variety of fresh vegetables and tubers. This business is an important source of family income because her husband's earnings as a bricklayer are insufficient to cover all family expenses. Ursula can always count on her regular customers who prefer her for her kindness and good customer service. She is thinking of enlarging her business by stocking more merchandise but she needs an initial, 1500 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to do so. Ursula is quite a hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to make some improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia C. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Florencia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Florencia owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community. Florencia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Florencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Florencia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Florencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita T. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Lolita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business providing motor transport services to local community members. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her business

loans.name: Edubeges

texts.es:
Edubeges tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Inocencio (44), que es agricultor y de sus 4 hijos menores de edad.

Esta laboriosa mujer se dedica a la agricultura, cada día se despierta muy temprano para vigilar sus cultivos, sabe que debe tener dedicación y cuidar muy bien su producción, si quiere cosechar en buena cantidad. Todos sus productos los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes le pagan muy bien por cada saco de frutos cítricos que les ofrece.
A ella le gusta mucho sembrar y cosechar y lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo, juntos se sacrifican a diario en busca del progreso; lo que no le gusta mucho es que cuando los precios de las frutas bajan y no percibe muchas ganancia. 
Siendo una mujer muy emprendedora siempre está en busca de nuevas oportunidades, por lo que para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mayores ganancias.

Es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.

Edubeges tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras para la próxima cosecha, además destinará una parte para el pago de operarios para la limpieza de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Edubeges is 35 years old. She lives in her own home together with her four young children and her husband Inocencio, age 44, who is a farmer. Edubeges is a hardworking woman. Every morning, she wakes very early to care for her crops; she knows that in order to have a good harvest she needs to work with great care and dedication. She sells all her produce to wholesale merchants who pay her very well for each sack of citrus fruit that she offers. Edubeges really likes the work of planting and gathering harvest; her husband helps her with everything. Together, they work very hard every day to make progress. What they don't like is when fruit prices fall, and they aren't able to make much profit. As a very entrepreneurial woman, Edubeges is always looking for new opportunities. In the future, she is planning to plant more so that she could obtain greater income. This is the third loan Edubeges has with MFP, and she is very grateful to all the people who made it possible for her to continue her work. She plans to invest part of the funds into the purchase of manure and fertilizer to prepare her lands for the next harvest; the remaining part will be used to contract workers to clear the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Boeb N. is 39 years old and is the village bank president. She was selected by the eight-member group located in Sla village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it for a different purpose. Mrs. Boeb N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and she weaves mats. In order to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Boeb N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Boeb N. is a widow with three children who are all students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Neang Son Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Neang S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members who live in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. This village bank loan has twelve people who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Neang S. and her husband, Mr. Ley Hor, are farmers who own a half-hectare piece of land to grow crops to sell in order to support their family's costs of living. Their problem is that their field is on time to plow but they did not have enough money to complete the harvest. So to improve production, Mrs. Neang S. is applying for a loan to hire a plowing machine to plow her field. She is the mother of a child who is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To hire a plowing machine to plow her field.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina E. is from the village of Lower Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 31 years old and still single. To make a living, Marina owns & operates a "Meat Shop". Marina has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Marina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.     
       
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
       
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her meat shop business.

location.town: Sindangan-Lower Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 24 years old and makes a living in two ways: by running a beauty salon and selling second-hand clothing and shoes.  Her hair salon is in a busy shopping center that serves many local customers. She has been in this line of work for four years and now has three employees. The many challenges she faces are competition from other salons and the high cost of electricity. 

Pauline plans to use this loan, for 20,000 Kenyan shillings, to buy hair additions/extensions (for “waves” and “wings”) and additional clothing and shoes to sell to her customers.

In the future, Pauline hopes to expand her businesses by buying a car to transport products from one marketplace to another.  In five years, she dreams of being the leading salon-service and clothing provider in her area, for both men and women.

loans.use: To buy products for a beauty salon and a clothing business

loans.name: Aydee Gladis

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Chota, una zona ubicada en la sierra norte del país, específicamente a 2394 m.s.n.m., pertenece a la región Cajamarca y se encuentra ubicada a diez horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ell cuenta con una bodega desD. hace mas D. 20 años, allí ofrece diversos artículos D. pasamanería, bebidas, lanas y vestimentas típicas para utilizarlas durante fiestas patronales. Este negocio le permite sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad se ha vuelto conocida por la zona y cuenta con un grupo D. clientes fieles.

Aydee se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición D. diversos productos que le permitan seguir captando mas clientes y percibir mas ganancias.

Ella goza D. muy buenas referencias por la zona en donD. vive, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer trabajadora y que siempre fa lo mejor D. si para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Aydee, 55, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Chota district, an area located in the northern mountains of the country at an elevation of 2394 meters above sea level. It’s part of the Cajamarca region and located ten hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For over 20 years she has had a general store where she stocks various items like lace trim, beverages, wool fabric and typical items of clothing to be used during festivals. This business allows her to support her family and help her husband meet household expenses. Because of the length of time she’s been in this business, she is very well known in the area and she has a group of regular customers. Aydee is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 2000 new sol, loan that she plans to use to buy various items that will make it possible for her to attract more customers thus earning more profits. She has very good references where she lives; her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a hard working woman who always gives the best of herself to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lace trims and assorted items for her store.

loans.name: Angelica Cecilia

texts.es: Angélica Cecilia tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar el servicio de panadería. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, cuando ella inicio no tenía el capital suficiente para ofrecerles a sus clientes una gran variedad de pan, debido a la buena administración de su negocio ha logrado que su  como semitas, picos, pan simple, rin y postres con el paso del tiempo y con sus clientes que recurren a su local ha mejorado. Actualmente solicita su primer financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como mantequilla, huevos, harina, sal, queso, leche entro otros productos necesarios. Ella sueña con poder construir su vivienda porque no tiene las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Angélica Cecilia has 2 minor children who are in her care. She has had a bakery business for more than 5 years. When she started out she did not have sufficient capital to offer her customers a large variety of bread. Owing to the good management of her business, she has managed to now offer rolls, picos (a Nicaraguan specialty made with dough, sugar and cheese), plain bread, desserts and other items. Over time, and with her repeat customers, her business has improved. Now she requests her first loan to buy raw materials such as butter, eggs, flour, salt, cheese, milk, and other needed products. She dreams of being able to build her house, because she does not now have the necessary conditions to do this.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to by supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Abdimitalip

texts.en:
Abdimitalip O. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  He is 43 and married. He has two daughters, the first daughter studying at university and the second just graduated from school. 

In 1995, when the collective farms broke up, Abdimitalip was given a plot of land where he started to grow wheat. Then he decided to grow rice instead of wheat, because the profit from selling the rice is higher.  In this way he makes about $130 per month. That profit made it possible for him to save money and purchase a vehicle.  With money received from the loan he wants to purchase 1.5 tons of mineral fertilizers which are needed for getting a good harvest.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas M., 24, is single and lives with her mom and her sister in Takeo province. She is shown with her mom in the photo. Meas M. is a farmer, while her sister is a professional tailor, both of them typically making about US$4.50 each day.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Meas M. included.

In light of these economic difficulties, Meas M. is asking for a loan of US$750 to purchase a sewing machine for her sister. This will allow the family to expand its daily revenue.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her sister

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. sells cooked rice and yams and serves them with tomato sauce and palava sauce (a type of stew) at Elmina.

Comfort has been through junior high school. She is divorced with two children. 

Comfort’s loan will be used to buy a bag of rice and more yams to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy a bag of rice and more yams to cook for sale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old and married with one child.  Samuel owns a shop where he sells a variety of goods such as printers, notebooks, and some other items as the picture indicates.  Samuel has been in this business for about two years and the business hours are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Samuel needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Samuel will purchase some additional items to satisfy the demands of his customers.  If successful, Samuel will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.  In addition to that, he will create some other sources of income in order to create more jobs for the people in his community.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun L. (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Pak Bo, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2001 and have two children; one son and one daughter. They are in the local school.

Sokun and her husband are silk weavers. Besides this, her husband is a construction worker as well. Sokun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

loans.name: Theresa Ekua Yasah

texts.en: Theresa Ekua Yasah A. is divorced. She has not received any form of education. Theresa sells fruit and soap at Elmina. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business by buying more fruit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Luka Kiptanui

texts.en:
Luka Kiptanui K. is a man of twenty eight years.  He is married to Philloh Cherutich.  They have three children who are between seven and three years old. They live in Kipkabus in Eldoret Town.   

Luka sells cattle in the same area and gets a monthly income of two thousand shillings.  He has been in this business for three years now.

This will be Luka's first loan from KADET.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy more cattle so that he can increase his stock.  With the income he will get, he plans to diversify his business and plough his farm and also plant maize for resale after the harvest.

In the future, he wants to raise the family's standards of living, educate his children to the highest level, and provide them with basic human needs.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa L., age 40, is a tailor, offering general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. In addition, she buys coconuts to be dried and sold as copra. Elisa has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. She and her husband live in the village of Sto. Niño, Manolo Fortich, Bukidno, and have two grown children.

In 2009, Elisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Elisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. Elisa is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 36 años, es madre soltera y tiene un joven hijo con el que vive  en la casa de su hermana.Desde hace un año esta laboriosa mujer se ha integrado al exitoso negocio de bisutería que tiene su hermana. Se dedica a la fabricación y elaboración de collares, cadenas, aretes y otros adornos de la casa,  y le va muy bien;  ya que su hermana Honorata tiene muchos años de experiencia en el negocio. Es por esta razón que para  Ana no  ha resultado ser nada complicado y le agrada mucho tejer y armar las cadenas, ya que cuando produce en mayor cantidad abastece a más tiendas, y de acuerdo a ello también aumenta sus utilidades. Sin embargo, esta pensando para el futuro  independizarse en este negocio, y de ese modo espera captar mayores utilidades para brindarle educación superior a su hijo.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que este dinero le será de mucha utilidad. En su grupo comunal, es nueva ya que ingreso por recomendación de su hermana, y no  piensa defraudarlos, pues le han brindado su confianza.Ana tiene planeado invertir  el crédito en la compra de materiales como alambres de alpaca, perlas entre otros dijes, y de ese modo espera  trabajar con su capital de a pocos.
texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old.  She is a single mother and has a young son with whom she lives in her sister's house.  For one year, this hard-working woman has been working in her sister's successful jewelry business.  She makes necklaces, chains, earrings and other decorative items and business is going very well since her sister Honorata has many years of experience.  For this reason, it hasn't been at all complicated for Ana and she very much enjoys weaving and putting together the chains since the more she produces, the more stores she supplies and the more she increases her profits.  In the future she is thinking of working in this business independently.  In this way, she hopes to make more profits so that she can fund her son's higher education.

This is Ana's first loan with MFP and she knows that the money will be very useful to her.  She is a new member of her community bank.  She joined on her sister's recommendation and she does not want to let down the other members as they have placed their trust in her.  Ana plans to invest her loan money in buying materials such as alpaca wire and pearls amongst others.  In this way she hopes to work gradually with her capital.

loans.use: To buy materials to stock her business

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to financially assist her son in his agriculture business. He works in the fields and grows different seasonal crops. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizers and seeds, etc., which will help him grow crops and earn good income. Irshaad is hopeful that her son, who has been operating this business for the past five years, will get the desired results from his work with the loan investment. 

Irshaad is a very supportive lady. In order to financially assist her family, she sells milk. She has a buffalo at home whose milk she sells to clients in her community at a reasonable rate. Her buffalo produces 8-10 kg of milk per day and she sells 1 kg of milk at approximately 45 Pakistani rupees which is almost the same price in every city. Her earned income allows her to pay off the utilities and to manage the financial affairs of her family smoothly.

Irshaad has three other sons and three daughters. Her sons do different kinds of businesses and play their part for the financial survival of their family. Her daughters stay at home and help their mother in her daily works. Irshaad has been living in the city of Jaranwala for the past many years. Jaranwala is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house. 

Irshaad is a regular client of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Irshaad.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita M. Domínguez cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 1 año todos los fines de semana, este es su fuente de ingresos al cual desea invertir; para seguir generando mas ganancias. Margarita se intereso en el apoyo que se brinda en esta institución para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Señora Margarita M. Domínguez has been running a business selling used clothing at weekends for the last year. Her only income comes from this business and she wishes to invest in it so that she can earn more money. Margarita is interested in securing a loan from Kiva partner Credituyo so that she can add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casad y tiene seis  hijos.  No pudo concluir sus estudios.
Viene trabajando con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años, el primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en la compra de artículos de ferretería para su negocio. Ella se dedica a distintas actividades, los mas principales son el bordado y venta de todo tipo de productos de ferretería, con respecto al bordado, elabora pues hermosos paisajes y costumbres de la familia “Urus” para luego venderlos y con respecto a la segunda actividad son comprados los productos desde Tacna y Desaguadero y entregado a los comerciantes en la feria de Ilave.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará  doce cajas de bisagras  y tres docenas de candados. 
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es la ganancia generada por los ahorros.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the communal bank named "Maria Asuncion Galindo", located in the district of Juli of the Chucuito-Juli province, in the department of Puno. She is 55 years old, married, and she has six children. She could not complete her studies. 

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past twelve years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/300 and she used the funds to purchase hardware store items for the business. She carries out various activities, but the main ones are cross-stitching and the sale of hardware store items. With respect to the cross-stitching, she creates beautiful sceneries and urus family costumes which she later sells. With respect to her second business she makes her purchases in Tacna and Desaguadero and she resells to the merchants in the fair at Ilave. 

With this loan, amounting to S/500, she will purchase twelve boxes of hinges and three dozen locks. 

What she most enjoys about the communal bank is the earnings generated through savings.

loans.use: To purchase hardware items.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem O. and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Sun, have been married for almost 30 years and have eight children-three sons and five daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, five are garment factory workers and other two are in school. They are living on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sem and her husband are farmers. They grow many kinds of vegetable such as corn, tomato and seas am on her farmland in the village. Sem is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives and building a restroom for family use.
Photo: Mrs. Sem O. was at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives and build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem S. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. is a weaver, earning an income of USD 2.8 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 20 on food and USD 66 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, es un joven de 20 años de edad, reside en San Isidro, departamento de Morazán, está soltero, vive en compañía de su madre, él se dedica a la venta de sorbetes, inicio este negocio hace dos años, lo cual consiste en recorrer varios lugares cercanos al municipio, ofreciendo paletas y sorbetes de diferentes frutas, vende de 8:00am a 5:00pm, surgió por la necesidad de ayudar a su madre con los ingresos para sostener el hogar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de la cual vende (sorbetes de sabores, paletas y vasitos), este préstamo le ayudara a tener suficiente producto durante un buen tiempo, ofreciendo así a los clientes de muchos sabores de helados.
Juan tiene como sueño instalar su propia nevería, que emplee a jóvenes de la zona, ayudando a otras personas que tienen necesidad de trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man who is 20 years of age. He resides in San Isidro in the Department of Morazán. He is single and lives with his mother. Juan sells sorbets and started this business two years ago. His job involves traveling to different places around town, offering popsicles and sorbets of different fruit flavors. He sells from 8am to 5pm. This business started because he needed to help his mother with generating income to maintain their household.

He is requesting a loan to buy the products that he sells (sorbets in different flavors, popsicles, as well as cups). These funds will help him have sufficient inventory for a long time, thereby enabling him to offer his customers different flavors of frozen treats. Juan has a dream of opening his own ice cream shop so that he can employ young people in the area and help other people who are in need of work.

loans.use: To purchase sorbets of different flavors, popsicles, and cups.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 25 years old. She has one child who is three years old so she has not yet begun school. Donatha sells foodstuffs and she has sold them for six years. This business has enabled her to feed her family. She works with her husband in the foodstuff business.

 Donatha is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and make more profits. She plans to save the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is a young man from Gaza city in Gaza Strip.  Radwan is the father of Ahmad, Bashar, and Layan who are seven, five and two years old respectively. 

Radwan has a grocery store where he was photographed in the picture here. He took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more items and a larger variety to attract more customers and increase his profit. Radwan is 37 years old.

loans.use: to purchase  a larger variety of items to increase sales.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Majella es integrante y presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “Amigas Unidas”, es una persona agradable y respetada entre las socias.
Entre otras actividades Majella se dedica a la venta de cerveza al por menor. Ella almacena las cajas en su casa y sin necesidad de abrir un local ella coloca sus ventas entre los vecinos y personas allegadas que conocen de su negocio. No le hace falta dedicarle mucho tiempo pues muchos de sus clientes la llaman con anticipación. Los préstamos del grupo los utiliza para mantener su stock de cerveza que es aproximadamente de 10 a 20 cajas. Su idea es poder convertirse en mayorista, si mantiene su perseverancia y su buen ánimo lo conseguirá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Majella is member and president of “United Friends” Communal Bank she is a nice and respected member in the bank.

Majella sells beer retail; she stores the cases in her home and doesn’t need to open a stall since she sells them to her neighbors and people who know about her business. She doesn’t have to dedicate a lot of time to her work since most of her customers call her in advance. The loan from the group is used to maintain her beer stock which is approximately about 10 or 20 cases. Mrs. Majella would like to become a wholesaler and believes that if she keeps her persevering and positive attitude she will achieve her goals.

loans.use: buy cases of beer to store the bottles.

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es:
María, tiene 41 años de edad, tiene tres hijos dos que aún viven con ella y uno que se caso, María tiene un negocio de venta de frutas, con este negocio ha logrado mantener el hogar, lo tiene desde hace 5 años, la fruta la vende en trosos ya en su bolsa, la ofrece de forma ambulante.
Actualmente necesita invertir en frutas, comprando mangos, sandia, jícama, pepino, ya que no dispone de muchas frutas en el puesto, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para ella y podrá ofrecer a los clientes frutas frescas.
Para María su único objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso, que le permita cubrir las necesidades del hogar y sobre todo mantener a sus hijos en condiciones optimas para que estos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old and has three children; two still live with her and one that’s already married.  María sells fruit.  She’s had the business for five years and it’s made it possible for her to support her home.  She is a street vendor and sells the fruit bagged and cut into pieces.

She currently needs to buy fruit: mangoes, watermelon, jícama and cucumber because she doesn’t have a lot of fruit available in her stand.  This loan will be of great help to her because she’ll be able to offer fresh fruit to her customers.

For María, her only goal is to have a source of income that will allow her to cover household needs and, above all, keep her children in optimal conditions so that they can improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with five children. Arlene is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Arlene is a farmer and raises crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 40 years. She has requested a loan to purchase materials for her house renovation.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her house renovation.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is married and has two children, ages 5 and 7. He has been repairing electronics, cameras, and televisions for over 10 years. Paul serves all types of customers in his community. He hopes to use this loan to purchase more parts in order boost his business. 

Paul plans to use the profits from his business to pay for his children’s education. He hopes to expand his business and open a branch one day. Paul describes himself as honest and god-fearing.

loans.use: to purchase more parts in order boost his electronics business

loans.name: 35 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình operates a food restaurant selling rice noodle. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Tình is 54 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a three member group, the 35 Điện Biên solidarity group. Tình lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Tình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tình has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tình has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Tình faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tình hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make processed food to sell

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. 

Houssam has had a workshop since 2008 where he repairs diesel engines for new cars. He has a lot of experience in this field, a good reputation, and is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family's quality life.

loans.use: To buy a generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 41 years old and married to Catherine. They have three school going children. He has practiced farming for eleven years. 
 
He was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seed and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

In the future, Francis hopes to become a leading farmer in his area of residence.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. Florence has a medical clinic. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. Florence sells her products from home, by means of retail. Florence has requested for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of syrups and other tablets. 

The main business challenges for Florence include defaulters and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked pharmacy. Florence lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of syrups and tablets

loans.name: Ramón Daniel

texts.es:
Ramón, tiene cuarenta y tres años de edad, es casado y con dos hijos que  dependen actualmente de el y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
Ramón acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para continuar con las  mejoras de  su vivienda, por lo  que este préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción para la construcción de un nuevo cuarto en su casa de habitación para sus dos hijos.
Todo esto es para que su familia goce de mejores condiciones de una vivienda.
texts.en:
Ramón is 43 years old, married, and has two school-age children who are currently dependent on him. He came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new loan so that he can continue making improvements to his home. The money will be used to buy construction materials so that he can build a new room in his home for his two children.

Everything he does is for his family so that they can enjoy better conditions at home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials so that he can build a room for his children.

loans.name: Afar

texts.en:
Afar is a 50-year-old farmer who raises fruits and vegetables. He has about seven years of experience in this field. He raises crops and sells them in the local bazaar. 

He is married and has three children. His monthly income is about 100 USD. 

He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase seeds and organic fertilizer for the upcoming autumn-winter season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en: Gansukh is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children. Two of his children attend secondary school and the youngest is only two years old. Gansukh delivers construction materials with his truck. Unfortunately, his business is highly seasonal. During the winter, he sells coal and wood to earn more income. With his hard work, their living conditions have improved steadily. His wife used to work as a salesperson for her brother’s clothing stall, but now she wants to sell clothes on her own.
