She believes that it will help increase her family's earnings. Gansukh is requesting a loan for his wife to purchase clothing products from wholesalers to start her sales business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing products from wholesalers to start his wife's sales business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 57 years old and a hardworking mother of three children.  She is engaged in the making and selling of rice cake, puto and suman.  These products are Pinoy (Filipino) recipes.   Filipino rice-farmers have always believed that there is nothing better than rice grown and tended by one’s own perseverance to fill one’s stomach.  Whether it is simple boiled rice, rice gruel or rice cake, it is prepared carefully in appreciation of the farmers’ hard work.  Yolanda aims to have a comfortable life.

Yolanda uses various methods to cook malagkit (glutinous rice) to provide her customers enough choices.  Most of her customers are looking for new food recipes and for this reason Yolanda requests a loan of PHP 5,000.  She will use the loan to buy malagkit rice, coconut milk, sugar, and milk to make her food products.  Yolanda wants to satisfy the tastes of her target market.  She offers her products by walking in her community every day and selling from house to house.   Yolanda hopes to earn a higher income to support the education of her three children.

loans.use: to buy malagkit (glutinous) rice, coconut milk, sugar, and milk to make her food products to sell.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr: Monsieur Souleymane est un marié de 50ans qui vit sur le territoire sénégalais. C’est un chef de famille qui a 5 enfants en charge. Il évolue dans le secteur du transport et gère un taxi.  C’est une activité qu’il a hérité de son père. Avec l’exploitation de son premier véhicule il est parvenu à épargner  jusqu'à se procurer un deuxième taxi. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui sera utilisé pour l’entretien et la réfection de ses véhicules. Ce financement lui permettra de maintenir le niveau de ses revenus pour toujours assurer l’entretien  et la gestion des besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Souleymane is 50 years old and married.  He lives in Senegal.  He is the head of his household and has five children in his care.  He works in the transport sector, running a taxi.  This is a business activity that he inherited from his father.  By working with his first vehicle, he has managed to save up enough money to buy a second taxi.  He has been a member of one of U-IMCEC's offices since August 2011.  He is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs which he will use to service and repair his vehicles.  This loan will enable him to maintain his income level so that he can always look after and manage his family's needs.

loans.use: to service and repair his vehicles

loans.name: Zolbayar

texts.en: Mr. Zolbayar is 28 years old and works as a technician in the power plant of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a technician for six years. He is a young father and lives with his family in a house located in the industrial district of Ulaanbaatar. Mr. Zolbayar and his family have been living in this house since he was a child. Lately his house has became very old and much of it is damaged. Therefore he is planning to make some repairs and renovate his house by himself before this winter. He needs MNT 600,000 to purchase the building materials according to his calculations. The loan Zolbayar is taking will be used to purchase the necessary building materials to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials to renovate his house.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 62 años, vive en su casa propia, Ella se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene pensado mejorar su actividad. Ella tiene tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente como siempre ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Margarita tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cerdos.
texts.en: Margarita, 62, owns the house where she lives.  She raises and sells pigs for a living.  She is an enterprising woman and plans to expand the business.  Margarita has worked with Fundacion for some time and she promises to repay this loan in the agreed-upon time.  She is grateful for the loan and doesn't want to let down the people who are responsible for helping her to continue to support herself.  Margarita will use this loan to buy pigs for her livestock business.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her livestock business.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Martha, de 48 años de edad, es comerciante, tiene una pulpería, vive en la ciudad de León, madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, ya son independientes. El negocio de la pulpería lo heredo de su madre quien era comerciante pero su madre la dejo a ella administrando el negocio y que se ayudara para pagar los gastos de sus hijos ya que le toco ser madre soltera y no tuvo mas apoyo  que el de su mama. Hoy en día es ella quien es dueña y administradora de su  pulpería a cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco y por la cual le dio lo necesario a sus hijos para que no pasaran hambre. 
Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar ropa, zapatos, chinelas y adornos alusivos a la navidad y productos varios para vender y mejorar la calidad de su servicio y productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella nos cuenta que piensa comprar un freezer nuevo y dos vitrinas para su negocio e ir mejorando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Martha, age 48, is a merchant and has a small store. She lives in Leon. She is the single mother of two independent children. She inherited her store from her mother, who gave her the business so that she could support her children. Martha is a single mother and her mother is her only support. She is now the owner and administrator of the store, which has grown bit by bit. Through this business, she has been able to provide for her children and ensure that they never went hungry.
She is taking out this loan for the purchase of clothing, shoes, slippers, Christmas decorations, and other products to sell so that she can improve her service and offer more products to her customers. She tells us that she also plans to buy a new freezer and two display cases for her business, so that she can improve bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, slippers, and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Yadir Sujeiry

texts.es:
Madre soltera con tres hijos a su cargo de siete, ocho y catorce años respectivamente. Con grandes sueños Yadir quiere comprar una máquina industrial para poder hacer de mejor manera y con mejor calidad los diferentes productos navideños y artesanías que sabe hacer con mucha perfección como peluches, almohadas, lámparas, entre otros productos que le solicitan sus clientes.

La compra de insumos para poder fabricar sus creaciones es un gran apoyo que se dará con la adquisición del crédito, además de comprar la máquina que le optimizará mucho más los tiempos de fabricación. 

Para ella sus tres hijos son lo más importante y por ello quiere emprender de forma muy organizada su microempresa y le pondrá alma, corazón y vida a su gran proyecto de vida.
texts.en: A single mother with three children in her care who are 7, 8 and 14 years old respectively,  Yadir has big dreams: she wants to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to make the Christmas decorations and crafts that she knows how to make with much perfection still better and with improved quality.  She makes stuffed toys, pillows and lamps, among other products her customers request.  The purchase of supplies to make her creations is a great help that she’ll get thanks to the loan.  Besides, the purchase of the machine will greatly improve the time it takes her to make them.  For her, her three children are most important and this is why she wants to run her micro business in a very organized way; she will put soul, heart and live into her great life project.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a married woman who has four children. Yolanda is 50 years old, and resides at Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. 

Yolanda owns and operates a business venture, raising pigs to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 10,600 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Yolanda has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Yolanda wants to make improvements of her house and to support the completion of education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future .

loans.name: Nuestra Pasión Por El Trabajo Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Nuestra pasión por el trabajo" es de la ciudad de Ybycui, son 12 mujeres muy unidas, trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Ellas tienen como objetivo principal ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo del comité. Comentan que vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las miembros es la señora Liz, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Comenta que le va muy bien en las ventas ya que siempre tiene muy buenos productos, además de eso la simpatía con que trata a las clientas. Una de sus metas es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de varios cosméticos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes. Ella al igual que sus amigas del grupo está muy agradecidas con la fundación.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuestra pasión por el trabajo" is located in the city of Ybycui and comprised of 12 women who are very united, hard-working and enterprising.  Their main goal is to help their families through their work group.  They saw what a great opportunity it was to participate in the women's program at the Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members is Liz who sells cosmetics.  She says sales volume is high because she always has good products, and treats her customers with kindness.  One of her goals is to continue growing her business so she can help her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy various cosmetics to be able to fill customer orders.  She, and all her friends in the group, are very grateful to the Fundación.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is 51 years old and married with six children. His business is to make pillows to sell. He has been in the business for eight years and has employed three people.He also earns extra income from the sales of used clothes. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy wool clothes to use in making the pillows

loans.use: To buy wool clothes to make pillows

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang, 28, is married and lives with her husband and two school-age children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has successfully grown and sold rice for over ten years. For over two years her husband has been renting out sound equipment.

In order to improve her husband’s business, Nang is requesting a loan of 550 USD to purchase a generator for her husband’s equipment rental business. By expanding his business her husband would be able to earn more money.

Nang would like to refurbish her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for her husband’s equipment rental business.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a very hard working woman who sells shawl by clothing. She has been in business for four years so she has many customers who request her bed sheet and shawl. She is 27 years old and lives with his life partner. Her husband is responsible for entire family. Nadia wants to stock her business for the winter season in order to have enough variety to offer customers. Therefore she is requesting a loan through BRAC Pakistan to buy clothing, bed sheet and shawl to offer her customers.
Nadia and her family will be thankful to the KIVA’s lender and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy bed sheet anshaall for her bussiness

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
I am 46 years old and an active member of Konguini Thayu Women Group and my activity in the group is rules controller which I have held since the group was formed in 2003.  Prior to joining the group I did not know that I can enforce group rules and regulations. 

I  sell my rice in diffrent parts of Central Kenya that is in Kagio, Kangari Karatina and Embu.  I buy as a wholesaler and sell to other retailers who inturn sell to small towns and individual customers.  The group revolving fund is not swift enough to cater for all members at the same time and this calls for external funding to cover the gap.  The business currently needs support to maintain the level of stock so that I do not dissapoint my customers because the demand is very high.

loans.use: To increase my stock of Rice to meet the demand of my customers.

loans.name: Deria Xochitl

texts.en:
Xochitl is married and is mother of two little ones. She works at her grocery store business with her mother, who was the founder of the business. At the time she realized that supporting her children was of primary importance, especially after her husband emigrated to the US in search for a job. She decided to join forces with her Mom with the money she receives from her husband. She waits for the waits for the day that her husband will be able to come back home so that they can all be together again, and this will only happen when she has managed to have an established and successful business. This is why she works so hard day after day.

She requires a loan of $475 that she plans to invest in the purchase of greater quantities of merchandise to expand her business. You can help Xochitl realize her dream of bringing her husband home. Don't hesitate, she needs you and appreciates your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Xochitl es casada y madre de dos pequeños, ella comienza el negocio de venta de abarrotes con su madre, quien es la iniciadora del proyecto, pues en aquel momento la necesidad de mantener y sacar adelante a sus hijos era indispensable, pues su esposo emigro a USA ante la falta de empleo. Es por ello que con el dinero que el le manda desde allá decidió asociarse con su madre. Ella sólo espera el momento en que su esposo pueda egresar para estar todos juntos de nuevo y esto sólo sucederá cundo ella pueda tener un negocio bien establecido y remunerado. Es por ello que trabaja muy duro día a día.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismo que planea invertir en la comprar de mayores volúmenes de mercancía y de esta manera lograr hacer crecer su negocio. Tú puedes ayudar a Xochitl a cumplir el sueño de volver a estar junto con su esposo, no lo dudes más, ella te necesita y agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame Martha is a resident of this town and operates a drinking spot where she sells a variety of drinks. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.en:
Herlinda sells cosmetics and perfume throughout her community. She usually travels door to door offering her products but also sells some from her home. She allows her clients to pay her for their purchases in weekly installments in order to maker her products much more accessible.

Herlinda used her first loan to invest in new products and to fix her home. She is happy with the results as she has been able to witness the growth of her business. She now makes fliers in order to market her products and announce special sales. Her family is now much more involved in marketing her products as they see that she sells quality items at affordable prices. She is very grateful for the loan and hopes she will be able to continue to grow with a new loan she will use to invest in more products.

Herlinda has four kids, three of which are still in school. She hopes that by generating more income she can continue to pay for their educations and make improvements to their home.

loans.use: Buy more cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Poeun

texts.en: Mrs. Poeun S. M. is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She and her husband work in a rice paddy growing vegetables, and they sell them in their community or sometimes in a market. With this business activity, they can earn up to $7.30 each day. This loan will be used to purchase more seeds and to buy a plot of land to expand their crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and a plot of land to expand her crops.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina is a widow with four children. She loves sales, which is why she started her own beauty supply shop four years ago, relying on her many friendships. Her enjoyment of sales and her need to earn money to support led her to open the business. She also has the ability to get along with all types of people, and she loves what she does; she'd love to continue her business.

Armandina is requesting a loan for $275 to buy seasonal merchandise to cover her orders and increase sales. She is offering to pay the loan in three months. She and her children thank you very much in advance for the support you'll give them to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Armandina es una mujer viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, a ella le encantan las ventas y fue por eso que hace 8 años atrás empezó con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ya que ella cuenta con muchas amistades y combinando su gusto por las ventas más la necesidad de generar ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, fueron los motivos que la llevaron a emprender su negocio. Ella también tiene capacidad para relacionarse con todo tipo de personas y le gusta mucho lo que hace, por ello desea continuar con su negocio.

Armandina está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 275 para comprar mercadería de temporada ya que ya tiene pedidos por cubrir y desea incrementar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella y sus hijos te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal beauty supplies

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter is 30 years old and lives with his 26 year old wife Delia Delgado in their own home. Walter repairs and sells cellular phones.

He first began as a cell phone accessory seller, then he completed a course in repairing cell phones since there wasn't anyone in the area where he lives that completed this type of service. Now he has his own locale in the center of the city.

He hopes to have a loan in order to purchase more cellular devices, as many of these devices are being sold today.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Walter tiene 30 años y vive en pareja con Delia Delgado de 26 años en una casa propia. Walter se dedica a la reparación y venta de celulares.

Empezó primeramente como vendedor de accesorios para celular, luego realizó un curso para reparación de celulares ya que en la zona donde el vive no existía nadie que realice este tipo de servicios. Actualmente ya cuenta con un local propio en el centro de la ciudad.

Desea obtener un crédito de manera a comprar más aparatos celulares, ya que la venta de estos aparatos es bastante alta.

loans.use: Purchase of different types of cell phones.

loans.name: Mutebi's Group

texts.en:
Mutebi N. wants to expand her business and construct a permanent stall. Mutebi has a general merchandise retail business and wants to have a permanent stall so that she will be free from the rain.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To construct a permanent stall

loans.name: Aslima

texts.es:
Mrs. Aslima T. has worked since 1999 selling prepared foods in the market of Leon Station. She prepares her food products and later distributes them in different locations in the market. She also delivers her products to some clients, while others arrive at her sales stall to buy the products as "take-away".

Aslima is a single mother supporting three adolescent children. She is the sole provider in the family. From time to time, she decides to apply for a loan from Ceprodel. Not only has Ceprodel never rejected her loan applications, but they have provided her with the capital to buy her raw materials and cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Aslima T. se dedica desde el año 1999 a la actividad de venta de comida en el mercado la Estación de León. Su actividad consiste en elaborar los alimentos y luego distribuirlos en diferentes puntos del mercado hasta entregarlo a sus clientes. De igual manera, otros clientes llegan hacia su puesto y compran los alimentos para llevarlos.

Es madre soltera y con tres hijos adolescentes a los que tiene que apoyar por ser el único sustento de su hogar. En el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar créditos en CEPRODEL, los que no le han sido negados sino que le han sido otorgados para la compra de su materia prima para la elaboración de sus alimentos, de igual manera los ha utilizado para la manutención de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the food products

loans.name: Vom

texts.en: Mrs. Vom V., 26, works as a weaver and normally earns around $3 a day of profit. To enable the family to have a better life, her husband, Mr. Ry Mao, works as a gardener, usually earning $2 a day. This couple hopes to borrow  $650 from Kiva to purchase a motor-bike in order to reduce the costs of Mr. Mao's commute.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike.

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Mrs. Chak V., 48, is a mother of five children and owns a plot of farmland growing rice. On average, she earns about two dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Song Heak, 29, is a garment worker. He earns approximately three dollars a day. Two of her children are married and live away from home and one other works in a garment factory with a salary $60 per month. The other two children help her grow rice.

Mrs. V. is requesting a loan to make a stable for her buffalos and to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: To make a stable for buffalos and repair the the family home

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Propositos Group

texts.en:
Ana is taking out her first loan with Esperanza, along with the other nine members in her group. She has asked for this loan to improve and expand her business, the manufacture of curtains and linens.

Ana lives in the city of Santiago, the second-largest city in the Dominican Republic, with her husband and two small children. Her goal is to expand her business. Within the next two years, she hopes to have a factory and not just a small business that she runs by herself. She dreams of providing a safe and healthy upbringing to her children. She wants to teach them to become hardworking individuals and help them go to college. For herself, Ana dreams of becoming a successful and strong businesswoman, and improving her family's economic status.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and Ana herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To buy materials for high-quality curtains and linens.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy K. is 30-years-old and lives with her family in the outskirts of town. Her two children are students. Besides taking care of the house and the children, she also works part time.

Thy was hired by the local villager to harvest crops such as radish on a huge farm. When she has money she purchases an amount of radishes and resells them at the Deumkor market. Deumkor market is where most of the crop vendors go to buy the vegetables and resell in local markets. She earns approximately $2.50. Her husband is a gas truck conductor and earns approximately three dollars per day.

Thy would like to use her loan to purchase a motorbike for transportation to the Deumkor market. The rest of the money would be used to purchase radishes for pickling.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation to the farm and market

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat S. is a vendor selling drinking water and soft drinks on a stand around the ferry station and earns about $3 each day. Her husband (in the photo) is a driver and makes about $4 per day. This couple has two children and they are too young to attend school. Since they first heard about Credit they wanted a loan to purchase a motorbike to run a taxi business. Her husband will use the motor to earn an additional income when he is free from driving a car.

loans.use: Khat would like to purchase a motor-taxi for her husband to run part time.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is a single mother with a lot of responsibility. She cares not only for her young son, but also watches her brothers and sisters. (Her brothers and sisters are still students, while her parents are getting on in years.)

Thanks to her farm work, Maribel has been able to cover household expenses and it’s for this reason that she works hard day after day to improve her crops. She is worried, however, because she cannot afford the high cost of natural and chemical fertilizers. Maribel is requesting this loan to improve her crops. She hopes you will be able to help her obtain the money she needs to continue supporting her brothers and sisters as well as take care of her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Maribel es una madre soltera, y tiene una gran responsabilidad, no tan sólo por su pequeño hijo, sino de sus hermanos por quienes también vela, ya que sus padres son ancianos y sus hermanos aún son estudiantes.

Gracias a su trabajo como agricultora ha sabido sobrellevar los gastos dentro de su familia y es por ellos que día tras día se esfuerza cada día más para mejorar sus cultivos. Sin embargo, los costosos abonos y fertilizantes la tienen preocupada ya que no puede adquirirlos y solicita este préstamo para la mejora de sus cultivos y espera que usted pueda ayudarla a conseguir el dinero que le hace falta y así seguir apoyando a sus hermanos y velar por el crecimiento de su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of natural and chemical fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Née en 1983, Monsieur A. Komlan a abandonné ses études primaires faute de moyens. Elle s’est adonnée aux activités de fabrication de pagne traditionnel communément appelé « kété »  qui lui permet de joindre les deux bouts. Mariée, il a cinq (05) enfants à sa charge. Il ne recule pas devant ses activités et sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’acheter l’équipement et les fourniture nécessaires en de produire de plus grande quantité et dans un laps de temps  et de facto augmenter ses revenus pour l’améliorations des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1983, Mr. Komlan A. quit primary school due to a lack of means. He devoted himself to the business of making traditional pagnes cloth called “kété” that enables him to make ends meet. Married, he has five children in his care. He doesn’t shrink from his work and is requesting financing that will enable him to buy the equipment and supplies necessary to produce more and, after a time, to actually increase his income to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell cloth

loans.name: Donatien

texts.fr: Né le 24/05/1982 à Sainte Cécile, un quartier de la capitale économique du BENIN,  monsieur D. Donatien est photographe de formation et exerce cette activité depuis 7 ans. Il est marié à DANDJINOU Adèle et est père d'un enfant ( Marina âgé d'un an). Il a démarré petit à petit et dispose aujourd'hui de  son atelier à Tokpa, le plus grand marché de la sous-région, où lui même habite depuis une dizaine d'année. C'est pour satisfaire au mieux ses clients dans les activités de photographie qu'il a sollicité ce prêt. Il est à son quatrième crédit à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on May 24th, 1982 in Sainte Cécile, a neighborhood in the economic capital of Benin, Mr. Donatien D. is a trained photographer and has been in business for seven years. He is married to Adèle Dandjinou and is the father of one child, Marina, who is one-year old. He slowly worked his way up in the industry and now runs his own shop in Topka, the largest marketplace in the region, where he has lived for about 10 years. He is requesting this loan so he can adequately respond to customer demand. This is his fourth loan with ALIDE.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of photography materials

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Isabel, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confección de lencería y todo tipo de prendas para damas, caballeros y niños, en su pequeño taller ubicado en su propia casa, en el Jr. Bolognesi  Nº 1095, Ella confecciona para luego salir a venderlos, así mismo trabaja en base a pedidos. Sus clientes son amigos, familiares y personas que llegan gracias a la recomendación de sus clientes ya existentes a quienes ella los trata muy bien para mantenerlos y asegurar sus ventas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas de diversos colores y variedades para la confección de todo tipo de prendas, elásticos, blondas, cierres y todo lo que se requiere en la realización de sus trabajos. Desea contar con un buen stock porque sabe que ya llegan las fiestas de fin de año y ahí es cuando le llegan muchos pedidos.

Maria Isabel tiene  40 años de edad, vive con 01 de sus 02 hijos quien aún depende de ella y es la razón para seguir trabajando con mucho entusiasmo porque quiere darle una buena educación. Es una mujer muy independiente, amigable y emprendedora. Su meta es poner una tienda de vestidos para novias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel is a member of the financial group "Mujeres Virtuosas," (Virtuous Women) and she lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She makes lace and many kinds of clothing items for men, women and children in her small workshop located in her own home. She makes the clothing and then goes to the market to sell them, as well as making items on commission. Her clients are her friends, family and those who come to her based on recommendations. She treats her customers well because she wants to keep them and to assure her sales. This loan will be repaid in 6 months and with it, she will purchase many different colored threads, fabrics, elastics, and zippers, among other things she needs to assemble her clothing items. She would like to maintain a large stock because the end of year parties are coming up and she will receive many requests for new clothing items. Maria Isabel is 40 years old and she lives with one of her two children, who still depends on her, which is why she continues to work with as much enthusiasm as she does, because she wants to give him a good education. She is an independent, friendly and hard working woman. Her goal is to open a store with bridal gowns.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase threads, fabrics, elastics and zippers, etc

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 55 años, es casada, D. ese matrimonio feliz tiene tres robustos hijos y muy trabajadores en la agricultura, a pesar D. que son muy pequeños. Catalina es ama D. casa, su esposo es agricultor, para que su esposo se vaya a la chacra, ella tiene que levantarse a la 5.00 am. y preparar un buen desayuno, a base D. cafecito con yucas, y en horas del medio día va llevando el almuerzo para su esposo y le ayuda cuando es necesario. Pero los dias viernes se va en búsqueda D. plátanos verdes, porque ha visto que ese negocio es muy rentable, y gana mucho más que vender los plátanos en su chacra, la única dificultad que tiene es sacar su carga desD. los montes, casi siempre no hay carros que ingresen, solo a veces motos, pero cobran muy caro. E.s su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprara plátanos y el líquido para la maduración, además D. aumentar su propia producció, espera con el tiempo, mejorar su calidad D. vida gracias a su esfuerzo
texts.en:
Catalina is a married 55-year-old woman. Out of that happy marriage came three robust children who work hard in agriculture despite their young age. Catalina is a homemaker whose husband is a farm worker. In order for her husband to go to the farm, she has to wake up at 5:00 am and prepare him a good breakfast, which consists of coffee and cassava. At noon, she takes him his lunch and helps him whenever necessary. On Fridays, she picks green plantains because she has noticed that this is a lucrative business, and she makes more money then when she sells plantains in her farm. The only problem is when she has to bring her crops from the mountain because it is accessible to trucks. Sometimes, motorcycles can be used, but it is too expensive. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase plantains and the liquid for the ripening process. AsiD. from increasing her own production, she also hopes to improve her quality of life over time thanks to her efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in crop fields and purchase green plantains

loans.name: Titi

texts.en:
This is Titi S., age forty-five. Titi was born in Tanbiyama, about eleven miles from Makeni City. She currently resides in Makeni, where she is married and running her business. Her husband is a retired police officer and the two have seven children. The eldest is now grown, two are in college, three are in secondary school, and one is in primary school. 

Titi sells a number of items both inside and outside her home. She sells items, such as fire wood, rice, sugar, palm oil, mints, biscuits, batteries, oil, flour and a lot more. 

This will be her very first loan from SMT. She is requesting a loan of Le 2,000,000 to help her strengthen her business.
With this loan, Titi will increase her business by buying more goods to add to her current stock. She will use some of it to buy firewood, three bags of rice, two barters (five gallons make a barter) of red palm oil (the most popular and most abundant cooking oil), and two more barters of white palm oil. She buys some of the goods in Makeni. She buys the palm oil from neighboring villages and the firewood at a location called Mile Fourteen. A barter of red palm oil costs her Le 90,000; a barter of white costs her Le 80,000. A bag of rice costs her Le 108,000.

Titi thanks God for her business, because it is running well for her. With the profit that this loan will generate for her, Titi will enroll herself into an Osusu (rotational savings) group in order to help repay her monthly loan on time.  She will also use some for domestic purchases, such as buying bathing and laundry soaps, kerosene for her lamps and food for her family.

loans.use: To buy firewood, three bags of rice, two barters of red palm oil, and two barters of white palm oil.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha C. tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende, azúcar, arroz, fideo, galletas, dulces y también refrescos.
Vive en la zona de alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz tiene dos hijos que están a su cargo y su esposo es empleado en una empresa privada.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería ( azúcar, arroz fideo, refrescos y otros)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
texts.en:
Martha C. has a grocery store where she sells sugar, rice, noodles, crackers, candy, and also beverages. She lives in the Irpavi zone of the city of La Paz, and has two children who are in her care. Her husband is an employee at a private enterprise. The loan will be destined to purchase merchandise (sugar, rice, noodles, beverages, and other items). This is the first time she requests a loan in Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es casada y tiene hijos.  Su negocio es la venta de productos de consumo diario, como arroz, maíz, jabón y aceite.  Ella tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado municipal de San Martín Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, también en su casa se dedica a la crianza de marranos.  2 de sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio, los otros estudian todavía, su esposo también le ayuda por algunos momentos en el día, el se dedica a cortar el pelo.  Su préstamo lo necesita para invertir en más producto, ya que su negocio necesita estar bien surtido.  Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y puedan salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
Paulina is married and has children. She sells daily foodstuffs such as rice, corn, soap and oil. She has a stall in the municipal market of San Martín Jilotepeque, in Chimaltenango. She also raises pigs at her home. Two of her children help her with her business, the other are still studying. Her husband also helps her sometimes during the day: he is a hairdresser. She needs this loan to invest in more goods as her business needs to be well stocked. Her dream is that her children continue their studies so that they can get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy daily foodstuffs to retail

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.en:
Adolfina J. is a Tanzanian woman. She is a micro entrepreneur. She is married with four children. Two of her children are in primary school.

Adolfina runs a café business in the Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. She has been in the business for two years. Her family's daily demands rely on the business income she earns.

Now, she needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Placida Claudia

texts.es:
Placida es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Placida vive en la comunidad D. Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Placida es casada, tiene 57 años y 8 hijos, Placida junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo D. peones, sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Placida se dedica a la compra D. tara, cochinilla y tuna.
Placida necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago D. los peones que labran los ladrillos.
Los sueños D. Placida son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena alimentación y estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Placida is a member of the Orcasitas Microfinance Institute. She lives in the community of Orcasitas, which is located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. Placida is a 57-year-old married mother with 8 children. She and her husband produce handmaD. bricks, for which they have the support of laborers. They sell their products in their own community. Placida also sells tara pods, cochineal insects and prickly pears for a living. Placida needs a 900.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in paying the laborers who cut the bricks. Placida dreams of improving her business and offering her children good nutrition and a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay laborers

loans.name: Yanet Luisa

texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Santo Domingo Village Bank. She is 41 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children. Two of her children are adults, while the youngest is in fifth grade. For the past 12 years, Yanet has worked in a hair salon, where she does cuts, color, perms, highlights and any other service that her clients request.

Yanet is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to put towards paying for her children’s education. Her two older children are studying nursing and accounting, and both are almost ready to graduate. After her children graduate from college, Yanet’s dream is to open her own hair salon.

loans.use: Pay for children's college education

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes quiere dar una buena vejez. Desde muy niña le gustó trabajar, actualmente atiende en un restaurante muy conocido de la ciudad de Juliaca, es una trabajadora muy ágil y atenta, pues sola atiende a cerca de 200 personas que entran diariamente al restaurante. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y espera que en el futuro pueda tener su propio restaurante. Este es el primer préstamo de Nancy con MFP y espera poderlo pagar a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita incrementará el monto para posteriormente poner su restaurante.
texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old, and a very responsible and hardworking woman. She lives in her parents' home and she wishes to give them a happy old age. Since she was very young, Nancy has enjoyed working, currently she works in a well known restaurant in the city of Juliaca. She is a lively and attentive worker, and she alone serves the nearly 200 people people who visit the restaurant each day. What she likes most about her job is conversing with the customers. She has spent 4 years at this job and hopes that in the future she could have her own restaurant. This is Nancy's first loan with Kiva partner MFP and she hopes to be able to repay it on time, as she doesn't want to have problems with the other members of her village bank, where she is well-liked and respected. With the money requested she will increase her total in order to eventually fund her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for her own restaurant

loans.name: Karmin

texts.en: Karmin is a 45 year old single woman living in Furn El Chebbak in Mount Lebanon. She has owned her own fruit and vegetable store since 2006. Today, she is requesting a loan for $1000. She will use this loan to redecorate and make the shop more heartwarming in order to attract a wider range of clients.

loans.use: To redecorate her fruit and vegatable shop.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
To assist her husband in providing for their family, Lilibeth started a business selling vegetables. She has already successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a second loan to add needed capital to her business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 for her business and for the cultivation of her vegetable garden where she also gets some of her produce. Lilibeth says that her business is very helpful to her family. She is glad that she has a husband who is very supportive of her business. They are working together very hard and hope that they will be able to start saving a little for the education of their children.

Lilibeth is from the village of Minallo Naguillan, Isabela. She is 23 years old and is married to John G. who is 35 years old. Her husband works in Cauayan, Isabela, generating a small daily salary. The couple has already been blessed with one daughter, Joanna G., who is 3 years old. At the moment, Joanna is serving as their inspiration, giving them the will to persevere and to be more diligent in their work.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jesús Es Mi Ayudador Group

texts.es:
el grupo Jesus es mi Ayudador esta integrado por tres personas que se conocen desde hace varios años, ya que ellos reciden en la misma colonia por muchos años.
las actividades que ellos realizan se detallan a continuacion:
la sra. Lucia E. tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 1 hija, la cual esta estudiando su segundo año de carrera.
Lucia tiene una pulperia en la colonia brisas del sur y ha logrado obtener una muy buena clientela debido a la atencion que presta a cada persona que llega a comprar a su negocio, es una persona emprendedora y desde muy joven le ha gustado el negocio.
su mayor sueño es tener un super mercadito y que su hija tenga un titulo universitario.
la sra. Maria I. tiene 64 años de edad, esta casada y tuvo 11 hijos de los cuales solo uno esta con ella ya que los demas estan casados.
ella tiene una pulperia desde hace 3 años, con la cual a podido dar el estudio a su ultima hija, ella nos comento que sus hijos le ayudan economicamente y que esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio, su mayor sueño es que su hija se gradue de la universidad.
el sr.Enyel C. tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su familia, el se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias, tiene 1 año de realizar esta actividad, el vende su producto en el mercado y en diferentes colonias de esta ciudad.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Jesús es mi Ayudador (Jesus is my Helper) Loan Group is composed of three people who have known one another for several years since they have lived in the same area for many years. The activities that they are engaged in are as follows: Señora Lucía E. is 38 years old, married and has one daughter who is in her second year of career studies. Lucía has a grocery store in the Brisas del Sur (Southern Breezes) neighborhood and has succeeded in acquiring a very good clientele because of the service she gives to everyone who comes to shop in her store. She is an enterprising person and has enjoyed business since she was young. Her greatest dream is to have a super market and that her daughter will obtain a university degree. Señora María I. is 64 years of age, married and has had eleven children, only one of whom is still with her and the rest are married. She has had a grocery store for three years now with which she has been able to educate her last daughter. She tells us that her children are helping her economically and that she is requesting the loan in order to stock up her business. Her greatest dream is that her daughter will graduate from the university. Señor Enyel C. is 20 years old, single and lives with his family. He sells shoes and sandals and he's been doing this for one year. He sells his products in the market and in different neighborhoods in the city. All of these people need the loan in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, bread, coffee, chicken, beef, pork,  bleach, bath soap, laundry soap, shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Lesi

texts.en: Lesi F., 37, is married with 4 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public 4 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about US $120).  SPBD loans are Lesi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Tạ Thị

texts.en:
H. Tạ Thị (1708060226) is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by H. from TYM Fund.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Bihosiyat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Сангинова больше трех лет кредитуется в нашей организации. Ей очень нравится условия кредитования нашей организации. Период кредитования она не только расширила товарооборот но и улучшила финансовое положении семьи. Хосият просит очередной займ для закупки  пряников, сахара, сгущенного молока, яиц и тд.
texts.en:
S. has been working with our organization for over three years. She likes our organization's credit terms very much. After obtaining credit, she not only increased her product turnover, but also improved her family financial situation. Hosiyat is requesting her next loan for the purchase of pryaniks (ginger honey cakes), sugar, condensed milk, eggs and etc.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pryaniks, 20 bags of sugar, condensed milk and eggs

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa tiene 60 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa que construyeron hace 20 años y donD. guarda sus mayores tesoros. DesD. que contrajo matrimonio tuvo que dedicarse a diversas actividades, las cuales ayudaron a consolidar su economía y el negocio D. ropa que tiene en su casa, donD. atienD. los pedidos D. sus clientes. Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 3 años, atienD. desD. las 9 D. la mañana hasta las 6 D. la tarD. y durante el tiempo que está en su negocio trata D. mantener una amena conversación con sus clientes para fortalecer los lazos D. amistad. Pero lo difícil D. esta labor es conseguir la mercadería, pues entre tantas tiendas hay que buscar prendas D. calidad y precios cómodos. Es así que su mayor anhelo es ampliar su tienda con diversas prendas D. vestir y algunos artículos para el hogar, debido a los pedidos que recibe continuamente, los cuales no pueD. entregar por falta D. capital D. trabajo. Este es su préstamo número 13 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, sus anteriores créditos le permitieron crecer comercialmente, así como a sus compañeras D. banco comunal, pues D. manera integral trabajan en diversas actividades en beneficio D. su  grupo. Los 3000 soles que solicita le permitirán incrementar su mercadería y hacer entrega D. los pedidos pendientes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Saom's Group

texts.en:
There are two low-income people who are jointly taking this loan.

One of these people, Saom V., 39 years old, is a married mother caring for four children, all of whom go to the secondary school. Saom V. and her husband earn a living by cultivating rice. However, their current income is not enough for the family’s daily expenses.

Saom V. hopes to use the loan from HKL as capital to invest in a new suitable trade as a rice trader. She will order rice in bulk to store and then sell to gain income.

The other borrower, Mrs. Saom S., 37, sells cooking supplies and she requests a loan to grow her investment.

loans.use: To invest in a new suitable trade as a rice trader

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida H. is from the village of Gumbil,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Nida is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nida is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Nida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria  es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntos, es casada, tiene 49 años y dos hijos mayores, pero son solteros y viven con ella.
Maria empezó vendiendo queso por pedidos, pero la necesitad económica aumentaba y empezó a vender ropa, ofreciendo a sus mismos clientes, y tuvo la idea de empezar hacer chocotejas, conoció una chica que le enseño y se puso a vender y le esta yendo bien.   
En finca, gracias a los prestamos que dan esta progresando poco a poco, su capital aumento 
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de ropa que le han pedido y compra de insumos para la preparación de chocotejas.
El sueño de Maria es importar sus chocotejas y tener un local donde pueda vender.

loans.use: compra de ropa que le han pedido

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Djekafo de l’association Miniankaton sont tous des femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, une préfecture de la région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe font le petit commerce d’articles divers à Tominian tels les produits alimentaires, la lingerie etc. 
Pour rentabiliser leurs activités, les membres du groupe Djekafo de l’association Miniankaton ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit  de l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, ils sont à leur premier prêt.   
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour l’achat d’une importante quantité de : divers condiments alimentaires et de céréales.  Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des grossistes de la place et des producteurs et effectuent leurs ventes en détail et au comptant au grand marché de Tominian à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Les membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser chacun un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000 FCFA à 22 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the Djekafo group belonging to the Miniankaton association are all married women from the town of Tominian, a prefecture of the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and have an average age of 30 and on average, at least 6 children each.

The women of this group sell various small items in Tominian, such as foodstuffs, underwear, etc. In order to make their businesses more productive, the members of this Djekafo group decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first loan.

This loan will be used to buy a large quantity of various condiments and cereals for resale. They buy from local wholesalers and from farmers and make their sales retail and for cash, at the big open-air market of Tominian, to a clientele composed essentially of women.

Each of the members of the Djekafo group expects to make a monthly profit of 15,000 to 22,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Moufideh

texts.en:
Moufideh is a 40 year old widow who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with her three children. Moufideh has owned a clothing shot since 2003. She sells women’s clothes like dresses, skirts, t-shirts, tops, as well as women’s accessories. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the winter season and coming holidays. This is the first time that Moufideh has requested a loan. 
Moufideh is speciA. in her work because of her experience and the way she treats her clients. Her clients are her family members, friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have self-confidence since she never worked before, and faced some financiA. issues. She decided on doing this business after her husband’s death in order to improve her family’s financiA. situation. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is excited to receive a Kiva loan. She is hoping for a loan of 100,000 NGN. She will use this loan to invest in a business selling provisions, which she will buy in bulk to get a better price. With this loan she will be able to build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her family.

Patience is 32 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es productor de leche de vaca; tiene dos vacas productoras de leche de donde proviene su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre su manutención y de su familia vive en la casa de sus padres en la comunidad Callutaca – Ticuyo, Provincia Los Andes a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una vaquilla para su posterior producción de leche.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del prestamos solicitado por Fernando.
texts.en:
Fernando is a milk producer. He has two dairy cows that provide a source of income to cover his expenses. His family lives in the house of his parents located in the community of Callutaca – Ticuyo, Los Andes Province, which is two hours away from the city of El Alto.

His loan will be used to buy a heifer for later milk production. This is Fernando’s first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicated that he qualified for approval of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy heifer

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther tiene 30 años y  vive al lado de su esposo y sus tres hijos, en su acogedora casa que es  propia.Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la atención de su restaurante, y su tienda de comestibles, ambos negocios  funcionan  en su casa, lo que  le resulta muy cómodo, ya que le proporciona  la opción de permanecer  al cuidado de sus hijos y poder atenderlos cuando la necesitan. Su rutina diaria empieza a las 7 de la mañana cuando apertura   la tienda con su joven ayudante, para posteriormente empezar con la preparación  del almuerzo que ofrecerá en el restaurante;  así  puede atender paralelamente ambos negocios , hasta que cae la  tarde, cuando su restaurante se convierte en polllería (lugar de venta de pollo a la brasa). El trabajo es cansado pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo logrará  el progreso para toda su  familia y por este motivo es  que realiza tantos sacrificios.Es su primer préstamo con  MFP y promete ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas ya que sabe que solo así podrá salir adelante.Con el dinero del crédito comprará mayor cantidad de productos para su restaurante, pero además invertirá en la bodega, ya que por fiestas navideñas habrá gran demanda de productos, y quiere aprovechar para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Esther, 30, lives with her husband and three children in her own cozy house. For the last two years she has run an eatery and a grocery store in her house. This is very comfortable for her because she can care for her three children while working. Her daily routine starts at 7am when she opens her store with her young assistant. Later, she starts to prepare the meals she will serve in her eatery. This way, she can tend to both businesses at the same time. In the early evening, the eatery becomes a chicken shop (a place where she sells grilled chicken). The work is tiring but she knows that this effort will lead to better conditions for her entire family so she is motivated to make the sacrifice. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to be punctual with her repayments since she knows that this is the only way to get ahead. With the funds she will buy products for her eatery but also will invest in stock for her store since the Christmas season means higher demand for products and she wants to take advantage of this to earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business and improve customer service.

loans.name: Simuy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Simuy U., age 38, lives in Prey Phnhi village in Takeo province. She is the village bank president for a village bank loan group consisting of eight people. The individual members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Simuy U. and her husband, Mr. Ngin Heng Maol, are farmers who own a 1.4-hectar field for the cultivation of rice. At present, the crop needs to be harvested, and she has decided to ask for a loan in order to hire laborers to help harvest her rice crop. Aside from farming, she is a silk weaver, an activity that allows her to earn a little additional income to help support her family. She is the mother of five children: the youngest is a baby and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice crop

loans.name: Balongi Plus Group

texts.en:
Nelly Bonjeka M. is the manager of the group “Balongi Plus” made up of 29 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE DRC in order to develop their businesses.

She is 40 years old, is married, and has three children who go to school.

Nelly’s main business is selling vegetables and sausages in her area. She has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1985 and each week, her business brings in a profit of $90. She likes her business and she is working hard to achieve her goal of one day opening a general store.

Nelly is a loyal client of HOPE DRC and has already received eight different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use this next loan to buy 10 kilograms of sausages to resell with the aim of increasing her profits.

loans.use: To purchase 10 kgs of sausages to resell at a profit

loans.name: La Unidad 4 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator of her group, L. Unidad (The Unity), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a poor, rural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Dominga is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado (small corner-store) by supplying it with more merchandise of the basic necessities such as rice, beans, cooking oil and matches.

Dominga will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing school supplies. Her longterm dream is own her own home and she hopes that by utilizing savings through Esperanza she will attain that. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, cooking oil and matches for her store

loans.name: Redelma

texts.en:
Redelma S. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Redelma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Redelma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Redelma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Redelma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Redelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Redelma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Redelma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun S. is a widow with three children, living in Preaek Bak village in Kandal province. Two of her children attend the local school while the youngest one is 4 years old.

Mrs. Khoeun S. is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living for herself and her family. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 Riels from AMK to buy corn seed, sesame seed and fertilizer to support the growth of her crops.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, sesame seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred, 42, is a pig and rice farmer in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He started farming in 2000. Now he manages one-hectare rice field and 2 pigs. He takes good care two children in his family, the eldest is 9. He wants his children to have a bright future that's why he works hard in the farm in order to provide their needs.

He joins Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in order to avail a loan of 15,000 Php. He lacks capital and sought help from a CEVI. This loan will help in providing feeds for the pigs and fertilizers for his rice field.

loans.use: feeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Bissimilai Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Bissimilai” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan SLL 2,400,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses. 

Forty-year-old Fadima K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of the group. She was born in Waterloo, is married to a businessman, and has four children. One of her children is in senior secondary school II and the others are no longer attending school. Fadima has been a businesswoman for more than ten years now. She sells ready-to-wear clothes for both men and women. With her share of this loan (SLL 1,000,000), she will expand her business by buying bales of ready-to-wear clothes for both men and women.

loans.use: Buy bales of ready-to-wear clothes for both men and women

loans.name: C2877 Twuzuzanye Group

texts.en:
Marie Chantal was born in 1981 and is married with three children. The first born is 12 years, the next is 9 years old and the last is 5 years old. Marie Chantal is the leader of a group which is called Twuzuzanye. This group contains six people: five women and one man.

Marie Chantal owns a small shop which sells different kinds of products. Her husband is in the government staff and both they work hardly for the development of their family. Marie Chantal has an experience of four years and her shop is open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Marie Chantal and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to sort out some of the problems they face in their businesses like not being able to satisfy the demands of their customers.

Once the satisfaction of their clients is reached, Marie Chantal and her group will be able to earn more profits to be reinvested in their businesses.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny T. is from the village of KINANGAY SUR CLARIN, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL. She is 42 years old. Zeny is married and has 1 school-aged child. Zeny owns & operates a motor transport service. Zeny has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Zeny joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zeny has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zeny is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Zeny from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann P. is from the barangay of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and blessed with seven children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in buying and selling kitchenware and utensils. She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities. 
In 2006, Mary Ann joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory for her kitchenware and utensils business. This will be her ninth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments and possibly expanding her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her kitchenware and utensils business

loans.name: Uganda Youth Microfinance Co-Operation Limited Group, Kampala

texts.en:
O. Joy has been a fruit and vegetable seller for ten years in Lubaga, central-Kampala. This mother of five worked hard with the assistance of close friends to obtain a footing in this increasingly competitive business.

Joy has mostly been selling fruits and vegetables. One cannot go wrong with this kind of business by virtue of the fact that people depend on the foodstuffs in the course of every day. Joy also ekes out profits from a rental business that she runs concurrently.

In a week, Joy makes over 200,000 shillings. With the hard work that she puts in, however, the future looks promisingly rosy. She needs a loan and, with it, she wants to purchase in bulk fresh fruits and vegetables that she will later sell at her stall.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai S. is 37 years old and she is the village bank president, having been selected by its nine members who live in Samraong Mreah village, Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use their loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Lai S. and her husband, Mr. Sis Nhoem, are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice and they work very hard to support their children. For the farm, Mrs. Lai S. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline and to dig a well. Aside from farming, Mrs. Lai S. also sells corn and sweet potatoes and is able to earn a small income to support her family living.

This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while another one is fO. years old.

Mrs. Chanty Mook, Mrs. Lakk C., Mrs. Chamroeun Ten, and Mrs. Mat Nhim, who are group guarantors, are also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline and to dig a well

loans.name: Hector Ramon

texts.es:
Hector de 42 años de edad habita en la comarca Calderon jurisdiccion de El Ayote junto a su esposa la Sra. Maritza Perez y su hijo de 8 años el cual estudia la primaria.  Hector es pequeño productor que se dedica al cuido de ganado. 

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de comprar 5 terneros para engordarlos y posteriormente venderlos a un mejor precio en donde obtenga ganancias que le permitan mejorar un poco la situacion economica de la familia.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y con la experiencia necesaria para esta actividad.  

Su mayor sueño es poder incrementar sus ingresos para poder darle a su familia las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Hector is 42 years old and lives in the Calderon Shire in the jurisdiction of El Ayote together with his wife Maritza Perez and his son who is 8 and goes to primary school. Hector is a small producer who raises livestock. He is asking for his 2nd loan with the objective of buying 5 calves to fatten and sell latter at a better price so that he obtains some profit that will allow him to improve the economic situation for his family. He relies on the support of his family and has the experience necessary for this activity. His biggest dream is to be able to increase his income to be able to give his family the best conditions possible.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying calves

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam M. has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals. Now Rustam is requesting a loan from IMON International to purchase more calves to raise. Their eventual sale will yield additional profits that will used to support his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
