loans.use: To purchase young cattle and construction materials to improve his cattle-shed

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom S. is 39 years old and sells rice, food, and grocery products in Takeo province. Her business has been around for about nine years and she makes US$ 5 every day. She is married and has three children. Her husband, pictured here, stays at home helping her selling rice and food. Mom S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store

loans.name: Adjoa Sika

texts.fr: M. adjoa est une femme très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de soviépé. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de kpalimé. elle vend son charbon aux femmes de son quartier qui l'utilise pour faire cuir les aliments. elle a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle voudrait se réapprovisionner en achetant 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
M. Adjoa is a very dynamic woman. She is married, has one child and lives with her family in the Soviépé neighbourhood. She gets her supplies in the interior of the country, in the town of Kpalimé. She sells her charcoal to women in the neighbourhood who use it for cooking. She has noticed a decrease in her stock of merchandise. She would like to stock up by purchasing 20 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Martin Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Martín es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya está casado con la Señora Francisca Agüero son padres de dos mujeres.

El Señor Martín es de profesión mecánico dental, realiza los trabajos en A.J. Hermanos consultorio odontología.
También posee una pequeña despensa en su domicilio ubicado en el Barrio Santa Ana de la misma ciudad.

Son personas responsables, eso se ve reflejado en el histórico de pago que posee en nuestra Institución y de las referencias obtenidas de los mismos.

El préstamo en esta ocasión es para la compra mercadería para el negocio de venta de productos de uso domésticos y de primera necesidad como carne, fideos, arroz, panificados, productos para limpieza, todo tipo comestibles, embutidos, enlatados, y otros.
texts.en:
Martín is a returning client of the Paraguaya Foundation.  He is married to Francisca Agüero and they have two grown children.  

Martín is a dental technician who works at A.J. Brothers dental office.  He also owns a small store which is located in his home in the Santa Ana neighborhood of the same city.

They are responsible people, which is reflected in the history of payment they have with the Foundation and the references they were given.

This loan is for the purchase of merchandise for the store, such as household products and necessities like meat, noodles, rice, bread, cleaning products, all types of food, sausages, canned goods, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 46 years old. Gemma is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gemma works hard for her family, especially for the future of her child. She says she wants to give her child a bright future.

Gemma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Gemma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose J. is currently in the business of selling soda and ice cream at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Rose is 30 years old and is married to a businessman. She has five children and two of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Maame Yawa

texts.en:
Elizabeth Maame Yawa A. sells fish and as well cooking oats in the mornings for sale at Elmina. Elizabeth has received junior high education. She is a single parent taking care of seven dependents. Elizabeth is asking to use the loan to enable her to expand her business. She ensures that the general needs of her family are provided for. She plans to educate her children with the additional income. 

In this picture, Maame had already prepared the oats she was going to sell that morning.

loans.use: enable her to expand her business

loans.name: Zerida

texts.en:
Zerida L. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children. Both of her children are currently in school. Zerida has a business of selling vegetables, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Zerida has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase vegetables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zerida hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees.  In the future, Zerida hopes to own a hotel. Zerida is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to use money.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet M. is a 36-year-old married lady with three children. She operates a food kiosk which has been in existence for the past two years. The business is situated at Mjanaheri in Malindi town.

Annet was introduced to KADET LTD by another client who is a registered member of the company. This is her first loan from KADET. The loan amounts to Kshs. 10,000. She is planning to use it to add more stock to the kiosk as well as repair the business structure.

Annet wishes to use the anticipated profit from the business to continue expanding the business and to buy a plot so that she may later be able to own a well-established hotel.  She wants to progress and see her family healthy and her children well-educated.

loans.use: To add more stock, and repair business premises

loans.name: Rolita Maria

texts.en:
Rolita Maria G. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Rolita Maria is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rolita Maria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling health & medicinal products like coffee with nutrients in the local community. Rolita Maria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rolita Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolita Maria is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rolita Maria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angela Isabel

texts.es:
Angela Isabel I. tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Camino Viejo en el municipio de Lejamani, Comayagua. Angela tiene una venta de abarroteria, ella inicìo con este negocio luego de que su esposo se cayera de un arbol de mangos y quedara invalido. Como el esposo de Angela no podia seguir trabajando en su condicion la empresa para la cual èl estaba laborando le cancelo sus prestaciones laborales y con ese dinero Angela empezò a comprar los productos que pondria a la venta en su domicilio. Angela tambien trabaja en los cultivos de pepino porque no tiene otra entrada de dinero y eso le ayuda a llevar el pan de cada dia a su familia.

Ella solicita el prestamo para surtir su pulperia con productos como arroz, manteca, pastas, carnes, lacteos, frijoles, refrescos, dulces, galletas, pan, jugos en caja y enlatados, maseca, etc. Con el apoyo del prestamo su pequeño negocio tendra mas y variados productos, y como su esposo le ayuda a atenderlo èl se sentira muy bien de asistirla. 

Su meta es seguir trabajando cada dia para darle educacion a sus hijos ya que uno de ellos esta en cuarto grado y el otro en primer grado en la escuela, y asi hacerlos personas de bien. Tambien espera que su negocio se mantenga estable y que le genere las suficientes ganancias para sostener a su esposo e hijos. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera ser puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en: dfadasf

loans.use: Comprar productos de abarroteria en general

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a young woman from Qalqilia. She has been working in sewing for a long time, and she was able to save a fair amount of money to start a small business. Hana will rent a shop to open a grocery store.

Hana took out a loan from FATEN to purchase display shelves and stands for the items she will be selling in the store. She also owns a house which she rents out for $70 a month.

Hana is photographed in FATEN's office in their Qalqilia branch.

loans.use: To purchase display stands and shelves for her store.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: Mrs. Pho N. is a 30-year-old married woman. She is a villager who lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Nget Heng, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice and different vegetables to sell. This couple has two children who are attending the local school. The family wants to grow rice in the dry season, but they don’t have enough money to support it. So Mrs. Pho N. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline for growing crops. Her husband is in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for growing crops

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda L. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old and is married. To make a living, Nilda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Guadalupe

texts.es: Mercedes Guadalupe M. D. M. D. 62 años D. edad, vive junto a su hijo, su nuera y dos nietos menores D. edad, junto a los cuales resiD. en Cuscatancingo, municipio ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Con el fin D. salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor, Mercedes trabaja muy duro elaborando prendas D. vestir, para hombres, mujers y niños, las cuales comercializa en su casa D. habitación. Ella posee mucha experiencia y así mismo muchos clientes, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. tela, botones, hilos, agujas y todos los insumos necesarios para elaborar más prendas D. vestir, D. modo que su negocio crezca grandemente.
texts.en: Mercedes Guadalupe M. D. M. is 62 years old and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and two young grandchildren in Cuscatancingo, a city of San Salvador.  In order to get ahead and improve her life, Mercedes works very hard making outfits for men, women, and children that she then sells from her home.  She has a lot of experience and also a lot of customers and for this reason is asking for a loan to buy more fabric, buttons, thread, needles, and other supplies for sewing more outfits so that her business can grow.

loans.use: buy fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia is a married woman who lives in the island of Cebu, Philippines. She earns her living by operating a general store and a load retailer (mobile phone credits) business. Her common-law husband Noel, who is 39 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have two children who are 1 and 10 years old. Ignacia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ignacia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,300, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy more stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future and for the education of her children. Ignacia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juana Leonor

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; la socia tiene 54 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de lavandería ella recoge las sabanas, manteles, servilletas también algunas ropas que le mandan de turistas para que pueda lavarlo y entregarlo planchados al día siguiente o máximo en dos días las piezas grandes , su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio siendo esta actividad que realiza un par de años atrás la cual le trae muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales ya que de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su lavandería y la compra de insumos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, "LOS LIDERES", which is in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Juana is 54 years old, and lives with her partner and three children.  She alternates her daily activity with her laundry service.  She launders bed sheets, tablecloths, napkins and other clothing articles that she receives from tourists for washing and ironing which she delivers the next day, or in 48 hours if the items are large.  She has been running her business out of her home for two years and enjoys the economic and personal satisfaction it gives her as a means of providing for her family.

The member is in need of a loan to cover laundry maintenance costs and to buy supplies.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To cover laundry maintenance costs and to buy supplies

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 43 years old and married to Ben Chepkwony who is a farmer, and they have three children aged 20, 18 and 13 years old.  Salome buys and sell milk in the Kipture trading centre in Kapsabet and has been in the business for a period of five years, getting a monthly income of KES. 12,000.

Salome has applied for a loan of KES. 25,000 from KADET LTD, this being her fourth loan after repaying the previous loans successfully. She intends to use this money to pay the local suppliers of milk from the surrounding areas. 

The income will be used to expand the business as well as to educate her children. Her dream is to see her business expand to another level.

loans.use: to pay milk suppliers, to purchase milk for resale

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
From the Prey Chor district, Chab V. is the one of many people who earns a living with a farming business. On average, she can earn an income about $1 a day. In order to help support in the family, Chab V. works as a casual laborer, who spends most of her time in the construction field. 

Because of unsafe living conditions, Chab V. would like to request the loan to buy wooden planks in order to mend her wall, which is broken. She will use some percentage of the total loan to purchase construction materials to support her husband.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks in order to mend her wall and purchase construction materials for supporting her husband.

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
Flavio, 64 años de edad, casado, es originario de la ciudad de Quillabamba, ubicada en provincia de La Convención departamento del Cusco (Perú), de oficio agricultor y transportista. 

Actualmente, Flavio vive en la comunidad de Arin de la ciudad de Calca dice que el primer préstamo que le otorgaron le fue de gran ayuda pues logro sacar adelante su siembra de maíz, logro comprar los insumos necesarios para la siembra, también pudo terminar de cosechar sus verduras. Su actividad complementaria es brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros interprovincial de la ciudad de Calca y Urubamba y viceversa. 
En esta oportunidad  Flavio requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono y para comprar animales menores como cuyes.
texts.en:
Flavio is 64 years old, married, and originally from the city of Quillabamba, located in the La Convención province in the department of Cusco in Peru.  He works as a farmer and in transportation.

Currently, Flavio lives in the community of Arin in the city of Calca.  He says that the first loan that he was given was a great help and allowed him to move forward with his corn crop, purchase the necessary items for the planting, and finish harvesting his vegetables.  He also works providing an inter-provincial transport service for passengers between Calca and Urubamba.  

Flavio is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and young animals, such as guinea pigs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and young animals, like guinea pigs.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 46 años de edad, el es soltero, vive en un caserío llamado nuevo Anexo San Juan, del distrito de Mórrope a 40 minutos de la ciudad de chiclayo.

Se dedica ala comercialización de animales especialmente a la ganado ovino (ovejas), ganado caprino (cabritos) y caballos, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, este negocio lo desarrolla en el mercado de Lambayeque  y también realiza entregas en su domicilio. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años, en los que a adquirido experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija a su negocio.

Julio está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para poder comprar animales con su respectivo alimento balanceado.  Además ella desea realizar unas mejoras en sus corrales, para mejorar el ambiente en donde cría a sus  animales. 

Julio desea mejorar su calidad  de vida, con esfuerzo y trabajo. Cuenta con buenas referencias, las personas que lo conocen lo describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Julio is 46 years old and single. He lives in a village called Nuevo Anexo San Juan in the district of Mórrope, 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
He works selling animals, especially sheep, goats, and horses, which he keeps in corrals behind his house. He sells his animals in the market at Lambayeque and he also delivers to people's homes. He has been doing this work for many years and has acquired a lot of experiences and has a loyal customer base. 
Julio is requesting a $750 loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals and their appropriate food. He also wants to make some improvements to his corrals to improve the environment in which his animals are raised.
Julio wants to improve his quality of life with his hard work and efforts. He has good references and the people who know him describe him as a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their food, and to make improvements to his corrals.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with five children, three of whom still attend school, while two have graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past eight years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors. Ali faces the major challenges of the high cost of transportation in his business and also seasonality, because during the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate his business. Ali dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar, and to add to his savings toward the purchase of a motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar, and to add to his savings toward the purchase of a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kadiamor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03juin 2011. Il est composé de quatre femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Kardiatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de sucre, de l'ognon et de l'huile. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The Kadiamor Solidarity Group was created on June 3, 2011. It is composed of four women living in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small business.

Kardiatou, the first person on the right in the photograph and raising her hand, is the president of the group. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of two children.

She sells sugar, onions and oil. She is highly experienced in this trade, which she has practiced for several years. This loan will enable her to strengthen her working capital and better develop her activity. The profit that she is going to earn from this activity will enable her to improve her family's living standard (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.) and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy onions, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 72 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four adult children. Marcelina has a retail business to earn a living. Despite her age, she manages her business. Her main source of income comes from producing and selling charcoal in her community. She has been running her business for 25 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the business. 

Marcelina has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. Marcelina has been a member of GDMPC for over 10 years. In the future, Marcelina hopes to expand her business and  purchase a motorcycle to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyun, 51 years old, is a businesswoman who lives with her husband, 52, and daughter, 14, in a "ger," a  traditional tent in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been running a small grocery kiosk in her backyard during the last two years. She wants to have a new bigger grocery store and expand their business through increasing her range of goods with many other products from abroad. 

Therefore the loan Oyun is applying for will be used to buy building materials to build a new grocery store. She is very grateful to the Kiva team for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a new grocery store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, who has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years, is 36 years old, married to Macharia, and the mother of four school-going children.

Agnes was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan, which she plans to use to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Agnes hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Florence. She is married and has four children aged 27, 24, 18 and 15. Two of them are in school. She has one dependent, who lives with her because he is in school. 

In 1991, Florence established her foodstuff business, selling bulgar, garri (dried cassava tuber) and corn flour. She began her business in order to augment her husband's effort and to enhance her independence. Working seven days a week, and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Florence requires a loan in order to buy more bulgar, garri, and corn flour. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. In the future, Florence plans to complete the construction of her house, and to improve on the level of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bulgar, garri (dried cassava), and corn flour

loans.name: Godoberto

texts.es:
Godoberto de 57 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Godoberto es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, productos que se comercializan diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos diarios de su familia.  También comercializa animales como ovejas y cerdos, permitiéndole obtener otro ingreso económico para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para comprar de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y alimento balanceado para sus animales, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida.  Godoberto es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante y se supere.
texts.en:
Godoberto, age 57, lives with his wife and children in his own home. Their home does not have the basic services, and is located in a rural zone in the Tambogrande district, belonging to the Piura department. This zone is characterized by agricultural, ranching, and crafting activity.

Godoberto is a farmer. He has his own lands where he sows lemon. He sells these products daily; once harvested, he sells his produce in the various markets in Piura. This is how he obtains an income to cover his family's daily costs. He also sells animals such as sheep and hogs. This allows him to obtain another income for his household.

He has requested a loan of 600 Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase fertilizers for improving his lands, for example through balanced food for his animals. Once he fattens them he sells them at a better price in various markets in the area. This way he will make a better income to improve their quality of life. Godoberto is a hard-working and very responsible person. His only desire is for his family to get ahead and excel.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his land, and balanced food for his animals.

loans.name: Michgona

texts.ru: Мичгона проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Она более семи лет занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку, где продает детскую одежду и ткани. Кредит берет для покупки женской одежды, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Michgona lives in the town of Vahdat.  She is 21 years old, single and lives together with her parents.  She has been involved in retail sales for over seven years.  She leases a retail outlet, where she sells children's clothing and fabrics.  Michgona is requesting this loan for the purchase of women's clothing in order to expand her merchandise assortment.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Gereltuya

texts.en:
Gereltuya is 44 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her daughter is a college graduate but currently helps her family's business. Her son is a high school student. Her husband used to work in the military but retired early. Now he stays at home. 

Gereltuya earned her certificate in tailoring and fashion design from the Russian training center. She started her business in 2003 by selling clothes with the bank loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). In 2009, she got sick and went to China for medical care. Now she is recovered. Although her business was forgotten for two years, she continued her business successfully by opening two trading places at the local market and another one in Darhan city. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business, buy a car and build a house. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I used to take loans from other places at higher interest rates. Now I can see that XacBank offers me loans with reasonable interest rates and other conditions." 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy clothes from China and diversify the products for her business. She also mentions that the winter season is coming and people will buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes from China.

loans.name: Mwenda Pole Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mwenda Pole Group in Western Kenya! Martin is the facilitator of the Mwenda Pole group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Martin was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Martin's group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
In the picture the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Somasse-Glotomey Group

texts.fr: SOMASSE-GLOTOMEY est un  groupement composé de quatorze personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quarter et mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de  Aimée est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.  Aimée est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Paul. Le couple a trois enfants, tous à leur charge. Seulement certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple se partage ensemble les diverses charges de la famille.  Aimée n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et contribuer aux charges familiales,  Aimée vend depuis une quinzaine d’année des épices et des produits divers dans sa région.  Aimée s’approvisionne au Bénin.  C’est la première fois que  Aimée et les autres membres du groupement  SOMASSE-GLOTOMEY sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui leur servira à rehausser leur activité.
texts.en:
SOMASSE-GLOTOMEY is a group composed of 14 people who all live in the same district and all work at income-generating activities. This is the first time that the group has asked for a loan from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their activities and better respond to the needs of their clientele. The representative of the group, Aimée, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo.  

Aimée is 32 and married to a carpenter named Paul. The couple have three children, all still in their care. Only some of the children are enrolled in school. The couple share in supporting the family. 

Aimée did not attend school. In order to support herself and contribute to the family income, Aimée has been selling spices and various other products from her region for about 15 years. She buys her merchandise in Bénin.  Aimée and the other members of her group called SOMASSE-GLOTOMEY are requesting a loan from ALIDé to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy spices and various products.

loans.name: Kochkonbek

texts.ru:
Кочконбеку 54 года. Женат, имеет двоих детей. Всю свою жизнь Кочконбек работал в сфере сельского хозяйства, сначала водителем в колхозе, затем разнорабочим. В 1996 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей  семьи, Кочконбек  организовал  собственное хозяйство и начал заниматься разведением скота и полеводством, стартовав с суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS).На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Кочконбека насчитывается  одна корова, 10 баранов, одна лошадь, а также – яблоневый сад, в культивирование которого Кочконбек вкладывает всю свою душу.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кочконбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов и саженцев новых сортов яблок. 
В будущем, Кочконбек планирует расширять поголовье скота и увеличить площадь яблоневого сада.
texts.en: Kochkonbek is 54 years old, married and has two children.  Kochkonbek spent all his life working in the agricultural field, first starting as a driver at a collective farm and then as a handyman.  In search of an additional source of income for his family, he organized his own farm in 1996 with a starting capital of 5,000 som (KGS) and started to breed livestock and farm land.  Today, Kochkonbek's farm contains one cow, ten sheep, one horse and also an apple orchard, into cultivating which he invests his whole soul.  In order to further develop his business, Kochkonbek requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase sheep and seedlings of new apple varieties.  In the future, he plans to increase his livestock headcount and expand his apple orchard.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and seedlings of new apple varieties

loans.name: Blanca Maria

texts.es: Blanca, originaria de Estelí, de 33 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad. Se dedica a una de las actividades mas populares propia de nuestra cultura es comerciante dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Sus inicios fue desde muy joven tenia 19 años de edad , tenia muy poca mercadería recuerda que solo tenia 2 jarrones de dulces, una bolsa de galletas , 4 cajas de jabones y detergentes. Pero con el tiempo y mucho esfuerzo su venta se ha venido levantando poco a poco y además la ha brindado la oportunidad de ser independiente y de ganarse su dinero de manera honrada trabajando desde su  casa. Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar , arroz, frijoles, azúcar, productos de limpieza, cosméticos, también quiere invertir en compra juguetes, ropa para vender y aprovechar la época navideña que esta cerca y es cuando las ventas tienden a incrementarse a un mas. Una de sus expectativas es instalar un mini súper en su casa para abastecer a su vecindario de todo lo necesario y suplir parte de sus necesidades y de esta manera contribuir en su comunidad.
texts.en: Blanca, who is a native of Estelí, is 33 years old and the single mother of a 1-year old son.  She makes her living in one of the most popular businesses in our culture- she is a storekeeper, the owner of a small grocery.  She started very young, when she was 19 years old.  She had very little merchandise then; she remembers that she only had 2 vases of sweets and 4 boxes of soaps and detergents.  But with time and a lot of effort, her business has grown, little by little.  In addition it has given her the opportunity to be independent and to make an honest living form her home.  Blanca took out the loan to purchase rice, beans, sugar, cleaning products and cosmetics, to invest in the purchase of toys and clothing to sell and to take advantage of the Christmas season, which is approaching and which is when sales tend to increase even more.  One of Blanca's expectations is to open a mini-market in her home to supply her neighborhood with all the necesities and to supplement some of their needs.  In this way, she will contribute in her community.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, cleaning supplies and cosmetics, to invest in the purchase of toys and clothing for sale and also to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Lavinia

texts.en:
Lavinia is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has five children.

Lavinia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lavinia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lavinia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Laura Roxana

texts.es: Laura,de 22 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,desde hace 3 años,ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque es una activida que le gusta mucho,ademas de ser una entrada economica para ayudar a su familia,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles,ya  que de esa forma lograra aumentar su mercaderia.
texts.en: Laura is 22 years old and has worked selling basic food products for the past three years.  She tells us that she is very happy because she likes her work very much, and in addition her work has provided an economic opening to help her family.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy food products since in that way she can increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 51 years old and married, with seven children. For 10 years, David has been working as a farmer and he started out by digging using a hand hoe for domestic purposes, but now he is farming on a commercial scale and even can afford to hire a tractor. He faces challenges of high inflation and bad weather patterns. He wishes to educate his children and also to buy more land for farming. He needs this loan to buy millet and beans for planting.

loans.use: to buy millet and beans for planting.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La Sra  Bernardina es de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene 49 años, tiene tres hijos, dos varones en edad escolar y una niña que esta en el colegio. Su marido trabaja como chófer en una empresa de transporte.
Ella cuenta que tiene una mercería bien surtida en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de cosas, como ser zapatos, ropas, artículos de librería, etc. Dice que le va muy bien en las ventas puesto que tiene de todo y eso le trae muy buenos ingresos. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva.
Solicita el credito para la compra de remeras, bermudas y zapatillas y agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da en el crédito, ya que para ella es un apoyo importantísimo.
texts.en:
Bernardina is from Mariano Roque Alonso.  She is 49 and has three children - two boys of school age and a girl at primary school.  Her husband is a chauffeur for a transport firm. 

She tells us that she has a well stocked haberdashery store at her home, where she sells all kinds of things, such as shoes, clothes, books and magazines etc.  She says that she makes very good sales as she sells a bit of everything, which brings her a good income.  She hopes to continue to grow her business and it is for this reason that she is asking for support from Kiva.

She is asking for the loan to buy t-shirts, Bermuda shorts, trainers and is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that the loan gives her, as it is of great help to her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, Bermuda shorts, trainers and other items.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has sold vegetables to earn a living for the past five years. She also earns money by farming.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya Christine has been able to improve her income. She has applied for a 15,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

Christine hopes to expand her business and have a shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 28 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child. Fe has a snack-vending and reloading business and earns approximately PHP 500 each month with this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. Fe has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Ebelym Osiris

texts.es: Doña Ebelym gracias a la ayuda financiera que le proporciono la cooperativa COMIXMUL y los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA muy agradecida porque ella manifiesta que ya puede tener la confianza y la tranquilidad de poder tocar puertas para avanzar y seguir creciendo con su negocio cubriendo las necesidades básicas del mismo como la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, foliares y en ocasiones el pago de mano de obra para dar una mejor y mayor asistencia a sus cultivos de café de forma eficiente y eficaz. En esta nueva ocasión aprovechando dicho apoyo ella quiere solicitar su segundo crédito, comprar los diferentes abonos, foliares y realizar el pago de mano de obra calificada para nuevamente asistir sus cultivos de café, prepararlos y esperar que esta temporada sea mejor que las anteriores por lo cual espera ser apoyada para salir adelante.

loans.use: para compra de abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para asistir sus cultivos de café

loans.name: Allahgulu

texts.en: Allahgulu is single and lives in the Fuzuli region  with his parents. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. His father is a bus driver and his mother is a farmer. He helps Allahgulu in his little business. He has been in farming for 2 years and planting cabbages,carrots. For this reason he needs a loan of 1900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this amount he is planning to buy wooden-sticks and other things for covering his plants. Allahgulu says great thanks to the Kiva organization for everything. In the future he wants to plant different vegetables to improve his business and for his personal life, Allahgulu wants to get married.

loans.use: to buy wooden-sticks and other things for covering his plants

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa P. has two children and is 35 years old. She owns a store in 
Guayaquil where she sells food in large amounts like rice, corn and sugar. The business is located in her parents home which is conveniently located on a main street. She is seeking to diversify her product offerings and buy in larger quantities for her clients. She also sells women’s clothing and perfume as a side job in order to bring in extra income for her home. She will use the loan primarily for her store in order to increase her inventory and boost sales.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sadig

texts.en:
Sadig was born in 1979 in the Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). After completing his military service, he he was unable to continue with his education and instead began to support his family who had recently experienced some hard times. Three years ago, Sadig rented a very small shop where he adjusts automobile signal systems and sells automobile accessories. He unfortanately does not have enough funds to develop his business. In 2005 he borrowed $500 from Normicro to buy automatic control equipment, electric drills and other misc equipment. 
He currently has applied for a loan $800 to buy  car radio cassette players and inductive-code signaling devices for cars.

loans.use: To buy nine auto radio cassette players and six inductive-code signaling devices for cars

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame Mercy is a resident of this town and sells roasted cocoyam, plantain and yam. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov C. is 28 years old, married and a mother of two children. Both are students. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To service the family's expenses, she sells second hand clothes at a nearby market and makes around 5 USD each day, while her husband can typically earn a meager amount of money from working at a private company as a security guard. Nov C. is humbly requesting a loan amount of 200 USD to purchase more clothes to increase her inventory, as well as satisfying her clients' needs. She hopes to have enough money to keep expanding her business and be able to build a new house one day.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Mr. and Mrs. Opoki, aged 57 and 48 years respectively, are a couple that is working closely together to make a better future for themselves and their children.

They have eight children, three of whom are still going to school. Mr. Opoki formally working as a banking assistant but lost his job following the closure of the Peoples owned Uganda Commercial Bank following its privatization around 2001.

With no formal work, the Opokis had to find ways of raising funds to cater for their basic needs as well as educating their children. Using savings from the former employment, he bought a piece of land. Three years ago the couple began a fish business, however the business has been low because they don’t have a freezer to preserve the fish.

Mr. and Mrs. Opoki are planning to borrow $600 to purchase a freezer. This will allow them to buy more fish. With increased income from increased sales, the couple plans to build a house on their plot and also educate their three children who are still in school.

Business for the Opokis begins early in the morning when they go to buy fish at Gaba landing site. The couple then proceeds to fry the fish at mid-day.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Olvin Tomas

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Olvin Tomas. My main activity is furniture sales. My specialty is hall, kitchen and bedroom furniture. I have been doing this activity for several years. It has allowed me to generate income to contribute with my family's expenses. Due to the rise in demand, I need to invest more and I don't have enough capital in order to meet the existent demand.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Olvin Tomas, mi actividad principal es la vanta de muebles de sala, cocina y dormitorio, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente la demanda es mayor por lo que necesito invertir mas y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: Purchase hall furniture, china display furniture and drawer chests

loans.name: Haralampy

texts.en: Haralampy H. lives in the village of Manastirishte near Vratza. He is not married but lives together with his girlfriend and their two kids. Haralampy breeds four cows and has three acres of land on which he produces his own fodder. He has a contract with a dairy that purchases milk.  Now he needs another cow. The loan request  is for $750.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary K. would like to buy iron sheets in order to construct a permanent structure for her charcoal business. Rosemary is currently renting her charcoal shop.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets to construct a permanent charcoal shop

loans.name: Veronica Asunción

texts.es:
Doña Verónica is 38 years old and was born in Managua on August 16th, 1970. Her husband is 47 years old and works as a welder in a workshop located at their home. Verónica sells food and her main clients are students from a middle school, located only 15 meters from her house.

She inherited the house from her mother and there she has raised her 5 children, three boys, 14, 10, and 8 years old, and two girls, 7 and 4 years old. This humble family requests a loan to add and extra room to their house and this way get a worthier home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

. DoñaVerónica tiene 38 años de edad, nació en Managua el 16 de Agosto de 1970, su marido tiene 47 años de edad y se desempeña como soldador de un taller ubicado en su hogar. Verónica vende comida y sus principales clientes son estudiantes de un colegio de secundaria que se ubica a 15 metros de su casa de habitación.

Su casa la heredó de su madre y en ella han crecido sus 5 hijos tres varones de 14, 10 y 8 años y dos niñas de 7 y 4 años de edad. Esta humilde familia solicita el crédito para construir un cuarto de habitación y optar a una vivienda más digna.

loans.use: Start building an extra room to enlarge home.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar A. is 43 years old and is married with 4 children.

Muyassar has been running her business for 8 years. She sells housewares like plates and dishes, teapots and caps, vacuum flasks and others items. All the goods are supplied from China. In addition to retail clients, Muyassar also sells to wholesale customers. The business is successful and generates a stable income allowing Muyassar to contribute considerably to the family budget. 

Muyassar has been working with IMON for several years already and has proven herself as a reliable client. Today she requests $1000.00 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Muyassar shall spend the loan for purchasing the chinaware and other houseware items like teapots, caps, and flasks in order to increase the range of goods for sale. Muyassar thanks all for support and promises to manage the loan without violations.

loans.use: Purchase of  housewares like plates and dishes, teapots, and vacuum flasks that will expand the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Suraia

texts.en:
Suraia is 31 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 14,9,8 and 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other 16 year old. Suraia started selling clothes in 2006. Everyday, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Suraia has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Gladys Katheryne

texts.en:
Gladys Datheryne P. R. has a business selling clothing, gifts, and stuffed animals in La Esperanza, suburb of Trujillo, La Libertad Region.  She sells her products from a booth at the Mercado Victoria in the center of town.  She has 4 years of experience managing her store and has many loyal customers.

Gladys is 26 years old, single and without children.  Her business is very important to her.  She studied to become a teacher at a local University but no jobs were available after she graduated.  She’s glad she is in a situation where she can help her family and save money.

A member of the community bank Mujeres En Accion, Gladys is requesting a loan of $625 to repay over 4 months.  She will use the loan to restock her best selling products.

loans.use: To restock her best selling products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy four sacks of maize.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan C., 50, is a widow who lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has six children, two sons and four daughters. One of her sons is married and lives outside the family home. One of her daughters has full time employment in Phnom Penh and the other three weave silk at home. The youngest son attends a local school.

Mrs. Yan has been a silk weaver since 1983, when she learned the skill from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes the material to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yan is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk thread to continue her weaving business and zinc roofing for her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk thread for weaving and zinc roofing

loans.name: Fuaina's Group

texts.en: This is the second group of ladies from Malae Faga village.  They just started, and they applied for 750 Samoan Tala each for their first loans.  These ladies have not been working for years, and this is the first time for them to have access to loans and also to run their businesses themselves. These are their priorities now which are different from what they usually do.  They are attending weekly meetings, and they are looking forward to being granted more loans to improve their businesses in the future.

loans.use: Purchase rake, knives, crowbar, wheel barrow, weed killing spray, and chemicals for gardens

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina has been running her retail business for seven years. She started as a small vendor in Nikolaev. Her vending location is in the central street of her hometown which is very convenient for customers who shop downtown Nikolaev. Galina sells jewellery that each of her female customers can afford. Presently, she has about $10000 invested in inventory. Her income is about $1400 each month.

Galina would like to keep her income stable and increase her turnover capital which is why she is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to be repaid in two months. We believe consistent demand, outstanding credit history and entrepreneurial enthusiasm will guarantee loan repayment without any delinquencies.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Solange Eudoxie

texts.fr: Dame M. Solange Eudoxie est née le 02/03/1967 à Cotonou. Elle est coiffeuse de profession; activité qu'elle exerce depuis 10ans. Elle est mariée à BEKOU Elie qui  est commerçant et qui réside en Allemagne. Elle est mère de 2 enfants ( Nadine et Ebénézer) tous scolarisés et respectivement en classe de 1ère et de 5 ème année du cours primaire. Dame M. Solange Eudoxie vit avec ses enfants en location. C'est pour faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle qu'elle a sollicité ce crédit car seule, elle ne dispose pas de moyens financiers suffisants pour satisfaire aux exigences des nombreuses femmes qui viennent se coiffer chez elle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Solange Eudoxie M. was born March 2nd, 1967 in Cotonou. She is a hair stylist by profession, a business activity she's been doing for the last ten years. She is married to Elie BEKOU who is a trader living in Germany. She is the mother of two children (Nadine and Ebenezer) who are both getting an education, in first and fifth year respectively, at primary school. Mrs. Solange Eudoxie M. lives with her children in rented accommodation. She is seeking this loan to meet the needs of her customers because on her own, she doesn't have sufficient financial means to satisfy demand from the many women who come to her to have their hair done.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase synthetic hair extensions, electric hair dryer, and hair care products

loans.name: Mrs. Phan Sopeap's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people in Andoung Svay Village in Kampong Chhnang Province have formed a village bank loan group and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Phan S. is the village bank president, who has been selected by the members. She is a vegetable seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of vegetables to re-sell to her customers. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Mrs. Phan S. is a 27-year-old widow with two children; one of whom is attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is two years old.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Desde hace 8 años que la señora Dionisia, de 55, tiene una tienda en casa donde expende gaseosas y todo tipo de abarrotes. Convive con su esposo, sus 3 hijos, Y alberga a la esposa e hijos de 1 de ellos, pero ella no les cierra las puertas: quiere el bienestar para todos sus hijos. Siendo la perseverancia su segundo nombre, ganado gracias al ahínco con que desarrolla sus labores, ella ve su futuro mucho mejor, tan sólo para poder brindarle a sus hijos, y a sí misma, una mejor calidad de vida.

Para plasmar dicho futuro en la realidad, ella requiere de 600 soles, considerando la implementación que necesita su tienda en sí, tanto en su ambiente como en los productos que tiene.
texts.en:
For eight years now Dionisia, who is 55 years old, has had a store where she sells sodas and all types of groceries. She lives with her husband, their two children, as well as the wife and children of one of her sons. She never closes the door to them, as she cares for the well-being of all her children. Since perserverance is her middle name, earned thanks to the eagerness with which she carries out her tasks, she sees a much brighter future if she can only provide a better quality of life for herself and her children.

To make this wish for their futures a reality she needs 600.00 soles, considering the improvements her store needs – both for the atmosphere and for the types of products that she carries.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase many more products at wholesale for her grocery store with the goal of increasing her income.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a member of the Sumacc Huayna (“Beautiful Flower” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is the single mother of one young son, and lives with her adoptive family. Her adoptive grandmother, Nicolaza, works with the same Village Bank and is also a Kiva client. 

Johana and her family sell handicrafts from their stand in the Ex-Penal Market, an old jail near the center of Ayacucho that has been converted into an artisan’s market. Each artisan has their own small space in what used to be a jail cell. They sell silver jewelry, embroidery, ceramics and alabaster sculptures from their stand. 

Johana needs a loan of 1,000 soles. She plans to use the money to travel to Lima to have some medical tests done on her son, who is having some stomach problems. Johana’s goals for the future are to start a larger business, employ more embroiderers, and to start exporting her crafts.

loans.use: Travel to Lima, pay for medical testing

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Rocío del Pilar A. M. tiene 40 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II, vive en  la Avenida Petro Perú  Mz E lote 8, del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, debido a una enfermedad en la vista no pudo continuar estudiando y se dedico al negocio. Se casó a los 22 años, tiene 5 hijos que aun son estudiantes.
Pilar, empezó vendiendo marcianos y otras pequeñas cosas en la puerta de su casa, actualmente tiene una bodega grande en la que vende artículos de primera necesidad, objetos de librería y otros, su local a crecido en su misma casa.
Con el primer crédito que fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró arroz, aceite y fideos y empezó a implementar una pequeña bodega.
Con este crédito de 1200 que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en comprar panetones, champán, leche y chocolate para las fiestas navideñas.
El mayor deseo de Pilar es ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rocío del Pilar A. M. is 40 years old and belongs to the Community Bank "Las Emprendedoras II" (The Enterprising Women II). She lives at Avenue Petro Peru Mz E, lot 8 of the Salaverry Port in the province of Trujillo, state of La Libertad, Peru. She completed her secondary education and due to a vision problem could not continue studying. Instead she dedicated herself to the business world. She got married when she was 22 and she has 5 children whom are still students. Pilar began by selling small things from outside her front door and today she has a large store where she sells first aid items and stationary items, among other things. Her store has grown in the same place, her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in 4 payments, she bought rice, oil and pasta and began her small store. With this loan of 1200 soles to be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy fruitcake, champagne, milk and chocolate for the Christmas holiday. Pilar's greatest wish is to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruitcake, champagne, milk and chocolate to sell in her store

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 20 años, es soltero, vive alquilado en una casa de adobe que pertenece a sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de artefactos de 2do uso, más conocido como venta de chatarra en la ciudad de Puno desde hace  un año, ya que al no tener acceso a estudios superiores se dedica netamente al trabajo como su única fuente de progreso. Aún así a Luis le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener cierta libertad e independencia y puede elegir que es lo mejor para él. Lo difícil de su trabajo es adquirir las cosas de segundo uso que venderá y refaccionarlas, ya que muchas de ellas están en mal estado, haciendo más difícil su trabajo. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de artículos de segundo uso y los refaccionará para venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Luis is 20 years old; he is single and is renting an adobe house owned by his parents. He sells second-hand goods and is well known as a scrap seller in the city of Puno, having been in this business for the past year. Because he did not have access to study past high school, he has focussed on work as his only avenue for progress. Luis very much enjoys his work as it gives him a certain amount of freedom and independence and he can decide what is best for himself. What is hard about his work is acquiring second-hand goods to sell and fix as many of these are in bad shape, making his work more difficult. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He will use the loan to buy more second-hand goods, to fix them for resale at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more used goods for resale

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: N. Rose is the leader of her lending group in Mubende. She is a devoted business lady with a shop selling new clothes of all kinds. She has been in this business long enough to know how to manage her finances well. She is grateful for her loans because they have helped her have enough stock of different kinds, hence winning her more customers. She says she can never forget her primary job of farming since living in a village like Mubende without a farm is rare, due to the fertile soils that favor their crops. Rose needs a loan to help with buying more clothes for sale, mostly from Kampala City.

loans.use: More clothes for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 49 años, vive en una humilde casa  que con mucho esfuerzo construyó con el fin de habitar junto a su esposo, su hijo y donde también acogió a su sobrina. Hace 5 años que está dedicada a la crianza de animales menores, actividad que inició desde que perdió gran parte del capital de su negocio de venta de carne de pollo, pues las circunstancias que se presentaron impidieron que siguiera trabajando en ello, sin embargo consiguió una manera de ganarse la vida sin tener que salir de su hogar. Encontrando en la crianza de animales una  buena oportunidad, gracias a la gran demanda que hay en la venta de estos animales, pudo instalar al poco tiempo un corral en el patio de su casa, espacio donde ahora alimenta y engorda a sus animales para luego venderlos a los comerciantes y a algunas avícolas que realizan pedidos cada mes. En el futuro Elizabeth desea tener una tienda, para no tener solo una sola actividad económica, con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y que eso le permita mejorar su casa y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su 13avo préstamo con MFP, y toda su temporada en la institución le ha ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida, en lo económico y sobre todo en la parte social. Ella invertirá 1500 soles en mercadería para su bodega, productos de primera necesidad, de esta manera iniciar poco a poco a surtir su pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and lives in a humble house that she built with great effort. She lives there with her husband, her son and her niece. For the past five years she has worked raising small animals. She started this business when she lost most of her money from her business selling chicken meat. Although circumstances prevented her from continuing to do that job, she found a way to earn a living without having to leave her home. Raising animals is a good opportunity and thanks to the large demand in sales of these animals she was able to add a small henhouse in her yard. She raises and feeds the animals and later sells them to vendors and merchants who give her orders every month. In the future Elizabeth would like to have a store, in order to have more than one source of income and increase her earnings. This would allow her to improve her home and the quality of life for her family. This is her 13th loan with MFP and her time with this institution has helped her improve her quality of life, both economically and, above all, socially. She will invest the 1500 soles in general merchandise, and begin to stock her small store little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 48 years old and married with five children. Her older children are in college, while her youngest son is just four years old. Marcelina buys and sells foods like rice, dried olives, corn, sugar, and spices. She buys her products straight from farmers or producers, then resells them to local stores. She also sells her goods to cooks for tour groups hiking the Inca Trail, a four-day, three-night excursion that leaves daily from Cusco. She receives regular orders from her clients, and buys her wares at the Saturday market in Wanchaq. She has been in this business for the past ten years, so she has a number of regular customers. 

Marcelina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more dried foods to sell. She invests most of her profits in her children’s education, of whom the three oldest study tourism at the local university. She is very proud of her children, and her goal for the future is to open her own tourism agency with their help.

Marcelina has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full.

loans.use: Buy dried foods (rice, corn, oil, sugar, spices)

loans.name: Buddi Maiya

texts.en: Miss Buddi Maiya R. is a tailor in Thikhidewol, Lalitpur. She lives with her father, mother, one brother and one sister. She opened her tailoring shop one year ago. She took a six-month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like the Kurta Sulwar, which are very popular with Nepali women. She makes dresses according to the orders she gets from her customers. Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs10000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en:
Musharaf T. is a mother working arduously in agriculture to help her husband with the household expenses in order to improve their quality of life and provide their three children with life’s necessities. During the season, Musharaf works on the land from early morning till late night with the help of her eldest son. At the same time, she runs a business processing and selling dried fruits to earn an additional profit. Musharaf is requesting a loan in order to expand this latter business. Please help this woman of great strength and courage to keep working. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits to expand the business.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La sra. Eulogia Mamani es nacida en la cuidad de Chuquisaca, pero hace mas de 20 años que se vino a vivir a la cuidad de Santa Cruz.
Actualmente vive en la Localidad de Cañada Strongesrt, en la cual cuenta con una parcela de 18 hectáreas. 
Vive con su esposo el Sr. Casiano Cruz, y sus dos hijos, ellos se dedican a la actividad de la agricultura.
El préstamo que fue solicitado fue para la compra de semilla de papa, y otros productos más como ser, yuca y maíz. También cuentan con 2 vacas, dos chanchos y 20 gallinas. Que estos les sirven para la venta y consumo propio.
texts.en:
Ms. Eulogia Mamani was born in the city of Chuquisaca, but she came to live in the city of Santa Cruz over 20 years ago.

She currently lives in the Cañada Strongesrt locality, where she has an 18-hectare plot of land.

She lives with her husband, Mr. Casiano Cruz, and their two children, all of whom are in agriculture.

She is requesting this loan to purchase potato seeds and other products, such as cassava and corn. They also have two cows, two pigs, and 20 chickens, which they sell or consume themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Las Pioneras De Chijini De Rsr Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las pioneras D. Chijini rsr” esta conformado por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la zona D. Alto chijini D. ahí es D. donD. surge el nombre del grupo. Una mayoría D. los socios se dedican a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, a la venta D. verduras, comida, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, pan y ollas. El mercado D. las socias es altamente competitivo por lo que requieren contar con capital D. trabajo para poder competir con mercadería D. mejor calidad y con herramientas y materiales e insumos que mejores e incrementen sus ingresos que ayudara a sus hogares a mejorar su calidad D. vida. El grupo se encuentra cursando su tercer ciclo por lo que cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que demostraron responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas D. sacar adelante sus negocios para el bien estar D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Las pioneras D. Chijini rsr" is maD. up of 12 members who, for the most part, live in the Alto Chijini zone, from where they get their name. A majority of the members are dedicated to making clothing, selling produce, food, groceries in neighborhood shops, bread and pots. The members' market is highly competitive which requires working capital to compete with better quality merchandise, tools and materials and inputs that improve their earnings and will help their homes to improve their quality of life. The group is in its third loan cycle which gives them experience and solidarity as a group that has demonstrated responsibility and, above all, the desire to push their businesses ahead for the well-being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa F., 40, is married with seven children. She has three years of experience in the taro plantation and vegetable business. She sells to the village people and the public, five days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 Tala (~60 USD). SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killing spray, chemicals, spade, fertilizer and some taro roots

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Moustapha T.  est un mécanicien  garagiste automobiliste  qui vend des pièces automobile. Il  mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années. Il est l’unique fournisseur de pièces détachées de la zone. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent à 33 ans de soutenir sa famille. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il compte renforcer et diversifier les pièces des marques d’auto qu’il vend.
texts.en:
Moustapha T. is a mechanic specializing in automobiles who sells automobile spare parts. He has been in this business for a number of years. He is the only supplier of spare parts in his area. The income from this business permits him, at the age of 33, to support his family. With the loan he is requesting, he intends to bolster and diversify the inventory of parts that he sells for various types of automobiles.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of spare parts for re-sale

loans.name: Вохид
