texts.ru: Вохид продолжает  свою деятельность . После использованного займа в МЗФ Микроинвесте он увеличил товарооборот и прибыль. Теперь он поставляет рыбу не только покупателям базара Фаровон но и населению города Худжанда и Душанбе. Отсюда спрос на его товар стало еще больше.На запрашиваемый займ он хочет закупить  рыбы.

loans.use: На закупку рыбы.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie D. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Orienta. She is 34 years old. Rosalie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies through consignment in the neighboring stores and the school canteen in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years.

In 2008, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Melania

texts.en: Melania D., a resident of Gusa, Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 57 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is a farmer, while Melania is a food vendor. She started her business doing house to house vending. But now, with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, her business is growing and she owns a sari-sari (variety retail) store. Her customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends. Her future plan is that the small sari-sari store becomes bigger and gains more customers. She also hopes that all her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: Capital for food vending and sari-sari store

loans.name: Ayidédji Justine

texts.fr: C. Ayidédji Justine est née vers 1955 à Akpro Missérété. Ayidédji Justine est veuve. Ayidédji Justine a à sa charge trois enfants dont deux sont les tiens. La famille réside depuis deux ans à Sèmè Kpodji. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Ayidédji Justine arrive à satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Ayidédji Justine vend des beignets de haricot, de l’igname et de pomme frits. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Ayidédji Justine fait ses provisions et elle vend ses beignets et igname au parc MIVO. Ayidédji Justine a déjà deux ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Ayidédji Justine a eu quatre crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Ayidédji Justine demande un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de haricot, d’igname, de l’huile d’arachide et des condiments.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim Q. has always been a hard-working man, who has made sure from a young age that his family never went hungry. He is married with three children. Five years ago, and with a starting capital of only US$ 100, Rasim started a grocery store selling different kinds of foodstuffs. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, his business has expanded and now his whole family is involved.

Today Rasim needs to increase the range of goods he sells. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1607 AZN. He is ready to work even harder and to make sacrifices to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: expand his business via purchasing more items to sell

loans.name: Moutian Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Moutian de l’association Dori est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 28 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe font entre autres comme activités génératrices de revenus, la couture, la restauration, la fabrication de jus de fruits et le commerce d’articles divers tels les céréales etc. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs activités, les membres du groupe Moutian de l’association Dori ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui ils sont à leur premier prêt. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour l’achat des ingrédients rentrant dans la restauration à Tominian ville. Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des grossistes et des forains et effectuent leur vente très généralement au comptant. Elles sont très sollicitées et appréciées. 
Les femmes du groupe Moutian comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 10.000 FCFA à 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Moutian group of the Dori Association is composed of married women from the town of Tominian, Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and have an average age of 28 and at least 6 children each. The women from this group, in order to earn income, do sewing, sell cooked food, make and sell fruit juice, among other things, and sell other items such as cereals.

WIshing to make their businesses more productive, the members of the Moutian group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first loan.

This loan will be used to buy ingredients used for cooked food in the town of Tominian. They buy their ingredients from wholesalers and from weekly market vendors, and they make most of their sales for cash. They are much sought after and appreciated. Each of the women of the Moutian group expects to make a profit of 10,000 to 15,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for making cooked food to sell

loans.name: Alsied

texts.en: Alsied is a very hard-working man. It's amazing the strength that he has to do hard tasks and simultaneously work in his business. He sells a drink called "Kharub" in the streets of Gaza city, Palestine where he is from. Alsied is requesting a loan of $3000. With the money he will be able to buy more materials for his business such as cups and special equipment to make the "kharub" drink.  Alsied is 37 years-old and married with four children. With your help, he will be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase cups and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Rice Farming is Gemma’s way of living. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Her oldest child is only 14. Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She takes extra care of her farm because it is where she gets her income. She is now preparing her land for planting. She applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos. She will use this loan for seed, fertilizer, and other farming necessities. Hopefully, her farm's yield could double on the next harvest.

loans.use: Seed, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer trabajadora que tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo (Edwin) de 53 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero solo viven con el menor, Nelson de 17 años; pues los 2 mayores ya han formado sus propias familias.

Ella se levanta cada día bajo el radiante sol de la selva peruana con muchas ganas de trabajar en su pequeña tienda que tiene en su vivienda. Esta actividad la realiza sola porque su esposo trabaja en la chacra y su hijo estudia. Durante los días de la semana no tiene mucha demanda, pero durante los fines de semana puede obtener muy buenas ganancias en la venta de bebidas.
Adicionalmente, Norma brinda el servicio de comida a algunos trabajadores de la zona y así puede ganar algo más de dinero para su familia. 
Esta trabajadora mujer tiene mente ganadora, porque sabe que existen días que debe trabajar con más ahínco, además ha sabido elegir y darse cuenta de lo que faltaba en la zona era que alguien prepare comida para los trabajadores.
Al verla uno se pregunta: ¿así es la mujer peruana, acaso tiene una visión perfecta para salir adelante con lo poco que tiene, y de la nada sacar adelante a su familia entera? Pues la respuesta es sí y como muestra basta la historia de Norma.

Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está segura de ser responsable con sus pagos, pues tiene muchos proyectos en mente y además piensa concretarlos con la ayuda de estos créditos. Norma planea invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas para abastecer su bodega y de esta manera seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking woman who is 48 years old. She lives with her husband Edwin, who is 53. Of their three children, only the youngest one, Nelson who is 17, lives with them. The two older children have families of their own.

Norma wakes up each day under the bright sun of the Peruvian jungle. She is eager to work in the small store she established in her home. Norma works by herself because her husband tends to the farm and her son is a student. There is not much demand during the week, but on the weekends, she generates good earnings from the sale of beverages. In addition, she provides meals to a few workers in the area as a way of earning extra money for her family.

One can ask the question, “Can a Peruvian woman have the perfect vision to succeed in moving her family forward with what little she has?” The answer is “yes” and Norma’s story shows that it is possible.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Norma is careful to be responsible with her payments because she has many projects in mind which can only happen with the help of these loans. She will use the money to restock her business with soft drinks and beer in order to keep it going.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & beer

loans.name: María Deisy

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija. Vive en el caserío La Payesa, distrito de Túcume, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace algunos meses, la necesidad de sacar adelante a su hija la llevó a juntar los ahorros que tenía disponibles para iniciar un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas. El negocio está instalado en un puesto del mercado de la ciudad de Túcume y es su única fuente de ingreso económico, por lo que día a día se esfuerza para sacarlo adelante.

María desea empezar a vender ropa de temporada de verano pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar la mercadería que necesita, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es darle a su hija una educación de calidad y una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es una madre luchadora, que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old. She is a single mother and has a daughter. She lives in the small town of La Payesa in the district of Túcume, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. A few months ago, the need to help her daughter get ahead led her to put together all the savings that she had available in order to start a business selling women's clothing. The business is run from a stall in the market of the city of Túcume and it is her only source of income, so every day she works hard to keep it going. María would like to start selling clothing for the summer season but she does not have the funds necessary to buy the merchandise that she needs. This is why she has found herself needing to ask for the first time for a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, that will help her achieve her goal. Her greatest hope is to give her daughter a good education and a better quality of life. She is a strong mother, who has been able to keep going despite difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer clothing to expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snacks business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 49, married, and has six children aged 4-24 years. All her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a five-roomed house where Edith stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity, but not to piped water at home.  They have three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses includes paying utility bills, school fees for her children, and medication. 

Edith sells charcoal in Kikoni to all kinds of people. She works seven days a week, serving an average of 30 customers a day. She has had her business for over fifteen years.  Her main challenges are transportation of chicken feed and thieves.  She sells both on retail and wholesale. She has been with MCDT for two years, and has taken four loans, working the whole time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She hopes to see her business grow bigger, and to start selling on wholesale only.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Roger Francisco

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, el señor Roger Pérez se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de productos descartables como vasos, platos, cubiertos, pajillas, entre otros. Dichos productos son comercializados a diario por el señor Roger desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y siempre está buscando la manera de cómo llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Actualmente, él está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los productos como vasos, platos, cubiertos, entre otros todos estos descartables y espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para así invertir en el negocio y obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Roger Pérez works hard in León department selling disposable products like: drinking glasses, cutlery, drinking straws, among others. He sells these products daily from very early in the morning, always seeking ways to bring sustenance to his home. He is asking for funding to buy disposable products like drinking glasses, plates, cutlery, etc. and hopes to be blessed with the granting of the loan so that he can invest in his business and earn income to support his household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy disposable products.

loans.name: Robilyn

texts.en: Robilyn M. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. She is shown in the photo with her daughter. Robilyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She is just starting this business. Before, she was engaged in making and selling food but, as time passed by, she decided to put up a sari-sari store in her village. In 2009, Robilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Robilyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rhonalyn's Group

texts.en:
Rhonalyn L. is from the village of Minien East, Santa Barbara, Pangasinan Province. She is 22 years old. Rhonalyn is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rhonalyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Rhonalyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rhonalyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rhonalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhonalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Rhonalyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Hera Ganga

texts.en:
Hera Ganga K. is a resident of Balkhu, Kathmandu. She lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, and husband. Her husband, Mr. Bikash K., owns a butcher shop.

Mrs. K. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Balkhu. She opened her grocery store three years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her store. Her father-in-law and mother-in-law help her in her work.

Now, Mrs. K. is asking for a loan to invest in her shop to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Dosmila

texts.es: Dosmila tiene 40 años, casada y madre de 3 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja, mercadería que se abastece de su propia granja de abejas que tiene en el patio de su casa. Es así que su actividad empieza viajando a otras ciudades para vender su producto. Además, cada quincena se dedica a la venta de animales como: cuyes, ovejas y pollos, en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Esta actividad, por lo general lo realiza sola, hay ocasiones en que recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, que la ayudan en el transporte de su mercadería. A lo largo de estos años, Dosmila ha visto las ventajas de  generarse ingresos de manera independiente, y por lo que continuará trabajando para así poder incrementar su capital. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, asimismo considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de miel de abeja al por mayor y también de animales como ovejas.
texts.en:
Dosmila is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. They live together in their own house. For the last 10 years she has made a living by selling honey, which is supplied by her own bee farms that she keeps on the patio of her house. She has managed to begin traveling to other cities to sell her product. Furthermore, every two weeks she sells animals, such as guinea pigs, sheep, and chickens, at the livestock fairs in her town. In general, she carries out these activities by herself, but occasionally her sons help her transport the merchandise. Throughout the years, Dosmila has seen the advantages of generating income independently, and therefore will continue working this way to increase her capital. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. Likewise, she believes that this credit will be very useful in the progress of her business. She will invest in the purchase of wholesale honey and also animals, such as sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase honey and sheep

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en:
38 years old Taiwo is married with three children and they live in Lagos. She is a member in LAPO micro finance and has been a faithful client for some years. Taiwo sells drinks in wholesale and retail, she also supply electrode used for welding to welders and has been in these businesses for the past three years. She is very concerned over her costumers’ satisfaction, she make sure their demand meet. She has two sales assistant that are paid monthly. With the profit from the business she could provide for the children’s education and their well being.
            .
Taiwo is asking for a loan of NGN170,000 to purchase more drinks to sell as this will enable her get better discount and more profit on each sale. She promise to pay back promptly and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S. is 58 and is married. She lives with her husband and six children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia: an area known for being the most populated city in the country. She and her husband sell coffee and breakfast for an income of about USD 6.5 per day.  


S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more food supplements to expand her business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 


S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more food supplements

loans.name: Noory Group

texts.en: Khaleda is the group leader of the Noory group. She is married and lives in district 11, Kabul, Afghanistan. She has three children who are in school. She wants a loan to buy teaching materials such as white boards, markers, chairs and tables for a course she teaches. She hopes to have a well-organized course where she will be able to teach the students in a calm environment. She is very happy about Kiva in Afghanistan. Thanks from AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: She wants to make buy teaching materials like, white boards,

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza de 44 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Ella tiene una papelería. 

Para poder solventar los gastos familiares ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros, ya que su esposo como es chofer trabajaba viajando a las provincias del Ecuador y no pasaba en casa. Compro cuadernos, papelería y artículos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido agrandar mas su negocio, Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos y mochilas para su loca. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 44 and lives in Primavera de Duran (Duran is an area on the edge of the city that once had hills, streams, and small lakes. These can still be seen as remains of a deteriorating environment). She has a stationary store. To be able to cover the household expenses, she had to invest her savings since her husband, a chauffeur, would work traveling to the provinces of Ecuador and wouldn't come back through the house. She purchased notebooks, stationary, and paper items. Little by little with effort, she has been able to expand her business. She works from 8 am until 7 pm. She wants to use the loan to invest in notebooks and backpacks for her store. In the future, she wants to stock her business with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and backpacks

loans.name: Nishan's Group

texts.en:
Nishan is applying for a loan to financially assist her husband who wants to expand his construction supply business. 
She is a housewife and lives in a city called Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has no children. She does stitching work to make some extra income. 
With the loan, her husband will put more construction supplies in his shop to make his business more profitable. 
Nishan will save the money from the profit for a rainy day.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es: Carla Patricia tiene 28 años, tiene 2 hijos son menores de edad y están a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, hace mas 6 años que se dedica este medio de vida, por lo que ella inicio vendiendo refrescos ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y no tenía ninguna ayuda de su esposo, por lo que es madre soltera que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y con todo los sacrificios que ha realizado. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, jugos, pan entre otras. Sueña con realizarles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carla Patricia is 28 years old and has 2 children under sixteen who she looks after. She has been running a grocery store for the past 6 years, having started by selling soft drinks when she had to take care of her children and had no help from her husband. She is a single mother and, with a lot of hard work and sacrifice, she has managed to move forward. The loan will be used to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, juices, bread, etc. She dreams of making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita E. is 49 years old and married with eight children. She lives with her husband in the province of Antique in the Philippines.

For almost four years, Angelita has been engaged in hog fattening. She is hard-working, determined, and dedicated. She would like to receive a loan to purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins and other supplies.

As a very active member since 2007 of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Angelita has been a model member, demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans. With the help of ASHI, she has already funded the college education of three of her children.
 
Angelita’s dream is for her other children to complete college. Additionally, she hopes to continue her hog-fattening business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family, to reach her goals in life, and to have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, feeds, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Khazhak

texts.en:
Khazhak Y. was born in 1973. He lives in Khashtarak village, Ijevan area. He is married and has got two underage children: a son and a daughter.

Since 2003 he has been working at a school in Khashtarak village as a teacher. Simultaneously with his basic teaching work, he is engaged in agricultural activities, particularly land cultivation and sheep breeding. He says that sheep breeding is very tiring work, but the same time it is profitable. With the profits from farming he is supporting his family and their needs.

Now he wants to enlarge his farming venture, so he asks for a 600,000 AMD loan to purchase some sheep and sufficient fodder for the whole winter. Khazhak is a 3rd cycle borrower with “Nor Horizon” UCO LLC, without any payment delays.

loans.use: purchasing some sheep and sufficient fodder for the whole winter

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales uno es mayor, y 2 están a su cargo, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante viven en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Desde muy joven esta dedicada mujer se dedica a trabajar, y ahora más para sacar adelante a sus hijos, por tal motivo se le ocurrió instalar una tienda en el interior de su casa, para vender  productos comestibles, a la vez para no descuidar su hogar. Con el tiempo ha logrado complementar sus ventas con productos de primera necesidad y cosméticos, de esa manera obtiene las ganancias que necesita para cubrir con los gastos que le generan la educación de sus hijos, además que cuenta con el apoyo de ellos en el negocio. Como es una emprendedora mujer,  para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad de mercadería a sus clientes. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues quiere continuar trabajando en busca del progreso, también esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá impulsar las  actividades de personas laboriosas como ella . Jessica tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes y espera obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessica is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her 3 children, of which one is an adult and 2 are dependent on her. She has a great desire to progress; they live in a neighborhood in the northern part of the city. Since she was young, she has been a hard-working woman and now she works even harder to help her children. This is why she decided to put up a general store in her home to sell products and food while being able to take care of her home. Over time, she has been able to add essential products and cosmetics to her store and has been able to earn the income that she needs to cover her children's educational expenses. Her children also help her run the store. As she is an enterprising woman, she plans to expand her store and offer a greater variety of goods to her customers. This is her second loan from MFP and she promises to pay it back punctually; she would like to continue working hard to progress. She is very grateful to all the people who make this loan possible that will allow her to encourage other hard-working women like herself. Jessica plans to invest the money to buy more merchandise as she would like to offer the best to her customers and hopes to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply a large quantity of products

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La   Sra. Rafaela  es viuda tiene  1 hija, ella se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, en forma ambulante, la misma le genera un buen ingreso.

La forma D. trabajo es la ir junto al cliente y ofrecer, la mayoría D. la ventas es acredito ya que es la forma más fácil D. colocar los producto comenta  Rafaela.

Así con la ayuda D. su hija están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
Con el día a día, demuestra ser una trabajadora honesta, responsable y con ganas D. seguir progresando.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra D. varios producto que le habían solicitado sus clientes como perfumes, cremas, maquillajes entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Rafaela is a widow. She has one daughter and sells cosmetics as a door-to-door salesperson. This generates a good income for her.

Her form of work is to go to her customers and offer her products. The majority of her sales are on credit, and she comments that this is the easiest way to sell her products.

Thus, with the help of her daughter, they are making progress, with great sacrifice and dedication.

With her day-to-day work, she shows that she is an honest and responsible worker who wants to continue progressing.

She is applying for the loan to purchase various products that her clients have asked for, such as perfumes, creams, and make-up, among other items.

loans.use: Buy make-up, perfumes, colognes, skin creams, oils, and other items.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana D. is from the city of Dalapang Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old. Rosana is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Rosana owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn for sale. Rosana has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosana is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Rosana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
}La señora Clara Vásquez es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Valientes, con domicilio en el distrito de Callería departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es casada sin hijos   y  su esposo se desempeña como mecánico. Con su primer préstamo  que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos, la señora Clara pensó en dedicarse  a la venta de productos de belleza.

También recibió capacitación para prestar servicio de manicure para complementar la venta de sus productos de belleza, en Manuela Ramos. Clara esta desde la fundación del banco comunal Mujeres Valientes. 

Con el préstamo que acaba de recibir  de Manuela Ramos  que asciende a la suma  S/. 1,800.00  soles el mismo que será devuelto en 4 cuotas mensuales. Con el dinero recibido incrementará el capital de trabajo de su pequeño negocio de confección de sabanas y secadores. Invertirá de la siguiente manera, 30 metros de tela para sabanas, 6 conos de hilos de diferentes colores, 10 metros de  tela toalla para los secadores, una docena de aplicaciones, 20 metros de pasa cintas, 3 unidades de cinta satinadas, y también mandará a reparar su máquina.

Clara con los préstamos que recibe por parte de Manuela Ramos apoya en la economía del hogar, su negocio crece, y está mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Clara Vásquez is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valientes” (Courageous Women).  She resides along Coronel Portillo Jr., in the District of Callería, Department of Ucayali.  Clara is 40 years old, married, and does not have children.  Her husband works as a mechanic.  With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, Sra. Clara began selling beauty products.

She also received training from Manuela Ramos in manicure services to complement her beauty product sales business.  Clara is also the founder of the Courageous Women Communal Bank.

The loan Clara will receive from Manuela Ramos is in the amount of 1800 PEN, which will be repaid in four monthly installments.  This money will increase her operating capital for her small business making bed linens and dish towels.  She will invest the funds in the following manner:  30 meters of fabric for making linens, 6 cones of thread in different colors, 10 meters of terry cloth for making dish towels, one dozen appliqués, 20 meters of fabric borders, and 3 units of glittering borders.  Clara will also send out her machine for repair.

With the loans from Manuela Ramos Clara will be able to support the household finances, grow her business, and improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Ervin Alexander

texts.es: Ervin tiene 35 años el se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, el vive con su familia en un municipio de Chichigalpa a pesar de que no tienen todas las comodidades el cada día se supera para proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. Además que sale todos los días a ofrecer los productos que el compra para ofrecerlo. El es joven muy ejemplar pues además es un buen hijo y padre al mismo tiempo a pesar de que recorre muchos lugares siempre está contento de ofrecer a sus clientes lo mejor en calidad. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como cremas, pinturas, ropa en general entre otras cosas. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y obtener otro medio de ingreso.
texts.en: Ervin is 35 years old and sells general merchandise. He has had this business for more than three years. He lives with his family in a town in Chichigalpa. Despite not having many amenities he strives every day to provide his family with the necessities. He goes out every day to offer the products he buys. He is an exemplary young man, he is a good son and father despite the fact that he has to travel to many places but he is always happy to offer his clients the best quality. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase supplies such as lotions, paints, clothing and other things. He dreams with improving his house and of obtaining another means of income.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bendetta

texts.en:
Bendetta is a married woman with five children, three of whom still attend school while two graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop for over four years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a taxi business which contributes to her other source of income. Bendetta hopes to run a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, sugar and peas for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its simple loaning procedures.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, rice, sugar and peas for resale.

loans.name: Julia Kenga

texts.en:
Julia Kenga M. is a 45-year-old woman from Mtwapa. She is a single mother of two children. Julia has been in the retail business for the past three years and runs a retail shop in Mtwapa. Her business is doing well. 

This is her second loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her shop. Julia has directed the anticipated profits to her children’s education. Her hope and dream is to own a horticultural business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn P., age 33, owns and oeprates a sari-sari (variety) shop, offering such daily-use products as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and snack foods for sale in her local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and it brings her approximately 7,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. 

Earlier this year, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase snack foods, biscuits, and other additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Emelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase snack foods, biscuits, and other additional products to sell

loans.name: Ananias

texts.es: Ananias, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de  su hijo Samuel (15), y habitan en una ciudad ubicada en la selva central peruana. Desde hace 20 años, se dedica a la siembra de café y plátanos, en sus terrenos propios los que después de mucho cuidado comercializa a buenos precios. Según afirma en su última cosecha, sembró maíz y obtuvo buenas ganancias de las ventas. Lo que le disgusta, son las constantes bajas de precio de sus productos en el mercado; pero a pesar de los inconvenientes, desea sembrar en mayores cantidades. Para el futuro tiene planeado dedicarse a la compra y venta de café, al por mayor, pues según dice ya tiene compradores en la ciudad de Pichanaki, y espera continuar progresando.Él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmas”, y este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como socio nuevo, espera trabajar con ahínco para el logro de los objetivos comunes del grupo.La limpieza de la maleza de los terrenos agrícolas es muy importante, por ello con el dinero del préstamo piensa invertir en la compra de herramientas,  además de varios sacos de abono, así espera mejorar su producción y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ananias is 49 years old.  He lives in his own home with his son Samuel (15).  They live in a town in the central Peruvian jungle.

Ananias has been growing coffee and bananas on his own land for 20 years.  He has cared for his land for a long time and, as a result, his crops now sell for a good price.  He says that his last harvest was corn and he made good profits from his sales.   What upsets Ananias is the constant lowering of prices for his products in the market.    However, in spite of these difficulties, he would like to grow his crops in larger quantities.  In the future, he plans to commit himself to buying and selling coffee wholesale as he says that he already has buyers in the city of Pichanaki and he hopes to continue making progress.

Ananias belongs to the "Las Palmas" community bank and this is his first loan with MFP.  As a new member, he hopes to work hard to achieve the common goals of the group.  Clearing the weeds from his farmland is very important to Ananias and, for this reason, he plans to use his loan money to invest in buying tools, as well as several sacks of manure.  In this way he hopes to improve his production and his profits.

loans.use: To buy tools and manure for his plantations

loans.name: Rubina Sadar Ali's Group

texts.en:
Rubina lives in Arifwala, a city in Pakistan famous for its agricultural business. She owns a two-room house in an area named Zia nagar where she lives with her family. Rubina is a talented lady who runs a sewing and tailoring business from her home. She sews clothes for neighborhood customers and her work supplements the family’s income. She is expert in her work and can easily sew designer and non-designer dresses. Her customers are very satisfied with her work and choose her over others. 

Rubina’s husband is S. A.. He is involved in a business selling spare motorbike parts. S. operates a shop in the market where he sells reasonably priced spare parts to generate income. Rubina has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy spare motorcycle parts to sell. 

Rubina is the woman in the photo holding the Asasah Passbook. She is hopeful that this loan will help expand her husband’s business and increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Sodnomdorj

texts.en:
Sodnomdorj, 49, is married and lives with his wife and two young daughters in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard on the outskirts of the city.

Sodnomdorj began to drive a microbus around the city, transporting passengers from one side of the city to the other, in 2005. His wife works with him as the conductor while he drives the bus. Sodnomdorj also started a raw materials sales business in 2007. He is a hardworking and honest person who says, "I would like to rebuild the engine and acquire some parts for the microbus in order to operate my public transportation business consistently and increase my profit." He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs for his current microbus.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Antonio I

texts.en:
Antonio I L. is 60 years old and has five adult children. He is from the village of Inasagan, Aurora Zamboaga del Sur. To make a living, Antonio owns and operates a business raising crops. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Antonio is just starting this business.

Antonio joined GDMPC in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Antonio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk,and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat, 32, lives with her husband and three children in a small city of Pakistan called Depalpur. Her home is located in the area named Abdullah Basti and contains two rooms. She came here eight years ago. Her children are young and haven’t started getting education yet. Nusrat takes care of them and also does her household responsibilities very well.
 
She is a business woman and runs a decorative embroidery business in her home for her neighboring clients. She learned this skill from her mother and became accomplished through regular practice. 
 
Her husband's name is M. B. and he operates a donkey cart. He puts different goods like construction supplies and fruits and vegetables on his cart and provides transportaton services to his clients. He has been operating this business for five years.
 
Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He will use the loan to buy a new cart because his old cart has become rough and rotten in different areas and needs a replacement. Nusrat hopes that her husband will be able to do his work better by purchasing a new cart. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior by paying her installments on time.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for her husband's loading business

loans.name: Pal

texts.en: Pal Y. is 49 years old, married, and has four single children, two of whom make a profit by working in various jobs while the other two are still studying. Pal Y. owns a small kiosk in her village in Kompong Tom province. She sells food such as Khmer noodles for people who need to have breakfast. She typically makes around $1 of profit each day to meet her family's needs. She has a life partner in her husband who is a local fisherman in and around the lake or river. Pal Y. will be using this Kiva loan to add to her personal savings to purchase a used motorbike for her children to travel to work. This loan will help her children to reduce their travel expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike for her children

loans.name: Teko Sanda Traders Group

texts.en:
Posseh K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Posseh was born in Makeni city, about 26 years ago. She is married to a soldier and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. Posseh sells rice, cigarettes, sweets, biscuits, etc. and has been in this business for four years now.

With the help of this loan, Posseh and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Posseh will use her share of the loan, 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL), to buy rice, cigarettes, sweets, and biscuits in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, cigarettes, sweets, and biscuits, in bulk

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz G. lives in the village of Dzalisi, Kartli region. He is 54 years old and lives with his wife, Tsisana. Teimuraz and Tsisana are actively involved in agricultural activities. They have three milk cows and sell dairy products locally. Also, Teimuraz has a shop of construction materials. The main product sold in the shop is cement. The total income of the family is 800 laris per month. 

With one part of the requested loan, Teimuraz plans to cultivate a plot of land and sow maize. The harvested corn will be sold locally. With the other part of the credit, Teimuraz will increase stock-in-trade in his shop. It will ensure flow of additional customers to the shop. In the future, Teimuraz plans to make some savings and invest in the further development of the dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay for a tractor for the cultivation of his land and to increase the stock-in-trade of his shop.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman who owns a house without electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past three years, Asha has operated a vegetable stall where she sells tomatoes, green vegetables, potatoes, and onions. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Asha’s major business challenge is the price fluctuation in her products. 

Asha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and bananas for resale. In the future, Asha dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 40 años de edad; La socia es conviviente;  La socia tiene 4 hijos de 17, 16, 8, 9 meses; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comidas elaboradas por ella misma, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia vende en el barrio de Santiago y desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas caceras, la socia comprara arroz al por mayor, fideos, aceite, verduras, carnes, huevos entre otros productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para elaborar comidas caceras.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the MADRES TRABAJADORAS community bank in Tica Tica, a town in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

She is 40 years old and partnered.  She has 4 children who are 17-years, 16-years, 8-years and 9-months old, respectively.  She manages to both care for her family and operate a business, selling prepared meals that she makes herself.  She works as a street vendor, selling what she makes in the town's Santiago neighborhood.  She is applying for a loan to buy the supplies she needs to make the meals she sells.  She will buy bulk supplies of rice, pasta and cooking oil, along with vegetables, meat, eggs, etc.  All the supplies will go to making food for her food sales business.

Our member is grateful to the bank for extending the loan and she is committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Susana; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, ella lo distribuye a todos los mercados del distrito de Urubamba, la fruta lo trae del distrito de Calca, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fruta como naranjas, plátanos, manzanas, uvas y mandarinas.  
                                                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the "Munay Tika" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Susana is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling fruit.  She distributes her products to all the markets in Urubamba district and buys her fruit in Calca district.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Susana would like to expand her fruit business.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruit such as oranges, bananas, apples, grapes and mandarins.

Susana is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as oranges, bananas, apples, grapes and mandarins

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 39-year-old married man who has four children that attend school.  He bakes and sells cakes to earn a living.  He has 10 years of experience in running the business.  He also farms to supplement his income.
  
Since Moses joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour for baking cakes.  

Moses hopes to own a big bakery and find other markets for selling cakes in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has two children, ages 2 and 6. He owns a butchery, selling meat to all types of customers in his community. Peter has been running this business for 10 years and employs 1 person. He intends to use this loan to purchase more materials to expand his business. 

Peter hopes to open up more branches one day. He describes himself as honest and obedient.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to expand his butchery

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a farmer and, at the same time, a business woman. She owns and operates a business selling fertilizers in her community. She has been in this type of business for over five years. Each month, she earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from the business.

Luciana is 58 years old and lives in Guingona, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of six adult dependents. 

Luciana has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Luciana hopes to expand her business and gain more profit for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Ricky has a shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ricky is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ricky hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has been making bricks and building houses for people in Olkalou town for the last 10 years. He is 53 years old and married to Loyce. They have two children who attend school.                                                                                                                       .

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be Simon's third loan. He has repaid his previous loans on time. He plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow so that he can diversify his sources of income.

In the future, Simon hopes to become a leading constructor in Olkalou and also to grow his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mburu

texts.en:
Mburu is 64 years old; he is married to Regina who is a farmer. They are blessed with two adult children aged 30 and 27 years old. He has been a mixed crop farmer for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mburu will use the loan to buy livestock for selling which will boost his farming business. 

He will use the anticipated profit as working capital in the farm. His hopes are to venture into dairy farming and continue with livestock selling.

loans.use: To buy livestock for selling which will boost his farming business.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is from the village of Gantiadi, South Georgia. He is 28 years old, married and lives with his wife Mzia, 5-year-old son, and 3-year-old daughter. 

Agriculture is the only source of the income for the family. The family has a small dairy farm with three milk cows. They sell milk to local dairy product retailers. Along with the dairy farm they own 0.5 hectare land, where potatoes are grown. Harvested potatoes are sold in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). 

Malkhaz requested credit for financing the harvesting process and harvest transportation costs. He will pay the owner of the tractor which will help him in harvesting potatoes, and the truck driver, who will take the harvested potatoes to Malkhaz’s store-house. Also, part of the credit (approximately 45%) will be used for purchasing wood, which will be used for the oven during the winter months. The oven is the only mean of heating the house in Malkhaz’s village during winter months. 

Malkhaz worked hard during the whole year. The weather conditions were favorable as well and he has good harvest this year. Malkhaz hopes that he’ll be able to sell it for a good price and earn planned profit, part of which will be used for the family's well-being and the other part will be reinvested in potato growing.

loans.use: to pay the tractor owner and truck driver for services provided in the potato harvesting process and to purchase wood to heat the house in the winter months.

loans.name: Xinh

texts.en:
Xinh is 47 years old and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have a business selling pork, which they started ten years ago. 
Because of capital shortage, Xinh often has to buy pork in smaller quantities at higher prices. She would like to take a loan that will help her to expand her business and buy larger quantities of pork at cheaper prices. As a result, she hopes to increase her family's income and create better opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy pork for resale.

loans.name: Tallevi

texts.fr:
Tallévi est une femme âgée de 27 ans,  elle est mariée à un menuiser. Elle a un enfant
Elle est revendeuse depuis 2007. 
Tallevi achète et revend pour sa clientèle composée de toutes personnes la friperie. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de Lomé. Elle est seule à exercer son activité. 
Elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de diverses friperies afin de satisfaire aux besoins de la clientèle
texts.en:
Tallévi is 27, married to a carpenter, and has one child. She has been a small-scale retailer since 2007. 

Tallevi buys used clothing and sells it to her varied clientele. She buys her goods at the local markets in  Lomé. She is the only one in her business. 

She is asking WAGES for  her first loan to buy various sorts of used clothing so as to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 24 years old and lives in the village of Geguti with his parents and two sisters, aged 31 and 28 years old, the eldest a hairdresser. The rest of the family is involved in family agricultural activities, using their greenhouse to grow greens from October through May, and cucumbers and tomatoes during the summer months. The harvested greens are sold to local wholesalers, while Otar sells the vegetables at the local open market. Total average monthly family income is 570 Laris (approximately 340 USD).

Otar has requested a loan to purchase wooden materials for the construction of a second greenhouse, an addition that will increase the income of the family, allowing them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Giselle Guadalupe

texts.es:
Giselle tiene 50 años y vive con su familia, en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo que es eminentemente urbano y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

En este momento los ingresos económicos de  Giselle son muy escasos, lo cual indica que sus  entradas de dinero no son suficientes para financiar la carrera de su hija.

Es por eso que Giselle está solicitando un crédito de 300,000.00 (trescientos mil colones), para pagar los estudios de su hijo. Ya que los miembros de la familia tienen sus expectativas futuras en él para asi una vida mejor.

Giselle es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su segundo préstamo con la Empresa y da muchas gracias por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Giselle is 50 years old and lives with her family in an urban residential community in the district of Hatillo.  The area is the object of increasing commercial activity, mainly shopping centers.  A great number of furniture shops, tortilla shops, bakeries, book stores, auto mechanics, gas stations, dentist offices, pharmacies, health centers, bars, restaurants, shops and printing companies are opening for business.

At the moment Giselle's income is scarce and she does not have enough money to pay for her son's college education.

Therefore she is requesting a loan in the amount of 300,000 CRC to pay for his tuition since the members of the family have high hopes for him and a better lifestyle.

Giselle is a member of the communal bank Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, one of the 110 communal loan companies belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.  It is her second loan through the institution and she is very grateful for all the support she has received.

loans.use: To pay for her son's college education.

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran is 29 years old, a farmer who is married and has three children.  He has five years of experience in cultivating seasonal fruits and vegetables. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. 

Kamran owns a large piece of land where he cultivates his crops, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects and high demand of customers, he is no longer able to satisfy market in an appropriate way. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy seeds and organic fertilizer. The loan will greatly improve Kamran’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 18 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Isaías, su esposo desde hace un año. Aunque no tienen hijos, ellos viven en armonía en casa de su madre, ubicada en el caserío de Tapo. Desde que falleció su padre, ella tuvo que trabajar para ayudar en los gastos del hogar por ello, todas las mañanas desde muy temprano sale a cuidar de sus sembríos de maíz y papa. Aunque formó su familia, ella continúa en esta labor, sobre todo porque le gusta mucho. Pero consiente que tiene que afrontar nuevas metas y responsabilidades. Comenzó a trabajar en la elaboración de leña. “Todo depende del tamaño del árbol”, afirma. Ya que su trabajo consiste en cortar la mayor cantidad de leña, en un árbol grande sale un promedio de 2 millares de leña, pero si son chiquitas solo ochocientas unidades; cada millar lo vende a un promedio de 200 soles. Eso le ayuda a ella a solventar algunos gastos. Pero su mayor objetivo es juntar dinero para adquirir su casa propia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa Rosa” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Julia, de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de palos secos para realizar leña.
texts.en:
Julia, 18, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Isaías, her husband of one year.  Although they don’t have children they live in harmony in her mother’s house located in the Tapo settlement.  Since her father died, she’s had to work to help with household expenses.  Therefore, she rises daily very early in the morning to care for her corn and potato crops.  Although she’s formed her family she continues with this work above all because she likes it very much. But, aware that she must face new goals and responsibilities she started to work making firewood.  “Everything depends on the size of the tree,” she affirms.  Because her work consists primarily in cutting most of the wood, a large tree results in about 2000 pieces of firewood on average but if the trees are small, only 800 units.  She sells each bundle of 1000 units for about 200 soles on average.  This helps her meet some of her expenses.  But her overriding goal is to save enough money to buy her own house.

She belongs to the “Santa Rosa” communal bank and this is the first MFP loan where she hopes for your cooperation to make her plans a reality.  She likes being part of her association because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  If Julia were to receive your support, she will invest the requested funds in the purchase of dry branches to make firewood.

loans.use: to buy dry branches to make firewood.

loans.name: Menn

texts.en:
Menn is a weaver. Her husband, Savoeun sells cotton and silk fabrics. He buys these fabrics from a weaver in the village, and he transports the fabrics to sell in other provinces.

Menn and her husband have been married since 1979 and have one son and three daughters. One is married and lives in a separate home, and the others have full-time employment. They live in Kbal Kosh, an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Menn is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for her son to get work. 

Photo: Menn and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Sonia Maricela

texts.es:
La joven Sonia Maricela tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el barrio la Providencia de la ciudad de Choluteca, ahi vive con su esposo y sus hijos,  Sonia  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada clasificada, tiene muchos clientes ya que la ropa que vende es de buena calidad y la vende a un precio accesible, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un fardo de ropa.
Sonia dia a dia trabaja muy fuerte para hacer crecer su negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia Maricela is a young woman of 25 who lives in La Providencia neighborhood, in the city of Choluteca.  She lives there with her husband and children.  Sonia sells pre-sorted used clothing.  She has many customers as the clothes she sells are good quality and she sells them at affordable prices.  She will use her loan to buy a bundle of clothes.

Sonia works very hard every day to grow her business so that she can offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes

loans.name: Mbiti

texts.en: Mbiti is a 24-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is three years old. He is a sociable and talkative man. He operates a retail store where he sells spare parts. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are motorcycle drivers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more spare parts. His business goal is to be  a supplier of motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Danilo tiene la edad de 45 años, siendo  casado y con dos hijos menores a los que debe de brindarle el bienestar. Su esposa es ama de casa y una mujer muy preocupada por el bienestar de la familia. Él trabaja como conductor en una empresa en el departamento de Granada y de esta manera se gana el pan de cada día para beneficio familiar.
 
El señor Oscar Danilo, está necesitando realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda por lo que el crédito lo solicita  para la compra de materiales de construcción, como zinc, cemento, piedra, arena y ladrillo. 

De este modo, el sueño de Oscar será cumplido y así logrará tener una vivienda que preste las condiciones oportunas para habitar.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo is 45 years old, and married with two children who he must provide for. His wife is a housewife and looks after the family. He works as a driver for a company based in the province of Granada and earns the daily bread for his family.
 
Oscar needs to make some improvements to his home, and has requested this loan to purchase construction materials such as zinc, cement, stone, sand and brick.

The loan will help Oscar to fulfil his dream of improving the house and providing suitable living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase cement, stone, sand, zinc, and brick to improve his home.

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en: Ms Luyen is 35 years old with three children who are school age. She has a small restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch. Her business has operated for five years and has created good revenue for her family.  Participating in our credit program in 2010, she used loans effectively in her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan to buy more furniture for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more furniture for her restaurant.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and gay. Richard has a beauty shop or parlor that provides make-up or beautification to customers. He also buys and sells jewelry like necklaces and bracelets. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan of 10,000 to buy materials and tools for the beauty salon.

Richard has been a member of HSPFI for since 2009. In the future, Richard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for a beauty salon

loans.name: Giribanga Group

texts.fr:
Consolate fait partie du groupe  Giribanga et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 36 ans et est mariée à Marc, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants dont  4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de la bière de banane depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière de banane, à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Consolate is a member of the Giribanga group and lives in Gitega. She is 36 and married to a farmer named Mark. They have six children, four of whom attend school.

She has been selling banana beer for three years.

This is her second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer for resale to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard used his previous loan to buy buy general merchandise such as sugar and maize to sell. He is a 34-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is still operating a retail shop, with the income, he has been able to restock his business and  pay school fees for his children. His still faces hardships of high taxes. Nevertheless, he intends to work hard and to attain his goals of expanding his business to new markets and buying land to grow crops. 

Richard is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar, salt, sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar, salt, sodas to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce K. joined Life in Africa in August of 2005. She is a very happy and dedicated member who loves what is happening at LiA and all the opportunities that are made available to people just like her. She is currently working in the Invisible Children Bracelet project creating bracelets and this has greatly improved the lives of her family by providing a steady source of income.

She has a large family and this means that the needs are also large. Her younger brother lives with her and together they have come up with a good plan to increase their income. Their plan is to purchase a motorcycle which her brother will operate as a a bodaboda (for hire). Transport is very needed in Kampala and bodaboda drivers can do quite well.

The money earned from this business will help the family but Joyce also realizes that as a young man, her brother also needs to have some money of his own. They have agreed that one day a week he will keep the money as his salary which will allow him to start saving for the time when he will have his own home and life. The family has already saved 500,000 towards this project. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to add to this to make the purchase. She will be able to repay this loan in 8 months.

She wants to pay this loan in a period of 8 months and her income verses expenses is Ushs.190,000

She saves Ushs. 50,000 per month and remains with Ushs. 140,000.

WE Team to Benefit: Internet4change

loans.use: Buying a Motorcyle for hire commonly known as boda-boda.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: A mother of five she joined SPBD in 2004 to get financial support to help her husband earn enough to improve their standard of living. Isa’s particular reason for joining was to get funding to help put her skills to good use earning money that could pay for her children’s school fees. Isa is a talented mother who loves gardening and produces Samoan oil made by Mosooi blossoms and coconut. Although Isa’s education is limited to basic studies in the secondary level she believes that education for her children is the one greatest opportunity that will broaden their horizons and also open doors that she never has. Her first loan funded for a vegetable garden. Her other loans helped her pay for her children’s school fees. She intends to expand the production of her Samoan oil so that her additional earnings can be used later on to fund a water system for her house. There is no existing water supply for her house.

loans.use: Purchase additional ingredients for Samoan oil (mossoi blossoms and coconut oil), bottles, labelling.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
For the past three years, Svetlana has been building a small shoe sales business at a good location in the large central market in Kharkiv. An outgoing, enthusiastic entrepreneur, she started her business because she wanted to be self-employed and help support her family. Svetlana’s average daily income is around $10 to $20 per day. Her business is currently the main source of income for her and her husband and their fourteen year old daughter.

Svetlana credits much of the growth of her business to funding she has received from Nadiya Ukraine. She is excited to expand further and would eventually like to open a second kiosk, which would significantly boost her returns from the business. Svetlana has requested a loan for $1200 that will allow her to purchase a good selection of seasonal shoe styles for spring and summer. She is hoping to take advantage of this busy time of year and increase her sales after the long winter.

На протязі останніх трьох років Світлана займається бізнесом з продажу взуття на центральному ринку м. Харків. Вона – дуже комунікабельна та завзята. Бізнесом почала займатися тому, що хотіла працювати на себе та підтримувати родину. Денний заробіток Світлани зараз складає приблизно 20 доларів. Її бізнес – головне джерело прибутку для усієї родини. Ростом свого бізнесу Світлана зобов’язана позикам, які вона отримала від „Надії України”. Вона дуже хоче розвиватися й надалі, в майбутньому планує відкрити другий кіоск, вважає, що це сприятиме отриманню додаткових прибутків. Світлана просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб закупити різноманітне стильне сезонне взуття напередодні весняного та літнього сезонів. Вона сподівається, що покупців буде багато, а це, в свою чергу, сприятиме підвищенню обсягів продажу після довгої зими.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar K. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 3 years. She has been in business for no less than 9 years. She is married and has 3 children.
