Regina uses the income she gets from her sales to help her husband to take care of the family. The loan is going to help her to expand her food business. She plans to put up a better structure where she can sell her food.

loans.use: To expand her food business.

loans.name: Santigie A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is pleased to present to you teachers of the Government Technical Institute in Magburaka town, northern Sierra Leone. This institution was founded in 1962 by the government to train youths in technical and vocational education. The institute is staffed with nineteen teachers and has 300 students. 

This is the third loan that Government Technical Institute is requesting from Kiva through SMT. With their previous SMT/Kiva lenders loans, some of these teachers started small businesses. Some invested their loans in an already existing business. Some bought pieces of furniture, some bought house-building materials, some paid school fees for their children, and so on and so forth. With the help of this new loan, they will be able to once again do or invest in something bigger than their mere salaries alone will allow.

Santigie A. T. is the leader of this group of teachers. Santigie was born in a place call Makeh. He is married and has three children – two adults and one in secondary school. Santigie has had eleven years of experience in the teaching profession. In addition to his teaching, Santigie is also a farmer. He has requested a loan of SLL 2,000,000 in order to buy seeds to plant in his farm.

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant in his farm

loans.name: Joyas Del Pacífico Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Joyas del Pacífico” se conforma por 18 emprendedoras y un emprendedor, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. Sus negocios son principalmente venta de ropa, lencería, mariscos, bebidas con y sin alcohol, huevos, productos Avon, empanadas, pan amasado y almacenes. 
Jacqueline trabaja en peluquería, haciendo cortes de pelo, tinturas, masajes, visos y peinados. Atiende generalmente a domicilio y algunas veces en un espacio que adapta para la ocasión en el living de su casa. Este trabajo lo realiza todos los fines de semana, ya que además durante la semana vende comida rápida, en la casa de una hermana, junto a su hija mayor, quien también forma parte del grupo, y otra compañera. El trabajo de peluquería lo realiza desde hace 1 año y medio, luego de terminar un curso del tema. 
Con este préstamo Jacqueline comprará una máquina desvelladora (sirve para las terminaciones de los cortes de pelo), un delantal de peluquera, agua oxigenada, tinturas y cremas de pelo, entre otros insumos  y lo que quede del dinero será para comprar alimentos para su otro negocio. 
A Jacqueline le han sido un importante apoyo los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, al igual que los talleres de administración de negocios, ya que ahora puede llevar un orden de lo que gasta y de lo que gana en sus negocios. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
The “Joyas del Pacífico” (Jewels of the Pacific) community bank has 18 female entrepreneurs and 1 male entrepreneur.  It is located in the city of Valparaíso.  The members businesses include selling clothes, underwear, seafood, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, eggs, Avon products, empanadas, 'pan amasado' (a type of Chilean bread), and running stores.

Jacqueline is a hairdresser.  She cuts and colors hair, provides massages, facials and hairdos.  She generally works in other people's homes but also sometimes in a space which she adapted for this purpose in her living room.  She does her work every weekend because during the week she sells fast food in one of her sister's houses, together with her older sister, who is also a member of the group, and another friend.  She has been doing the hairdressing work for one and a half years after she finished a course on the topic.

Jacqueline will use this loan to buy clippers (which are used to finish off hair cuts), a hairdressing cape, hydrogen peroxide, dyes and hair creams, amongst other supplies.  What she has left over she will use to buy food for her other business.

Fondo Esperanza's loans have been an important source of support for Jacqeline, as have the business management workshops, since she can now keep records of what she spends and what she makes in her business.

Valparaíso is 120 kilometers north-west of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and also the seat of the country's legislative power.  It is the most important port in the nation and offers a large variety of beautiful and picturesque places such as, for example, the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: To buy hair clippers and food

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita G. is from the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Angelita is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Angelita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Angelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and junk foods. This will be the first loan taken out by Angelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Leonor Isabel

texts.es:
Leonor es una madre D. familia que tiene 49 años D. edad y que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una zona urbano marginal D. la ciudad D. Lambayeque, una zona comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en un ambiente D. su vivienda. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. consumo diario tratando siempre D. brindar un trato amable. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a mantener los gastos económicos familiares.

Debido a que Leonor siempre brinda a sus clientes una atención D. buena calidad, su negocio actualmente cuenta con clientela estable. Ella desea adquirir más productos para satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Leonor is a 49-year-old mother.  She lives with her husband and children in an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Lambayeque, a commercial area that is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works selling basic-needs products and groceries in a store installed in her house.  She offers her clients different daily consumer products while always trying to offer friendly service.  She uses the income she receives from her job to help her husband with the family expenses.

Since Leonor always offers her clients good quality service, her business currently has a stable clientele. She would like to get more products to satisfy the demand that she has.  Therefore, she has decided to apply for a loan of 2000 PEN with Edpyme Alternative with which she hopes to reach her goal.

loans.use: Purchase more products to satisfy the demand she has.

loans.name: Muhamamd

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Ramallah. He is 24 years old, Muhammad runs an internet cafe beside a small workshop for computer maintenance in the same place. Muhammad has been running the shop for a couple of years and he wants to improve it by painting the shop and bringing in better desks.

Muhammad, who is photographed here, took a loan from FATEN to apply the needed improvements.

loans.use: Improve an internet cafe and computer maintenance shop

loans.name: Leuk's Group

texts.en:
Six people are forming a group loan; they are located in Champuh K'aek village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Leuk L. was born in 1970, and she is a group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She is a laborer. Her husband, Mr. Bun Voek, works as a construction worker. With their occupations, they are able to earn a little income to support their family.  Mrs. Leuk L. is asking for a loan to buy medicine for a family member who is unwell. 

This couple has three children: one is a laborer, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy medicine for health.

loans.name: Recsalde

texts.en:
Recsalde C. is from the village of Malaigang, Wao, Lanao del Sur. He is 42 years old. Recsalde is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Recsalde owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal (taxi) services to local community members. Recsalde has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Recsalde joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recsalde is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Recsalde from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana B. is from the village of Malibago. She is 33 years old, married and has 1 infant child. Cresenciana operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cresenciana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase feed for her pigs. Cresenciana is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store and to purchase feed for her pigs. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Cresenciana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for sale and to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum S. is a 62-year-old widowed mother caring for six children. All four of the children who are still living in the family home are employed in different jobs. 

She makes a profit by cultivating a rice crop on her own farmland, which came from her grandparents years ago. 

Chhum S. has a son who is a recycling seller. He buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electricity wires. 

Chhum S. is looking for a loan for her son to buy a used motorcycle for picking his items up. This will enable him to purchase more used goods and increase his profit.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her son's recycling business

loans.name: Sandra Maribel

texts.es: Sandra Maribel:de 32 años ella tiene una tienda de venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,ella tiene barios años de dedicarse a ete negocio,ella nos cuenta que le a ido bien porque poco a poco e mejorado su ganancia,pero en esta ocacion ella solicita este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera necesidad como por ejemplo,azucar,maiz,frijol,golocinas,aguas gaseosas,etc, para poder tener mas bariedad en su tienda ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes,desea agrandar mas su tienda y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sandra Maribel is 32 years old.  She has a store where she sells basic needs food products.  She has had this business for several years.  She tells us that it has gone well for her because, little by little, she has improved her income.

She is now requesting this loan to buy basic needs food products like sugar, corn, beans, sweets, and carbonated water, etc.  She will do this in order to have a greater variety of products in her store.  There is a lot of customer demand, and she wants to expand her store and have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy basic needs food items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary J. is 29 years old, married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She currently sells ice cream.

Mary took a loan to stock more ice cream to sell. She hopes to open up a big shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more Ice cream to sell

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married with two grown-up children. She owns a small bakery located in a village close to Ivano-Frankivsk city. Eleven years ago she lost her job of pastry-cook because the company she worked for closed. Vera decided to start working on her own.
Vera was able to purchase an old building and turn it into a bakery. Absence of competitors enabled Vera's business to grow fast. She still owns the only bakery in this village. This is a family business that brings in a stable income. Vera would like to borrow 15,000 Ukrainian Hryvnias (UAH) to purchase five tons of flour. She will use it in her bakery over several months.

loans.use: to purchase five tons of flour.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 27 year-old Mohamed. He is married and has two children, ages 4 and 7 years old. In 2003, Mohamed established his coffee/tea drink business. He began his business because he needed a source of income to support family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy coffee/tea items by cartons. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to open a restaurant, hire workers (trained staff) and promote his children to higher institution. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks for his business.

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Bunthoeun is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Neang, is a cleaner for a company. They have three sons and five daughters. Three are married and live in separate homes, one is a garment factory worker and the others are in school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Bunthoeun is asking for a loan of $1,200 to build a concrete brick room.

loans.use: To build a concrete brick room.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a fifty-five-year-old single mother of three living in a rented house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family solely rests on her and her desire is to build a house and educate her children.

She has been selling clothes for two years after diverting from the selling of fresh food where she earned her initial capital. She faces the challenge of limited capital but has big plans of owning a boutique. Edith needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: The Star Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “The Star” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Hadiatu is the leader of this group. The 35-year-old is a widow with 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 not of school-going age. Hadiatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells slippers/flip-flops. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy dozens of slippers to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of slippers to add to her business

loans.name: Rosauro

texts.en: Rosauro is 69 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of two adult-age dependents. Rosauro has a retail shop at home to earn a living. She sells personal products, food ingredients, and assorted food products. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 10,000 from these activities. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell. Rosauro has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Rosauro hopes to expand her retail shop and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, age 50, earns a living by selling deliciously cooked meat dishes in her "carenderia." She has a passion for cooking and has been engaged in her business for the past five years. She earns PHP 7,000 monthly. Veronica and her husband have five grown children and live in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.

Veronica has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000.00 from GDMPC in order to buy materials to repair her display area and to purchase additional food processing items. She joined GDMPC in 2008. 

Veronica hopes to boost her income by owning and operating a food stall in the marketplace.

loans.use: to repair her display area and to purchase additional food processing items

loans.name: Abd Alrahman

texts.en:
Abd Alrahman is a 26-year-old man, who recently got married. 

Four years ago Abd Alrahman opened a shop to sell frozen goods such as meat, chicken, fish, etc. He even has the equipment to prepare the goods in any shape the customer wants (slices, chopped, etc.). And from his income, he was able to get married on his own and start a family. 

Now Abd Alrahman has applied for this loan in order to improve his store and open another branch in another area as an expansion of his business.

loans.use: to improve his store and open another branch to expand his business.

loans.name: Akouewegnigbeto Group

texts.fr: AKOUEWEGNIGBETO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Adjarath(qui a la main levée sur la photo),est âgée de 22 ans et est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a deux enfants à leur charge. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisé. Adjarath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Adjarath n'a jamais été à l'école.Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Adjarath mène comme activité la vente des fruits. Parallèlement à cela Adjarath vend des ustensiles de cuisine. Adjarath s'approvisionne au Bénin.C'est la troisième fois que, Adjarath et les autres membres du groupe AKOUEWEGNIGBETO sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur capacité financière et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AKOUEWEGNIGBETO is a group of three persons who all live together in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Adjarath (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 22  and married to Louis. The couple are raising two children. Neither of the children is enrolled in school. Adjarath  lives together with her husband and children. 

Adjarath never attended school. To support herself and her family, she sells fruit. In addition to that, she sells kitchen utensils. She buys her merchandise in Bénin. This is the third time that Adjarath and the other members of the group called AKOUEWEGNIGBETO are asking for a loan from ALIDé in order to expand their financial capacity and better meet the demand of their clientele. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy fruit, plastics, and coolers.

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Yolanda Isabel tiene 55 años. Ella está casada junto a su esposo Tienen 1 hijo mayor de edad. La actividad económica es venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con productos como ropa interior entre otros con el paso del tiempo fue que Yolanda logro ampliarse, por lo que decide incursionar comprando más mercadería. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, brillos, sombras, polvos, tratamientos, cremas, perfumes. El sueño de Yolanda es diversificar en sus productos.
texts.en: Yolanda Isabel is 55.  She is married and has a grown up son.  Her economic activity is the sale of cosmetics, she has done this for more than 20 years.  She started selling products such as lingerie, with time Yolanda was able to expand and decided to buy more merchandise.  The loan requested is for working capital to buy lipstick, nailpolish, gloss, eye-shadow, powder, face treatments, lotion and perfumes.  Yolanda's dream is to diversify the products.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, nailpolish, gloss, eye-shadow, powder, face treatments, lotion and perfumes

loans.name: Rafayil

texts.en: Rafayil is a gentleman who has dedicated himself to the business of farming and raising livestock for the past four years. He is married and has three children. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them and resells them in several months at a profitable price. His wife actively helps him in looking after the cattle. The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this simple reason he is seeking a 1,000 AZN loan to obtain cattle to sell.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 33-year-old businessman who is married and has one child. For the last year, he has made a living by driving a van. He has done well because he is determined to succeed and to expand his business. Paul also supplements his income by raising cows, and is applying for a loan for 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a new cow so that he can produce and sell more milk.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is divorced and has 5 children. Theresa sells drinks at Kufur near Elmina, which she has done for 12 years. She also sells red-peppers (on the floor in the photo). It has not been easy as a single parent having to take care of 5 children and so Theresa needs a loan to expand her business to be able to take care of her family. The loan will be used to procure drinks to sell.

loans.use: to procure drinks to sell

loans.name: Flora Marina

texts.es:
La señora Flora Marina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 36 años quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla desde hace 6 años negocio la cual inicio con unos ahorros. Ella tiene tres hijos de 18, 16 y 11 años los cuales estudian y le ayudan en el negocio.
Ella invertirá el crédito en maíz y leña para el negocio. Su meta es salir adelante levantar su casa y taller.
texts.en: Señora Flora Marina is a very hardworking and enterprising woman of 36 years of age. She has been selling tortillas for the last 6 years, a business she started with her savings. She has 3 children, 18, 16 and 11 years of age, who study and help her with the business. She will invest the loan in corn and firewood for the business. Her goal is to get ahead and improve her business and household.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna Elizabeth, de 39 de edad, casada desde hace 17 años, vive en una aldea rural de Santa Bárbara, tiene un hijo de 15 años quien esta estudiando. Su esposo realiza trabajos de construcción adicional a la agricultura.
Doña Mirna, muy trabajadora, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la producción de café, y vende el café en pergamino húmedo. Le dedica el tiempo necesario a esta actividad. Toda su familia se dedica a producir café, pues donde ellos viven es una zona apta para esta producción y además la venta de café esta siendo un negocio muy rentable en el país.
Este préstamo es el primero que solicita y es para invertirlo en la siembra de café, incrementando el área de producción y  para cubrir gastos de mantenimiento.
Su plan es seguir ampliando el área de producción para generar mas ingresos y ayudar con la educación de su hijo y apoyo a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna Elizabeth is 39 years old, and she has been married for 17 years.  She lives in a rural village in Santa Bárbara.  She has a 15 year old son who goes to school.  Her husband does construction work in addition to farming.

Mirna is a very hard-worker.  She has worked for 15 year producing and selling wet parchment coffee.  She devotes the necessary time to this business activity.  All of her family produces coffee.  The area where they live is suitable for this production.  Also, selling coffee is currently a very profitable business in the country.

This is the first loan that she has requested.  It is to be used to grow coffee, to increase the area of production, and to cover maintenance costs.

Her plan is to continue expanding the production area in order to generate more income, to help with her son’s education, and to support her family.

loans.use: to grow coffee and for maintenance expenses.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Cooperativa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS DE COOPERATIVA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Adela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pescado, venta de plásticos, internet, reciclado de plástico, comercio, tienda, venta de desayuno.

La señora Adela,  indica que hace seis meses trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de promotores. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pescado) que comprara de las personas que le traen de provincia  y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "VICUÑITAS DE COOPERATIVA" will begin its second cycle in the Pro Mujer program, which is run by the German Busch social center.  The group is comprised of eight members and is chaired by Mrs. Adela.  The communal bank's members are involved in different businesses, among which are: fish sales, plastic sales, internet services, recycled plastic, commerce, a store, and breakfast food sales.

Mrs. Adela has been working with Pro Mujer for six months and she joined through an invitation from one of the promoters.  She has a fish selling business  that she has been in for several years.  She learned the trade from her mother.

The loan she is requesting is to increase working capital to buy fish from the salespeople coming to the province.  She later sells it at her stall.  Through her work she is able to generate income to cover family expenses, since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she says it's the Health area.

loans.use: To buy fish.
